BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: An

texts.en: Mrs. An A., 41, lives in Chambak village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder, selling pigs to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phen Mong, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support the family. They face a problem because Mr. Phen Mong’s field is infertile and is far from the irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. An A. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide and to rent a plowing machine to plow the field. Mrs. An A. is the mother of three children: one is a clothes seller and the others are studying at the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en: Kyrgyzstan is undergoing extensive political and economic changes and the latest developments in the country have led to great economic crisis. In this situation, many international agencies are providing help to relieve the effects of these events, but still there is a large number of refugees and homeless people. The Government is incapable of providing all the necessary support and financial help. In this situation any help would be significant, especially for people who have lost their shops and now are facing the cruel reality of starting everything all over again. Aizada O. is thirty-seven and is married with two children. Her son and daughter are eighteen and fifteen years old respectively and both of them are unemployed. Aizada and her husband are engaged in farming, growing vegetables to sell in the local market. Three years ago they bought a cow and started breeding cattle and, since then, their main source of income has come from selling their cattle as there appears to be a need for that. Aizada has applied for this loan to purchase more cattle to increase the total population. She would like to have more cattle and, for this reason, she is planning to double her efforts. Aizada’s partners are: Rozakan T., 44, is currently building a new shop. She used to trade in a small shop but now she wants to make it bigger to attract more customers. Rozakan hopes to obtain this loan and expand the assortment of her goods. Kuluipa A., 49, has two children. She and her husband are engaged in selling cattle. They used to raise and sell cattle, but then they just started buying cattle and reselling them as it also brought a good income. Now Kuluipa needs a loan to purchase some more cattle. Toktobu S., 23 is single and works as a PC operator. She lives in a village and wants to obtain a good college education so that she will be able to go to the capital and find better employment. She hopes to obtain this loan and apply for college to get a degree in economics. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is married and has six dependents. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a security man.

Adwoa sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and also cracks stones in Abura for building constructors. She uses the income she makes from cracking stones to support her husband in taking care of her family.

Adwoa will use the loan to order more stones to crack for her demanding customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to change her business.

loans.use: To order more stones to crack for her demanding customers

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam R. has been in the farming business for years. She plants rice crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Sam R. has been married for years and has five teenage children. Two are employed at a garment factory in Phnom Penh and the other three are going to school. The coming heavy rainfall is good for growing; Sam R. is looking for assistance in order to help support her in the farm business. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To help support her in the farm business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Oneida Concepción

texts.es:
Oneida P. es una mujer muy empresaria que desde hace muchos años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la que ha recibido ocho financiamientos;   Oneida es muy destacada por su amabilidad, buena fe y capacidad de asesorar a las personas,  lo cual hace que quien la conozca la aprecie, especialmente  sus clientes, porque ella tiene un negocio donde vende vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, que inició buscando la oportunidad de obtener ingresos sin descuidar a sus hijos; así fue como “regando pequeños artículos, que compraba en promoción y con descuentos,  entre vecinos y familiares llegó a consolidar su actividad comercial. Gradualmente su disciplina y buen manejo de la inversión permitió el aumento de sus ingresos y la oportunidad de hacer créditos con la Fundación y en la actualidad obtener un credikiva, para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, calzado, jeans y en general ropa femenina y masculina, que ella tiene encargada porque se acerca  el día del amor y la amistad y sus clientes quieren vestirse elegante y obsequiar detalles para llenar de alegría a su pareja y a las personas que aman.
Con su negocio ha podido influir en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su hogar, así como ayudó a adecuar su vivienda, que al principio fue un lote y hoy tiene una casa completa que día a día intenta mejorar ;  Oneida vive en un barrio del sur de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 25 años; con los financiamientos de la Fundación Oneida ha logrado educarlos, uno de ellos ya es tecnólogo y el otro cursa una carrera universitaria; y es que su principal sueño, es el que sus hijos lleguen a profesionalizarse muy bien,  para que sean competitivos en el mercado laboral.
Su desafío mas relevante es la recuperación de su cartera constantemente, pero ella  siempre está pendiente de asumir nuevas estrategias para conseguir los mejores clientes y proteger su capital.
texts.en:
Oneida P. is a very entrepreneurial woman who for many years has been associated with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organisation from which she has received eight loans. Oneida is well known for her friendly, trustworthy and accessible nature, which means that she is well liked, particularly by her customers as she has a clothes-selling business for ladies, men and children. Oneida started her business as she was looking for something that would increase her earnings whilst still being able to care for her children. Oneida grew her business by “selling small items”, which she had bought on offer or discount, to neighbours and family members. Gradually, her perseverance, able management, and loans from the Fundación allowed her to increase her income. This current loan from credikiva will be used to buy blouses, footwear, jeans and general men’s, women’s and children’s clothing for the purposes of Valentine’s Day, which is coming up and people wish to look nice and buy gifts for their partners and loved ones. Oneida’s business has allowed her to improve her standard of living and turn her home into a pleasant environment. Initially her house started out as a plot of land but has gradually been improved upon. Oneida lives in a neighbourhood in the south of Barranquilla with her two children ages 21 and 25 years. She has managed to put her children through school using the loans provided by the Fundación. One of her children is a technician and the other is studying at a university. Oneida’s dream is for her children to become fully professional in order to be able to compete in the job market. Oneida’s most notable challenge is to continue to make ends meet but she is always keen to adopt new strategies to be able to build her client base and protect her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, footwear, jeans and general men and women's attire as Valentine's Day is approaching

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty Bwanika is a 46-year-old mother of four, and her computer services business has been in existence for the last 7 years in Prison zone-Mpigi. She mostly offers computer training and photocopying services. This business, she says, was begun with encouragement from her husband. Betty also owns poultry and rental enterprises. Profits from these two businesses help her cover her basic home expenses. By her own account, she makes 200,000 shillings in a week. With this loan, she wants to buy necessary computer materials that she will be using to improve her services.

loans.use: To purchase more computer materials

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme de 33 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il fait la vente de maïs, il procède en remplissant des bidons jaunes de maïs, ainsi la marchandise est plus facile à déplacer. il fait ce commerce depuis 2007. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Notsè. actuellement il fait face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un  crédit qui est son premier crédit pour acheter une vingtaine de sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a 33 year old man, he is married and he is the father of 3 children. He sells corn. He fills yellow containers full of corn to facilitate transportation of his product. He has had the business since 2007. He makes his purchases in the interior of the country, in the city of Notse. He has currently sold out his stock and he requests a loan to purchase more. This is his first loan and he will use it to purchase twenty sacks of corn.


kodjo est un homme de 33 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il fait la vente de maïs, il procède en remplissant des bidons jaunes de maïs, ainsi la marchandise est plus facile à déplacer. il fait ce commerce depuis 2007. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Notsè. actuellement il fait face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un  crédit qui est son premier crédit pour acheter une vingtaine de sacs de maïs.

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children, one of whom is in school.  Aisha runs her business from a food stall. She has been in this business for over fifteen years and she works seven days a week. She sells her products for retail prices at the market.    

Aisha has requested a loan of 450,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of tomatoes, bags of cassava and both sweet and Irish potatoes.  The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers.   Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of 3 school-aged children. He has many years of experience working as a sanitary man repairing toilets, faucets etc. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. In addition, He takes home projects and finalizes all the sanitary work on it.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business level and to purchase new repairing tools needed for his business purposes. He has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas and he needs to be equipped with all the materials needed. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open a small sanitary shop. He will provide the project entrepreneurs with the materials and the manual labor.

loans.use: To purchase new repairing tools.

loans.name: Gulaikan's Group

texts.en:
Gulaikan S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. Gulaikan is 48 and married. In order to earn a living, her husband works in construction. Together they are raising two sons and a daughter.  Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Gulaikan started to cultivate strawberries.  She also breeds cattle to earn more money. 

Gulaikan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay in order to feed her cattle during the winter season. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace L. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Grace is widowed. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making wedding foods, such as cakes and pastries, for the local community. Grace has been operated her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and her business. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Grace is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make cakes and pastries. This loan will be the fifth taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make cakes and pastries

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 36 años, es muy empeñosa y le gusta hacer bien su trabajo, es madre de 2 hijas, y vive con su esposo, en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 6 años, Flor se dedica al tejido y bordado de chompas. Los meses de mayor trabajo para ella, es de mayo a noviembre, ya que es temporada de invierno, asimismo tiene mucha demanda del extranjero; es por ello que le presta toda su atención y concentración a esta actividad. Día a día Flor trabaja muy contenta en su labor y lo que más le gusta es que lo realiza en la comodidad de su casa, sin descuidar de sus hijas ni de su hogar. Para el futuro tiene pensado incursionar en la venta de comida, por ello desea tener su restaurante. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil para el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de lana e hilos en variados colores, asimismo mandará hacer puertas y ventanas para mejorar su casa y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 36 years old, very earnest and enjoys doing a good job.  She is the mother of two daughters and lives with her husband and parents-in-law.  Since she was six years old Flor has been knitting and making embroidered jackets.  Most of her work is between May and November since it is the winter season.  She receives many orders from overseas so she is very careful to pay full attention and concentrate on her work.

Flor is very happy to be able to work out of the comfort of her home where she can attend to her daughters and household chores.  She has future plans to go into the food selling business and would like to open a restaurant.  

This is the ninth loan she has requested through MFP and she is fully committed to making the payments on time, considering the loan to be very helpful in growing her business.  She will use the loan to buy wool and yarn in different colors; and also plans to install doors and windows in order to mprove her home and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wool and yarn, and to have doors and windows put in her house

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo es casado, tiene un bebe; es una pareja muy joven y viven en casa de los padres de Abelardo durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es maestro albañil; trabaja en obras de construcción  de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposa le ayuda realizando trabajos de ayudante de albañilería en las mismas obras que su esposo. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para sanear los papeles de un terreno el cual ellos adquirieron, donde planean construir su casa  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Abelardo is married and has a baby.  He and his wife are a very young couple and they have been living in Abelardo's parents' house for a long time, in Lloteja district, in the city of La Paz.

Abelardo is a master builder.  He does construction work in the southern area of the city of La Paz .  His wife helps him, carrying out work as an assistant builder on the same projects as her husband.  This is how they make income for their household.

Abelardo will use his loan to clear up the title on a plot of land that they have acquired, where they plan to build their house.  This will enable them to improve their quality of life.,

This is Abelardo's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of putting in order the transfer papers for a plot of land

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam B. is a 55-year-old woman who lives in the province of Kompong Thom. She has no life partner, because she divorced her husband many years ago. She lives with seven children. Three children are single, and the other four are married. Sam B. earns a living by planting various crops on her own farmland. Currently, Sam B. wants to plant a potato crop, but she has no funds to do it. To solve this problem, Sam B. will use her loan to plant a potato crop.

loans.use: To plant a potato crop

loans.name: Abed Elhassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has six children.

Abed has a lot of experience in repairing electronics such as refrigerators and freezers. In 2001, he opened his own business in the same field and he started selling some electronic machines too. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy new tools for his business including two small machines and a small generator. He is aiming to develop his business and grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy new tools and a small generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad  fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su hermoso centro histórico, tiene muchos lugares en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora María es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 18 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras para surtir más su negocio. Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. Su sueño es  conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the Progresista communal bank.  She lives in downtown Cuenca, a city that was designated Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 1999 because of its beautiful, historic city center.  It has many places where nature’s beauty can be admired in its entire splendor; its residents keep its culture and traditions alive.

María is 53 years old, is a widow and has five adult children who are married and independent.  She does not own her house; she rents.

María is a merchant.  She sells vegetables and leafy green vegetables.  She’s been in this line of work for 18 years and works Sunday to Sunday from 6am until 8pm.

She will use her loan to buy vegetables to better stock her business.  She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank.  Her dream is to stay healthy to continue working.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua. Su comunidad es pequeña con aproximadamente 100 familias. Se gana la vida desde hace tres años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando su ganado ya ha alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo lo ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado y desea hacer unos arreglos al techo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar el material necesario para reparar y mantenerlo. Maximina es  honesta y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maximina is 48 years old, married and has a young child. She lives in her own house in the rural area of the district of Lambayeque. Presently, it does not have the basic services of electricity or running water. Her community is small with about 100 families.

Her income comes from breeding small animals in pens located in the back of her house. When the animals are ready, she sells them to customers who visit her area. She learned this trade from her parents which provided her with experience.

Presently her house is in poor condition and she wishes to fix the roof. She is requesting a loan of 1.000 Nuevos Soles to buy the materials necessary for the repairs. 

Maximina is a very honest person; one of her main goals is to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Leah is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling delicacies such as flavored ices or halo-halo in the local community. She also sells ready-to-wear clothing & electronic cell phone loads. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & fund working capital for her business. 

Leah is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make halo-halo, such as sugar and milk. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make ices to sell

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a young man from Tulkarem. Mousa is a National Palestinian Authority employee who lives and works in Tulkarem. Mousa also is a wedding planner. He doesn't work in wedding planning on a regular basis but it helps him increase his income.

Mousa took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a computer for his sons who are now old enough to start learning to use the computer. Mousa appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for his sons.

loans.name: Jean Robert

texts.en:
Jean Robert, age 29, works as a technician. He starts his work from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday. He has been in this business for two years and currently employs two people to help him. He is married without children.
 
He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials for his business. With the profits generated as a result of this loan, Jean Robert will be able to earn more revenue, which will allow him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Ramiro José

texts.es: El señor Ramiro tiene la edad 50 años , habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen un hijo mayor de edad e independiente ; los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar la cocina ya que la que actualmente está muy viejita y se le hace incomodo a su esposa estar cocinando el pan de cada día , don Ramiro desde hace veinte cinco años trabaja al campo , la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo de piña son las plagas que le  invaden ya que este carece de un mantenimiento adecuado , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para darle una mejor vida a su cultivo de piña y pueda ser una producción  rentable  .
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro is 50 years old and resides in the town of Ticuantepe.  He and his wife, a fruit and vegetable merchant, work together to cover the household expenses.  They have an adult son who is independent.  

His plans for his family include improving their kitchen which is currently outdated.  His wife does not have enough room for preparing the daily meals.  Don Ramiro has worked as a farmer for 25 years.  The greatest challenge he has faced in growing pineapple has been dealing with pests that have invaded his fields and prevented him from providing adequate maintenance.  

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies in order to provide better conditions for his pineapple crop and promote a profitable harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Rosa que pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa que cada treinta días se reúne con sus compañeras en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Rosa nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 42 años edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella está feliz porque están sacando adelante a sus tres hijos. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística y comercio).

Rosa nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de condimentos en el mercado Túpac Amaru del distrito de San Sebastián de la ciudad de Cusco. Desde hace cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar más condimentos como cominos, pimienta, sal y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
During the communal bank’s meeting we met Rosa, who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “María Auxiliadora” communal bank, and who meets with her fellow members every thirty days in the house of one of the members in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood.  

Rosa was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú) and is 42 years old; she lives in Cusco.  She is happy because she’s successfully raising her three children.  (Cusco is noted for having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism and commerce).

Rosa tells us that she sells condiments in the Túpac Amaru market in the San Sebastián neighborhood in Cusco.  She’s been in business for five years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

On this occasion she needs a loan to buy more condiments like cumin, pepper, salt and other things.

loans.use: to buy more condiments like cumin, pepper, salt and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two children; one attends school while one has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is water bills and electricity bills. 

For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also owns a rental house, contributing to her other source of income. Rose faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, wash boards, baskets and buckets.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with two children, one boy and one girl. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a bakery business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of purchasing food products. He dreams of establishing another bakery shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase an oven for his bread baking business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase an oven to bake bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer in Kitale,Western Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6. He has been in mixed farming for 5 years with his farm producing milk and eggs which he sells to the local market.

Benard has requested a second loan with Juhudi Kilimo for 41,200 KES. His first loan was promptly paid and he says the first loan improved his family living standard. He hopes the second loan will be better. He wishes to have four dairy cows and a motorcycle for transport business.

He says scarcity of animal feeds and costly management of diseases are the farming challenges.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and expand the dairy unit.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu is married and has five children. She bakes small chops like chips, rock bans, spring rolls and others for sale in Elmina. She has been in this business for seven years. As part of her wifely duties, she feeds the children. She will use this loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Ardan Duba

texts.en: Ardan is a 39-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is three years old. He describes himself as innovative, creative, persistent, and independent. He operates a mobile phone store and cyber café where he sells mobile phones, phone accessories and provides internet, typing and printing services. He has been involved in this business for seven years and employs three staff members. His business is located in a commercial area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of inputs and electricity. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to purchase more phone accessories and computers. His business goal is to have many chains all over town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his wife as she becomes educated so that she can be employed and earn a living for the family as well.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories and computers

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur Libasse est âgé de 33 ans. Il vit au Sénégal, il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie  entre 2 et 4 ans. Il est enseignant depuis 2006 dans une école privée du quartier ou il habite. Parallèlement  il fait des prestations de service depuis 2008 accès  sur l’organisation de cérémonies comme mariage, baptême, conférence, etc.  Il a choisi ses activités par passion, mais aussi pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Ce qui lui procure beaucoup de plaisir c’est le savoir qu’il inculque aux enfants. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2008. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un prêt  de 400 000 frs. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de  certains matériels utilisés pour l’organisation d’événements tels que bâches, tissus de décoration, tapis rouge ce qui lui permettra d’être  bien équipé pour offrir des services de qualité a sa clientèle. Son but est d’accroitre ses revenus et améliorer le bien être  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Libasse is 33 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. He has been a teacher since 2006 in a private school in the district where he lives. Concurrently, he has worked in the service sector since 2008 organizing events, such as marriages, baptisms, conferences, etc. He chose these kinds of work for the love of them but also for supporting himself from day to day. What makes him very happy is the knowledge he instills in children. 

Mr. Libasse has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since February 2008. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy certain supplies used for organizing events such as tarps, decorative fabrics, and red carpets that will enable him to equip himself well, so as to offer quality service to his customers. His goal is to grow his revenues and to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy tarps, decorative fabrics, red carpets, etc. for his business

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat was born in 1987. She lives in the Reussey Keo community with her humble husband and only one favorite kid. Presently, she is a clothes seller in front of her house, where she is able to earn about $4 for each day. She is married to Mr. Sali, who is a craftsman. He has been running this type of industry since 2008. 

For promoting her family to live in a better quality of life, Mrs. Phat and her husband wish to borrow some funds through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, with the purpose of purchasing additional craft materials. She is expecting that this loan will make her family meet happiness, prosperity and gain more benefits daily. This is her first loan with HKL and Kiva. She is very thankful to all kind lenders who assist her family in avoiding the poverty line.

loans.use: to purchase additional craft materials.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: la señora Lourdes es cliente antigua de la institución desde el año 2001, ella tiene un atienda de barrio donde se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos como pan, refrescos, abarrotes, enlatados, etc., su  tienda es muy surtida, se encuentra todo tipo de artículos, desde una aguja por así decirlo,  el lugar donde se encuentra la tienda es también estratégico y ella abastece a los vecinos de la zona,  ya que es la única tienda por el barrio,  la señora Lourdes vive en la misma zona y lugar donde es su negocio,  ella vive con su hija,  yerno y nietos, es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora, con su negocio y los créditos anteriores ha logrado hacer crecer su capital y el negocio que tiene, por lo que se solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como refrescos y dulces para surtir su tienda, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is an old client, since 2001, of the communal bank. She has a neighborhood store and sells diverse items such as bread, drinks, groceries, canned goods, and other items. Her store is well supplied and one can find all sorts of things, even a needle so to speak. Her store is found in a strategic location, and she meets the demand of the neighborhood residents. It is the only store in the area.

Lourdes lives in the neighborhood where her store is located. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law, and nieces and nephews. She is very energetic and enterprising.

Through her business and previous loans she has increased her capital and her business has grown. She is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as drinks and sweets in order to supply her store. She is very grateful for the help of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, refreshments, and soft drinks

loans.name: Adzokuma

texts.fr:
Adzokuma est une femme  âgée de 40ans. Adzokuma est mariée å un  dépanneur. Elle a 4 enfants
Adzokuma  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Adzokuma  est revendeuse de pâtes fermentées (com)  faites à base de maïs. Adzokuma  achète les produits à Lomé et  travaille avec une employée. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir assez  dans les tâches de sa restauration. 
Adzokuma  a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adzokuma voudrait ouvrir son petit restaurant  pour plus de sainteté dans l’alimentation et quitter la route. Elle  dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit offrir une meilleure scolarisationà ses enfants.
texts.en: Adzokuma is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to an engineer and has four children. Adzokuma has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells com (a salted cornmeal dough). She buys her products in Lomé and works with one employee. At the moment, her main difficulty is not having enough supplies for her food business. Adzokuma has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy corn. Over the coming years, Adzokuma would like to open a small restaurant so that she no longer has to sell in the street. She says that she plans to use her profits to offer her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Berly

texts.en:
Berly is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Berly has a shop that sells canned goods, detergent & shampoo. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, detergent and shampoo.
Berly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Berly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent and shampoo.

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep is a 48-year-old married woman, living in Reussey Keo commune, a suburb area Phnom Penh City. She earns a living by selling merchandise like metal pots, plastic baskets, plates, spoons, and other kitchen supplies. She has spent most of her time outdoor to run this business, from which she usually generates in the neighborhood of $3.00 per day. Her husband also helps her in the same business. With this loan amount, Mrs. Lep will use it to buy a stock of merchandise to sustain her business. In the future, she will save some money to invest and expand her existing business as it is improving.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise to sustain her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es una señora alegre, humilde, creativa, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde  hace cuatro años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Luis con quien tiene un hijo por quien los dos trabajan ya que desean darle un mejor educación.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus clientes para  que vuelvan a comprarle y se vayan con una buena impresión.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para la compra de ropa para dama y caballero que es lo que más se vende en su localidad.
Ella vende su ropa en pagos  y acotando, también vende productos de omilfe  desde hace  cinco años.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en: Señora Irma is a happy, humble and creative woman who has been selling clothes for the last 4 years. She is happily married to Señor Luis with whom she has 1 child for whom they both work as they wish to give him a better education. What she likes the most about her busiiness is serving her customers so that they return to buy again and leave with a good impression. She asked for the loan to buy ladies' and men's clothes which are what sells the best in her area. She sells her clothes on credit and for cash. She has also been selling Omnilife products for the last 5 years. She thanks the Fundacion for the support given her to get ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y, pictured above, is 42 years old.  His wife, Rortyas, aged 44, lives with him in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991, and have three sons and two daughters. One has full-time employment, and the others attend school.  

Y is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver and is also a fisherman. His wife sells fish that her husband catches in local market. Y is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 USD to purchase a boat motor.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Абдурахим занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. По профессии Абдурахим агроном. В этой области он проработал 20 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп топлива для вспашки земли с помощью трактора.
texts.en:
Abdurahim lives in the region Hamadoni. He is 69 years old and married. He has three children. 

Abdurahim works with growing vegetables. He has been engaged in this activity for 12 years. Abdurahim is an agronomist by profession. He has worked in this area for 20 years. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of fuel for plowing the land with the help of a tractor

loans.use: to buy fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Mr. Meur is 43 years old. He is married with three children living in Takhmao town. But presently, one of his children has started a new family and lives separately. The remaining two are now working in various parts of a garment factory. Mr. Meur has spent most of his lifetime dedicated to an agricultural business. He grows rice and vegetable crops and is able to earn in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day. 

At present, Mr. Meur needs some funds from Kiva through HKL to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides and lubricating oil for his pumping machine. This loan will enable him to keep his crops in good condition and to improve his business. For his goal, he will build a wooden pigpen behind his house and raise some piglets for more income.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides and lubricating oil for his pumping machine.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia Albertina continúa dedicándose a su negocio de su restaurante donde vende distintos platos populares de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia pertence al banco comunal "VIRGEN DE CHAPI" y está logrando salir adelante gracias a su empreño y dedicación a diario, por eso ella desea ampliar su negocio por fiestas de fin de año ofreciendo mas alimentos preparados por ella.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar  carne, pollo, aceite, huevo y fideos.
La socia esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.

loans.use: carne, pollo, aceite, huevo y fideos.

loans.name: Miboussomékpo

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Mrs Miboussomékpo A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. For the last 8 years, she has run a business fabricating and selling mats. The business of mat making is booming in her town. It is because of this that she is able to contribute to the running of her household. Three months ago, she began making woven baskets because she realized that this would also be profitable. The demand for these baskets has been very strong and they need to been made in large quantities to meet the demand - particularly from tomato producers. To suitably meet the demand of people wanting to buy her baskets, Mrs A. needs some financial support. She is asking for a loan of $700, which she will use as business capital to buy raw materials needed to make mats and baskets. This will increase her income and improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965, Madame A. Miboussomékpo est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a comme profession la fabrication et la vente des nattes, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 8 ans. Le commerce des nattes est une activité très florissante dans cette localité. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle contribue aux charges du ménage. Il y a 3 mois, elle s’est initiée à la fabrication des paniers car elle s’est rendue compte que ce commerce aussi est très rentable. Mais la demande étant très forte, il faut en fabriquer en grande quantité pour les livrer aux producteurs de tomates surtout. Pour pouvoir satisfaire convenablement les acheteurs de nattes et de paniers, Madame A. a besoin d’un appui financier. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des matières premières nécessaires pour la fabrication des nattes et des paniers. Ceci augmentera son revenu et améliorera ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials to make mats and baskets

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives on a farm where he grows rice, plantains, maize and soy beans. He is very proud of his lands, as they are very fertile and they have helped him and his family survive for years. He lives with his mother and father, and they hope to invest in fertilizer and pesticides for their crops.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: William would like to invest in fertilizer and pesticides for his farm's numerous crops

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is José H. and I sell seafood like fish and shellfish. I've owned my business for 1 year. The sales of these products is going very well; many people eat fish because it is healthy. Since I live close to the Gulf of Fonseca, it is easy to obtain fresh fish of high quality. I need extra capital to buy more and increase my revenue, and with the profits I'll be able to feed my lovely family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jose H. me dedico a la venta de mariscos como ser pescado y curiles, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, la venta de estos productos es muy buena ya que mucha gente come pescado por saludable y como vivo en un lugar cerca del golfo de fonseca consigo mucho pescado fresco y bueno, pero necesito capiital para poder comprar mas y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi querida familia.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. is 53 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband who is 58, and their 4 children. Her husband works as a fisherman, earning $3 a day. Two of their children are garment workers, one is an electrician and one is a student. Ly Y. would like to invest in an electric shop. She will use the loan to purchase second-hand televisions and radios, which she will then repair, enhance and finally re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase second hand televisions and radios to repair and enhance for re-selling

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
I am Nasreen H. and with the help of my husband, I knit woolen bed sheets, cushions, shirts, wall hangings, bags and so forth. I have two sons and one daughter. My eldest son is in grade one and my daughter is in grade two. The youngest one is not of school going age yet.

I wish to have promising careers for my children -- maybe a doctor or a teacher. I have employed women from my neighborhood to help me in my knitting business. They contribute well to our household income and help us manage our living. However, I need to expand my business in order to save for my childrens' education. Thus, I am requesting a loan of 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Doña Ricarda has a workshop in her house in which they create rustic furniture, such as wardrobes and wooden chairs. In addition, she buys fine arts and crafts of bright colors. She has been working on this business for 33 years, having started with a working capital of US$286 (two hundred eighty six dollars). She started in some stone benches with wooden shelves in which she would place small things she could get out of her workshop, which at the time was still newly built. The shop was out in the open, under the sun, and she would sell there all day... but that was before the central market of Leon was remodeled.

As a result of working with loans, she has been able to invest in her business, have her own stand, and fill it with typical Nicaraguan merchandise, as well as being able to buy raw material to create her own products. She is married and has a minor grandchild living with her. She is the only one in her household who works and the sole support of her home. Her dream is that this business will grow and her workshop can move to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Ricarda tiene un taller en su casa ya que elaboran artículos rústicos como roperos, sillas de madera, además de eso compra artesania fina de vistosos colores. Lleva 33 años de tener este negocio y inició con un capital de trabajo de U$ 286 (doscientos ochenta y seis dolares). Inició en unas bancas de piedra con estantes de madera donde colocaba cositas pequeñas que podia sacar en el día de su taller que aun estaba recien construido. El negocio se encontraba al aire libre bajo el sol, vendía todo el día...pero esto fue antes de que remodelaran el mercado central de León

A raiz de trabajar con los créditos ella ha logrado invertir en su negocio, tener su propio módulo y surtir su venta con mercaderia típica nicaragüense asi como la compra de materiales para fabricar sus propios productos. Ella está casada y tiene un nieto menor de edad viviendo con ella, es la única que trabajo, es quien mantiene su hogar. Su sueño es que este negocio logre crecer y su fábrica sea trasladada a la ciudad.

loans.use: Buying guacanaste wood to create her own arts and crafts products.

loans.name: Twawiya

texts.en:
Twawiya B. is a perfect example of why microfinance works, and why the large majority of clients repay their loans.  A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time ask anxiously, “but how do you make sure people pay back?  Won’t they just take the money?”  The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually the poor) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people.  Whether or not this is true is somewhat irrelevant for a number of reasons.  

Firstly, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk.  More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive.  The incentive is for clients to be able to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another… The incentive is to have on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

Twawiya began this journey in 2002 when she opened a shop selling a variety of foodstuffs.  Since then, she has received and repaid four loans of progressively increasing amounts from SELFINA, which she has used to expand her business.  Twawiya now purchases all her stock in bulk, which has enabled her to increase her profits.  

This time, Twawiya requires a loan of $1075 to purchase stocks of soda, flour and sugar.  Her business makes it possible for Twawiya to provide for her three daughters - Corona, 12, Caroline, 9, Theresa, 6 - and her niece, Elizabeth, aged 10.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase stocks of soda, flour and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Amudat

texts.en: Amudat A. is 45 years old, married with 7 children, and hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials; she has been in business since 2005 and needs a loan of $275 to buy more tailoring materials for sale. She thanks you!

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin H. , 34, has been married for sixteen years and has one son who is studying in primary school. Currently, she and her husband, Hem Socheat, are in the business of spinning thread with a semi-machine for a scarf producer in the village. It’s a skill they learned from their neighbor. Both husband and wife hope to continue to grow their business so they can support their son’s studies.

Mrs. H. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: U. Malohat was born in 1960 in the Spitamen region and she is married and has 2 children. Her stable business has allowed her to repay past loans on time and to improve the business terms significantly. She opened a trade outlet in the local bazaar selling shoes and men's clothing.  Because she has a good assortment of products and low prices, many of her customers return to her.  She is applying to Kiva for a $625 loan for 8 months to import new goods and increase the variety of goods in her business.

loans.use: To import goods and expand their variety of goods.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
At seventy two years old, Evaristo is still committed to working. He is retired in the eyes of the government following thirty years working in a textiles factory. However, he prefers to spend his time working rather than resting at home. This is why, for five years, in the mornings, he has been selling sweets from a wheelbarrow outside a school. He decided to go into this line of work as he already had some experience in the field. Before working in the textiles factory he worked for several other people selling sweets. Of course, he was selling from something a bit bigger than a wheelbarrow in those days. On the other hand, in his house he also sells fizzy drinks, as well as other types of soft drink. He plans to work as long as his health allows him to, which is why he is looking to invest more money into his business. Today Evaristo lives with his wife, and his children have all moved out of the family home and live independently.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

A sus setenta y dos años de edad Evaristo es un hombre que aun se caracteriza por su empeño a la hora de trabajar. Él ya tiene el titulo del gobierno como jubilado gracias a su trabajo de casi treinta años en una fabrica de textil; sin embargo, él prefiere ocupar su tiempo trabajando en algo a quedarse descansado en su casa, es así que desde hace cinco años vende golosinas en un carretilla en los exteriores de un colegio por las mañanas. Se le ocurrió vender golosinas, puesto que ya había tenido experiencia en este negocio. Antes de trabajar en la fabrica textil contrató a un numero de personas para que vendan golosinas. En ese entonces contaba con más de una carretilla. Por otro lado, en su casa vende gaseosas y otras bebidas. Tiene planeado trabajar hasta cuando la salud se lo permita, aun así el busca invertir más en este negocio. Actualmente Evaristo vive solo con su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes.

loans.use: To stock more drinks to sell from home

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica K. sells children’s wear in Ghana. She is married and has one child.  Her business is doing very well and her customers keep returning.  However, Veronica is running out of inventory and wishes to stock up on goods in order to increase sales.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela is a recently married 22-year-old woman. Her first loan was obtained while she was still single, and she is now in her third relationship with the institution. Currently, she is expecting her first child and she lives together with her husband in a rented home. From a young age, Gabriela has worked as a secretary and her husband has worked for over six years as an electrician specializing in the repair of Kenwood products. They don’t have competition since they both can count on regular work. The current loan is to help pay for their baby’s delivery costs and also to purchase clothing, a crib, stroller and other products that a new baby will require. Gabriela has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with regard to her loan payments, and she has a good credit history. It should be noted that because Gabriela was not available when the picture was taken, it is instead a photo of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una señora de 22 años de edad, recientemente se casó. Su primer crédito lo sacó cuando era soltera ahora es su tercera frecuencia con la institución. Actualmente está esperando a su primer hijo y vive junto a su esposo en alquiler. Gabriela trabaja como secretaria desde muy joven y su esposo ya trabaja desde hace más de seis años como técnico electrónoico especializado en artículos de la marca Kenwood. No tienen competencia ya que abos cuentan con un trabajo fijo. El presente préstamo es para los gastos que se necesiten en el parto y también para comprar ropita, cuna, coche y otras cosas que vaya a necesitar su bebe. Gabriela demostró ser una persona muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas a nuestra institución, tiene un buen historial crediticio. Se hace notar que como Gabriela no estaba para la foto se la tomó a su esposo.

loans.use: To pay for furniture and medical expenses.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesus is 38 years old and is dedicated to transporting passengers in his mototaxi. With help from his wife, he cultivates a small plot of land and sells produce. In this manner, this couple is able to pay their bills and support their children's education. The reason why Jesus is here in front of you is so he may request a loan so he can maintain his mototaxi and purchase some parts. At the same time, he wants to continue saving for the purchase of another vehicle so he may increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús tiene 38 años, y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, a la par con la ayuda de su esposa, cultivan un pequeño terreno para luego vender los productos producidos, de esta manera, esta pareja de esposos sostienen los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos.El motivo por el que Jesús se presenta ante ustedes es para pedir un apoyo económico en préstamo para el mantenimiento de su motocarro y la compra de algunos repuestos, así mismo seguir ahorrando para la compra de otro vehículo para aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance and the purchase of parts.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L.  35 tuổi, chồng chị hiện đang đi xuất khẩu lao động tại mỹ, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2000 vốn vay ban đầu chị vay 2.000.000 đ chị đầu tư vào may mặc, sau đó vừa may mặc vừa bán hàng tạp hóa. Các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục đầu tư vào hàng tạp hóa lãi xuất thu được chị đã quay vòng mở rộng kinh doanh. Bản thân chị là người phụ nữ khéo tay lại có vốn đầu tư mua nhiều sản phẩm vải để may quần, áo rất phong phú, khách hàng đến may tại cửa hàng chị chủ yếu là người dân  trong địa phương, thấy việc may mặc vẫn còn thời gian kinh doanh thêm nên đầu năm 2003 chị đã đầu tư thêm vốn mở một gian hàng tạp hóa. Hiện tại việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị phát triển cho thu nhập cao bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Chồng chị đi làm vẫn thường xuyên gủi tiền về phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị đầu tư 10.000.000đ mua hàng tạp hóa.
Thu nhập bìnhquân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., aged 35, became a member of TYM Fund in 2000. Her husband is currently working in the States under one labor export program. Mrs. L. only borrowed 2.000.000 VND in the first round of loan to invest in tailoring. As Mrs. L. is a skilled tailor, her shop is very popular in her area. Realizing that she still had time to do something else besides tailoring, Mrs. L. started using the loans from TYM Fund to open a small shop selling a variety of necessities at home in 2003. This has helped her family make about 3.000.000 VND per month. Her husband sends money back home every month to help the whole family. In the next round of loan, Mrs. L. would like to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($625) to purchase more goods for her shop. Her family’s monthly income is 5.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Sahau

texts.en:
Sahau is 31 years and is divorced with one 11 year old child. She sells charcoal and firewood. She works daily and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Sahau is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loans.name: America

texts.es: América tiene 34 años, es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos Renato de 11 y Anthony de 09.  Se dedica a la venta de colchones, planchadores, etc, desde hace 3 años atrás cuando se independizó, antes de eso trabajaba con sus hermanas, en el negocio familiar.  América trabaja incansablemente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, hora en la cual debe desdoblarse para hacer el trabajo de venta y de madre a la vez, lo cual es lo más difícil, pero aún así a América le gusta mucho la venta de colchones, ya que con este oficio puede mantener a su familia.  América se esfuerza para sacar a sus hijos adelante y que sean profesionales.  Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más colchones, para mejorar la venta de su negocio y así expandirse, logrando tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
América is 34 years old, single, and lives with her two sons; Renato, who is 11 years old and Anthony who is 9. She dedicates herself to the sale of mattresses, linens, etc., which she has done for the past three years when she became independent. Prior to that, she worked with her sisters in the family business. América works tirelessly from 8 am until 6 pm, at which time she must do double-duty to conduct both her sales work and be a mother which is the most difficult part. Despite this, América very much enjoys selling mattresses given that with this endeavor she can support her family. América makes great effort to help her children get ahead, so that they may become professionals. With the funds from the loan she will be able to buy more mattresses in order to improve sales at her business, and therefore be able to expand and manage to improve her income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Elba

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Elba R. tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene dos hijos de los cuales actualmente cursan la primaria, los propósitos de Doña Sandra es  tener un lugar que represente las condiciones necesarias para la elaboración de su producto como es la tortilla por lo que  necesita su respectivo espacio, otros de sus sueños es contratar a una ayudante para que su mama descanse y proporcionarle la ayuda económica que necesita, dentro de sus metas ofrecerle a sus hijos un porvenir llenos de estudios por lo que esto requiere trabajar fuertemente pero solo así lograría asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y para que en un mañana no pasen dificultades.



La actividad económica a la que Doña Sandra se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas que esta ubicado en león, el tiempo de tener este negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio por su mama por lo que Doña Sandra tenia experiencia en este oficio desde los 13 años de edad y fue así como ella decidió convertir este oficio en un medio de trabajo y vida y mas tarde toma la responsabilidad de hacerse cargo de este negocio, ella pidió este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que la elaboración de este producto requiere de mucha materia prima como es: el maíz, la compra de leña y carbón por lo que esto es el consumo de diario para la elaboración de su producto y agradece trabajar con fundación león 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones que le facilitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Sandra Elba R. is 38 years old, single, and has two children in primary school. Sandra would like to have an appropriate place to make tortillas. Another of her dreams is to hire an assistant so that her mother can rest and Sandra can provide for her needs. She also would like to make sure that her children are well-educated. For this, Sandra must work hard, but she knows that only in this way can she ensure her children's futures so that one day they will not face difficulties. For ten years, Sandra has made and sold tortillas in León, Nicaragua. She learned the profession from her mother and has had experience in making tortillas since she was 13 years old. She decided to commit herself to this way of life and later took over responsibility for the business. Sandra requests this loan as working capital, since the production of tortillas requires many resources: corn, wood, and coal. She is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and the other organizations that provide this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ileje Group

texts.en:
Hosea N., age 26, is single. He has a butcher shop which he started three years ago. He opens his butcher shop from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $122.

In the past Hosea has taken out one loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy a refrigerator and to paint the shop. He hopes for a new loan to start selling fish in the same shop.

Hosea will share this loan with his loan group, Ileje, which totals 16 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Hosea is in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: To start selling fish in addition to meat in his butcher's shop.

loans.name: Mrs. Hun Luon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan goes to a group of eight people in Tong Rong village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Hun L. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. She is a 37-year-old widow with two children who both attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to resell

loans.name: Normurot

texts.en:
Normurot K. is 45 years old and was born in Rudaki, Tajikistan. He is the father of five children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. An ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a barn to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni for the realization of this project. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta N. sells clothes. She uses her profit to pay all her family's daily expenses including tuition fees of her four children and their other needs. She is 44 years old and lives in Maribojoc, Bohol, a town of 18,113 people. Her husband, Wilfredo N., is very supportive of her in her business. They work together to uplift their lives. She previously worked as a daycare teacher. She was not happy about her job and decided to venture into selling clothes in the flea market.

Vicenta is asking for a loan of 9,000 pesos. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell. She believes that her loan will bring her more profits. This would definitely help her family address their needs.

CEVI is giving all its clients the credit assistance they need in their businesses. CEVI also provides trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients to help them increase their sales. In this way, CEVI can create a lasting impact on so many lives.
