loans.use: To buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mukankuranga

texts.en: Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda!  J. Mukankuranga is currently seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda.  She lives and works in the Kimironko neighborhood of Kigali, the capital city.  She has owned a butcher shop there since 2004 and employs three people to help her run the shop.  With her loan, J. will purchase a freezer for her butchery.  This will permit her to store meat for long periods of time without it going bad.  She anticipates that it will result in an increase in profit, and with this profit she hopes to buy more food and goods for her home, pay school fees, and reinvest in her business.  J. is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children.  In addition, she cares for three orphans.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her butchery.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 43, who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children, has owned a sewing factory for over ten years. He repairs and sews clothes as well as school costumes, and is requesting a loan of $3000 USD  from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread and repair one of his sewing machines. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

Ibrahim's previous loan helped him improve both his factory and his financiA. situation. He is speciA. in his work because he does it well, and his clients are schools, clothing traders and others. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase thread and repair one of his sewing machines.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda tiene 34 años de edad, está casada cerca de 10 años, tiene 5 hijos, todos viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura, es una mujer muy perseverante, aunque su esposo no la ayuda tanto como quisiera en estas labores, junto a sus hermanos, siembra en las fechas designadas para las chacras temporales, porque si se pasa de fecha la producción no es del todo buena, el factor del clima, es quien dirige este tipo de siembras. A Rayda le gusta su trabajo, aunque a veces tiene dolores en sus pies que no le permiten desplazarse fácilmente, pero pese a ello, cosecha la papa junto a su esposo. Sus anhelos son de comprar terrenos en zonas de regadío, para que de ese modo no tenga que esperar las fechas de lluvia para el inicio de sus labores agrícolas. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, todo este tiempo demostró ser una cliente que paga en las fechas señaladas por su asesor de crédito. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de alverjas en semilla, ya que tiene sus chacras preparadas para ser sembradas.
texts.en:
Rayda is 34 years old, has been married for close to 10 years, and has 5 children who all live at home. She works in agriculture and is a woman who perseveres, although her husband doesn't help her with the work as much as she would like. Together with her siblings, she plants her plots of land according to the seasons because if she misses a date the production is not so good. It's the climate that dictates this sort of planting. Rayda likes her work, although sometimes she has pains in her feet that don't allow her to move around easily. But even so, she harvests potatoes alongside her husband. Her wish is to buy land in an irrigated area so she won't have to wait for rain to begin her agricultural work. This is her 7th loan with MFP. All this time she has proved to be a client who pays on the dates marked by her loan adviser. The loan she is asking for is to buy pea seeds since she has the plots of land already prepared to be sown.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semillas de alverja

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 49 years old. She is married with four children. Through her hard effort, all her children are in school. Her husband is a professional carpenter. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. Apart from that she also sells onions, spices and pepper on top of a table.

She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her save more for the children’s education. Akosua belongs to the village bank called "Nokwarefo" which means Trust.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P., a resident of Tipolo, is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Fe operates a family member's business venture in the services sector, primarily providing construction services to local community members. She has been engaged in the business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC used to purchase materials needed to provide service, she is now requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used both to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Fe’s third loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao R. is 32-year-old and a resident of the Phnom Penh, where she earns a living selling Khmer noodle to neighbors in the village. She always buys the ingredients on credit. She returns the money after she finishes selling.

She is married with four children; all of whom are teenagers and school-age. Her husband works as a construction foreman. Mao R. hopes to earn extra income as a merchandise trader. Due to the lack of capital, Mao R. requests a loan of $1000 from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is a food vendor who sells a variety of foods in the streets to earn a living for her family. She sells "balut," a delicacy made from chicken or duck eggs which is popular as street food in the Philippines. Its taste is very distinct. Some say that a tour of the Philippines is not complete if a tourist does not sample it.

Gemma would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI to buy more eggs to make balut for sale. The loan will go far in improving her business. The income that she gets from her business helps her feed and educate her children.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides its clients not just with loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy eggs for making balut for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es: Carlos Edwin es un taxista propietario, trabaja hace 15 años, vive en su casa con su familia, su esposa trabaja, y le apoya en los gastos de la casa, sus niños están en edad escolar, él es muy dedicado a sus hijos y a su familia. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de respuestos que llevará para venderlos en los Yungas del departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Carlos Edwin has been a taxi driver for 15 years. He lives in his home with his family. His wife works and helps him with their home's expenses. His children are school-aged. He is very dedicated to his children and his family. He will invest this credit in purchasing parts that he will sell in Los Yungas in the department of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will purchase automobile parts to sell in the provinces of La Paz.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
LUCITA D. is a 64 year-old widow with 5 adult children, who lives in Punta Cabahug, Brgy. Zone 6, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Lucita does not want to be a burden to her children so even at 64 she is using her innate cooking skills to earn a living for herself and even help in the family's financial support.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 and has used the loans to fund her small neighborhood eatery - better known in the Hiligaynon dialect as a "carinderia" which offers cooked food to her neighbors who either eat the food on the counter of her food stall or as a take-out. The food business nets about PHP 6,000.00 for Lucita.

This new loan of PHP 10,500.00, her 17th from NWTF-Project Dungganon, will allow Lucita to offer her customers more variety and allow her to cook larger quantities to sell to more people, ultimately increasing her income potential.

Lucita is determined to stay financially independent as long as she is capable of earning her own living, and to also set aside some of her income for her support in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL TO BUY INGREDIENTS FOR HER PRODUCTS

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Phoung H., age 70, is a widow who has three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, where she makes a living growing rice and earns about $2 per day. She gets help from her children, who make their living in different ways.

The financial crisis has been difficult for Cambodians and made life hard for everyone, H. included. Despite these difficulties, she is determined to increase her income and improve her life. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a photocopying machine because her house is located near a school. She hopes that the business she gets from the school will allow her to generate more income and raise her standard of living. 

We see one of her children in the picture. He operates a motor taxi in town and uses his income to help his family.

loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob V. sells a few items out of her home for a daily profit. At the same time, she is always dealing in rice. She is married to Nhek Srin, age 55, who is a fisherman. They have seven single children, four of whom are employed (two are security guards and two are employed workers). Nob V. will be using her first loan to buy a used car to begin a taxi service. This loan will provide her and her family with additional income and a higher living standard.

loans.use: To buy a used car to begin a taxi service

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn manages a vending business situated in the school canteen.  She sells different snacks like banana cue on stick and other snacks for children. She also brings her products in front of their house whenever she is not in the school. She wanted to generate income everyday because she needs funds to meet the daily needs of her family. 

Juvilyn is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders for the improvement of her business. She then decided to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP5, 000 loans. She wishes for its development to further increase her daily income. She have two children and they were both studying.  She is glad that her husband is always there to support their business and she prays that they will be given the chance to further expand their business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stationery supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells foodstuffs and local gin to make a living within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. Her husband sells drinks and local gin. She is 40 years old and has five children. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and local gin

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, 51 years old, is married to Rolando who works as a farmer. They have two children who are both married. Now that her children are done with their schooling and already have their own families, she believes that they will make it on their own. However, Yolanda is ready to assist her children in times of need.

Yolanda makes a living with her hog-raising business. She keeps them for four months. She has had her business since her children entered college. Through this business, she earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month which is a big help in meeting the daily needs of her family. She hopes that her business will further expand and become more productive, and that's why she is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She wants to borrow 20,000 PHP to buy hog feed and some hogs to raise.

loans.use: For hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar T. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 51 years old. Oscar is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Oscar operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used shoe products in the local community. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Oscar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Oscar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna B. sells beer and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell. Inna is 33 years old and is married to a teacher. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mery Carolina

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. 

Nuestra socia MERY tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos: Vanesa es la mayor y es independiente. Melissa tiene 19 años, Urpi tiene 9 años y Álvaro tiene 7 años, ellos todavía estudian en el colegio. La socia es docente hace 24 años en el Instituto Educativo Inicial “Pampa Chulla” de Urcos. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de multi servicios como librería, café Internet y venta de cosméticos. La socia en su domicilio acomodo una habitacion para su tienda y es donde vende sus productos. Ya son 8 años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos menores. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como aretes, pulseras, collares, perfumes y muchas cosas más pues por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran. La socia esta acompañada en la foto con su nieta.
texts.en:
This member is from the city of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis of the department of Cusco. She belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco" of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank is of Quechua origin and means "Mountain of Gold."

Our member Mery is 46 years old, married and has 4 children: Vanesa is the oldest and lives on her own, Melissa (19), Urpi (9) and Alvaro (7). Melissa, Urpi and Alvaro are still in school. Mery has been a teacher at Urcos' Educational Institute "Pampa Chulla" for 24 years. Also, she alternates her housework with running a small, multi-service business that has a bookstore, an Internet café and cosmetics sales. She has a room in her house that acts as the store. She has already had the store for 8 years and it is going very well, thanks to the determination she gives to her work. Our member is a hardworking and enterprising woman who moves the lives of her younger children forward. She requires a loan for purchasing earrings, bracelets, necklaces, perfumes, and other items because this is the time in which most is sold.

She feels thankful for the opportunity given to her and she is commited to make her payments on time.

The city of Urcos is 45 km from Cusco by the asphalted roan to Puno. It has a small population and beautiful lake, where, according to legend, Huascar threw a giant gold chain in order to avoid the Spanish that carried it. The member is in the photo with her granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her store (earrings, bracelets, necklaces, etc)

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Marina tiene 40 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos: Darly tiene 22 años, Romel tiene 20 años y Cesar tiene 2 años. La socia Marina vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades en la casa como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades de la casa va atender el cafetín escolar en el colegio “Humberto Luna” de Calca.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como galletas, dulces, gaseosas, refrescos, hamburguesas y pasteles.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, Marina, is 40 years old, divorced, and has three children: Darly, who is 22 years old, Romel, who is 20, and Cesar, 2 years of age. Marina lives in the city of Calca, in Cusco, and belongs to the “MAMACHA ASUNTA” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. Marina is a hard-working mother and entrepreneur that rises very early each morning to tend to her household chores, such as making breakfast for her children. After finishing these tasks, she goes to work at the school cafeteria at the Humberto Luna School in Calca. She has been in this business for several years, and things have gone well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work. This member needs a loan to buy products such as cookies, sweets and snacks, sodas and refreshments, hamburgers, and cakes. She is very grateful for the financial opportunity presented her via this medium, and commits to repaying her loan as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as cookies, sweets, sodas, refreshments, hamburgers, and cakes.

loans.name: Bibi Khadeja Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Bibi Khadeja. It has three members. Together, they have requested a group loan of 30,000 AFN. 

Bibi Khadeja is the group leader. She is 39 years old, and is married with four children. She would like a loan to advance her quilt sewing business and buy materials.

The second member is Nazellah. She would like a loan for her tailoring business; she wants to buy a new sewing machine. 

The third member is Madena.  She would like a loan for her bakery, to buy firewood and a new shop. She hopes to have more clients and to increase her monthly income.

Finally, they would like to say that they admire the loan process in Afghanistan and its benefits for entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and buy materials for a quilting business

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar, a 28-year-old married man with two young children, has been working as a farmer for the past 12 years. He learned this occupation from his father who also worked in the agriculture sector. He cultivates all types of vegetables and distributes the harvest to the market to be sold. Today, Omar is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to increase his production.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en:
Although an older woman, Floricita still wants to be productive. Thus, she is requesting a larger loan amount from Kiva through ASHI for her second loan. This loan will be used to grow her small sari-sari (variety) store, which was put up using profits from her previous business. Since two of her three children have their own families now, Floricita will use her proceeds to support the education of her youngest and only child dependent. She also wants to support the needs of her grandchildren, since their parents are also poor.

Floricita's dreams and ambitions for her children and grandchildren are why she has remained strong and determined to grow her business, despite being poor and widowed.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell in her store, and to buy a hog/pig for fattening and selling

loans.name: Pita

texts.en: Pita J. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, beans and groundnut (peanut) paste and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell. Pita is 30 years old and is married to a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 33 years old and is married with one kid who is 1 year old.

Faustin is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of jewelry, as his photo indicates. This is his fourth successful year in this business, which he operates from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Faustin is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to improve his business. In addition, he wants to start another source of income by selling soft drinks, which hopefully will increase his revenue.

Faustin has a vision of keeping his businesses sustainable through reinvesting more in them.

loans.use: To buy additional jewelry and also soft drinks as another business

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 29-year-old engaged man living with his parents. He's an experienced hairdresser, having ten years of experience. In 2003, he opened his own barber shop in his hometown. This man caters to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods.

Today, Nizar wishes to improve the decor of his barbershop and buy a new desk. He will also increase his merchandise such as shampoos, gels, sprays, etc. In order to do so, he is requesting a $1,200 loan.

Nizar is certain that, with the help of the loan, his business productivity will be increased and he will be able to collect more savings for his wedding.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop, buy a new desk, and increase his merchandise

loans.name: Lucebel

texts.en:
Lucebel N., 27 years old, owns and manages a small sari-sari (variety) store and also has a farm. She has two children, her eldest child being 6 years old. She would like to ensure that her children have a better future.

Lucebel wants to have a bigger farm in the future and that is why she labors so hard to be able to save money to realize her dreams. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 11,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store and farm supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies plus additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 23 and runs a retail shop in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years. She was previously employed in a pharmacy. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her stock of sugar, rice and flour for her business. Ruth is a member of Joy Partners Self Help Group and the members of the group have guaranteed her loan. She wants to own residential and commercial houses in the future. She plans to grow her business to a supermarket in five years. She describes herself as hard working.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus padres, tiene 10 años trabajando en el negocio de venta de relojes y accesorios; anteriormente lo manejaba su padre el cual es mayor edad, ademas realiza servicios de reparacion y limpieza de relojes, realiza compras quincenales en lima o le realizan envios de acuerdo a su necesidad. Cuenta con una experiencia crediticia en Mi Banco por credito vigente para su negocio. Solicita financiamiento para remodelacion de mobiliario; compras de vitrinas para su negocio
texts.en:
The applicant is single, and he lives in a rented house with his parents. He has been working in the business of selling watches and accessories for ten years. His father, who is elderly, previously ran the business. He also does repairs and cleans watches. He makes his purchases in Lima every two weeks, or they send him shipments as needed. He has loan experience in his bank; he has a loan for his business. He is requesting a loan to remodel his furnishings and buy display cases for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy display cases to show his products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma C. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Gemma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling used clothing locally known as "ukay ukay" and some ready-to-wear items. Gemma has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single mother of two children and her two children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Catherine resides in and owns a three roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, school fees and treatment.She owns a stall in Naguru selling vegetables like tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She buys these vegetables from Nakawa Market and uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping on a daily basis.  

Catherine wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and banana leaves. Besides this business she also sells piped water at her home. During morning hours she sells in the market and during lunch time she goes to her home and again sells from there. She sells to all types of people both in retail and wholesale.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenge is the change of seasons.  Catherine aspires to see her business grow, earn enough profits to educate her children up to university and also start going to farmers directly .  She joined MCDT because they were caring and very cooperative.

loans.use: To buy more  boxes of  tomatoes, onions and banana leaves

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi N. K. is 26 years old, married, and has one child aged four and half years old. Her business is located at Muthurwa, a very busy open-air market on the outskirts of Nairobi city centre. She sells clothes and CDs to walk-in customers. She has been in this business for the last three years. Naomi says that business is very good and profitable. The only major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area operating the same kind of business so customers are spoiled for choice. However, Naomi works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to add to her stock of clothes to meet her customers' needs.
In the future, Naomi sees herself importing clothes for resale by herself and owning her own plot where she will build a house. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William E. is from the town of Pangal Norte, Echague. He is 56 years old, married, and has one adult child. To make a living, William owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. William has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, William joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. William has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. William is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the same items. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by William from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishemen/women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Ma. Fe owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Ma. Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and feeds for her pigs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Nació en una familia agricultora y desde entonces le enseñaron los conocimientos con respecto a esta labor. Hoy a lado de su esposo, cultivan papa y olluco sobre terrenos que le fue heredado, asimismo procuran siempre en tenerlos protegidos de la plaga de insectos. Por otro lado, también se dedica a pastar sus animales en el campo, es por ello que cuenta con la ayuda de su familia, por que saben lo duro que es este trabajo. Se siente muy tranquila porque tiene dos ingresos, tanto la venta de animales, como la de su cosecha, y por ello desea seguir ampliando sus terrenos agrícolas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra y también comprara más cerdos.
texts.en:
Eva is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She was born into a farming family and they taught her their knowledge of the business. Today, at her husband’s side, she grows potatoes and ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) on lands that she inherited. They also try to always have their crops protected from insects. She also works tending her animals in the countryside. She knows how hard the work is, which is why she has the help of her family. She feels calm because she has two sources of income – both her animal sales and her crops. This is why she wants to continue expanding her agricultural lands.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been very responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive people. She is grateful for the people who will fund the loan, as it will be very useful for her in helping her business progress. With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for planting season and also to buy more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mkusima Ene

texts.en:
Mkusima has been practicing livestock farming for three years in Naivasha town.  She is 42 years old, married to Koira ole Seraya and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy five sheep and 10 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Mkusino hopes to have a dairy farm in future to sell her milk products in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy five  sheep and 10 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Obidio

texts.es: Obidio, de 29 años, es un hombre tímido pero trabajador, convive con María, de 20 años; ambos tienen un hijo; Ángelo de un año y 7 meses de nacido. Los tres viven en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Desde ya algunos años, se dedica al arado de la tierra; actividad que lo aprendió desde muy pequeño, que con ayuda de dos toros puede remover la tierra, lista para poder sembrar, sea papa o arveja. Por otro lado procura siempre mantener muy saludables a sus animales, ya que son su principal herramienta de trabajo. Paralelamente a estas actividades, una manera de generarse ingresos económicos es vender los productos que cosecha, en temporadas muy fructíferas la venta lo realiza dentro de su mismo campo agrícola, así evita hacer gasto de transporte. Su mayor anhelo es construir su propia casa, ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho compartir experiencias con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, remedio y guano, productos naturales que fortalecerá los cultivos de papa que sembrará.
texts.en:
Obidio, 29, is a shy but hard working man.  He lives with María, 20.  They have a son, Ángelo, who is a year and 7 months old.  The three of them live in his mother’s house in Chiras.

For a few years now he has worked tilling the fields, a task he learned as a little boy.  He has two bulls that help him till the soil leaving it ready for planting either potatoes or peas.

On the other hand, he always strives to keep his animals very healthy because they are his main work tools.  

In order to earn income he also sells the products he harvests.  During very fruitful seasons he makes his sales at his own fields in order to save transportation costs.  

His greatest wish is to build his own house because he wants to provide his family with a better quality of life.

This is his 4th loan with MFP.  He enjoys sharing experiences with his fellow communal bank members.

He will use the requested funds to buy manure, remedy and guano, natural products that will strengthen the potato crops he will plant.

loans.use: To buy manure and guano to strengthen the potato crops.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family. 

She has operated her greengrocery business for two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Tima faces a major challenge due to high transport cost in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business.  

With the 20,000 KES she wants to stock vegetables for her stall. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To stock vegetables for her vegetable stall

loans.name: Somoina Ene

texts.en:
Somoina O., aged 42, trades livestock in Bissil market in Kajiado, which is a busy market. She sells her livestock to the Kenya meat commission, Kajiado butchers and the people in Kitengela. She is married to Lepatu, who is a farmer, and together they have three children aged 20, 18 and 14 years.

Somoina was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has been running her livestock trading business for 10 years and she gets a monthly profit of 4,000 KES.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Somoina plans to use 10,000 KES to buy cows, 5,000 KES to buy goats and 5,000 KES to buy sheep all for trading. If the loan boosts the business, she will start supplying her cattle directly to the Kenya meat commission.

Somoina’s dream is to buy a pickup for transporting meat to Nairobi and cattle to the Kenya meat commission. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep for trade

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 43 years old. Judith is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Judith raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith wants to improve her family's living conditions and she works hard to achieve it.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 27 years old and married with one child. He operates a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business in Kiambu. He has been running this business for four years. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to buy another motorcycle. He is a member of Nuru Investment SHG and this loan is guaranteed by the group. Benard also earns extra income through farming. He hopes to be financially stable in five years' time.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain plant health

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 55 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Sara, y sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los cuales cuida, educa y cría, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El pilar de su vida, es la agricultura, y aunque a veces tiene altibajos y complicaciones, él sigue adelante. Ya tiene 35 años dedicándose a esto, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas, olluco y oca, los cuales cuida y fertiliza todos los fines de semana, ya que está trabajando en una empresa de construcción, cuyo proyecto es la creación en una hidroeléctrica en la zona. Pero a pesar del poco tiempo que dispone Antonio, esperar tener una buena calidad de sus productos en está nueva cosecha, que le constará mucho esfuerzo, ya que necesitan mayor cuidado, por épocas de lluvia. Para más adelante desea obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, e incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y está segura que seguirá trabajando de manera activa y responsable por el desarrollo de su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito solicitado, invertirá en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 55 years old.  He lives with his wife Sara and their three young children who he looks after, educates and raises in his own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

The pillar of Antonio's life is farming and although he sometimes has his ups and downs and complications he continues to get ahead in life.  He has been a farmer for 35 years.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, 'olluco' and 'oca' (these last two being native tubers).  He looks after his crops and fertilizes them every weekend since he also works for a construction company which is building a hydroelectric power station in the area.

In spite of the fact that Antonio doesn't have much time, he hopes to produce good quality crops in his next harvest.  This will require a lot of hard work since they need more looking after during rainy periods.  He would like, in the future, to obtain more farming land and to increase his production.

This is Antonio's sixth loan with MFP and he is certain that he will continue working actively and responsibly with his community bank.  He will invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic manure which he will spread on his different crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry A. is from the village of Mapuroc in San Mateo. He is 39 years old. Jerry is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry plants, harvests, and sells rice. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be Jerry's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 24 years old, married and has two children.

Azhar learned to be a seamstress from her mom, so in 2008, she opened her own sewing business for women and baby clothes. She is well known in her local area and has an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy two new sewing machines and a generator. She is aiming to expand her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two new sewing machines and a generator

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang C., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. C. sells groceries, earning an average income of $10 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhon H., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sarat Chhorn, 29, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have two young sons. 

Sokhon is a motorbike and bicycle repairman. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase spare motorcycle parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de una filmadora para trabajar en eventos

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan K., 42, is a sewing worker in the garment industry in Phnom Penh City. She has worked at this job for over three years, and she gets a fixed salary every month. The family has another earner in her husband who is a construction worker. They have three single children who all still study in school. 

Chhan K. would like to ask for her loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her traveling needs. She says she always spends at least thirty percent of her gross salary for transportation costs. This loan will save her expenses on motor taxi fees.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her traveling needs.

loans.name: Iranete Frederico

texts.pt:
Iranete Frederico D. Conceiçaõ nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casaD. mãe de 1 filho de  08 anos de idade e vai a Escola. Fez 6ª classe não continuou devido a doença do pai e não teve mais condições financeiras para ir mais avante. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum valor para despesas de casa.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane com seu marido quando construiram a sua residência. Tem um negocio proprio de venD. de roupa usaD. e exerce esta actividade ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria porque tem ajuD. do seu marido que trabalha nas minas D. Africa do Sul.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (fardos de roupa usaD.  de crianças e adultos) para aumentar a quantidade D. sua mercadoria. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para aumentar aquantidade D. sua mercadoria e adiquirir um meio de transporte para auxiliar na compra de sues produtos.
texts.en:
Iranete Frederico D. Conceiçaõ was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one 8-year-old son who goes to school. She attended school through the 6th grade, but had to leave school when her father got sick and her family no longer had the economic resources for her to continue. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents by sending some money to cover their household expenses.
She and her husband left Maputo for Boane when they built their house. She has had her own business selling second-hand clothing for more than four years. She doesn't have any employees, and brings in about 6000 meticals a month, which is enough to cover some expenses and also save a little in a bank account, since her husband also supports the household working in South African mines.
She's never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a neighbor who is also a Hluvuku client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she intends to use to buy merchandise (bales of used clothing for children and adults) to increase her stock. Her previous loan was for 10,000 meticals for her business.
She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that she'll be eligible for others in the future. She intends to apply for additional loans to increase her stock and to purchase a vehicle that will be helpful when she buys her goods.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (bales of used clothing for children and adults).

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin lives in the Negev. She is a 25-year-old mother of four. She owns a small beauty salon for make-up and waxing and now is expanding to bridal rentals, nail extensions and manicures.

Nasrin needed this loan to purchase bridal dresses for rental and beauty salon supplies.

In the future Nasrin wants to open a large bridal salon in the center of her village and employ part-time staff to assist her.

loans.use: To purchase bridal dresses for rental and beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: From Ornlong Veng district, Mrs. Toem is a 42-year-old married woman who is able to earn a low income by selling snacks to her neighbors and other passersby around her village. From this business, she can generate a profit of about US $5 a day to manage the financial expenses of her whole family. Her husband also assists her in the same business. They are blessed with two children; one is married and works as a teacher and the other one is single and still enrolled in school. Mrs. Toem will be using her loan to buy some piglets to raise and sell when they are big.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso solicita un préstamo para comprar material D. construcción ya que le esta haciendo falta un cuarto y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el block, arena y cemente que es el material que le esta haciendo falta para empezar L. construcción. 

Pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe D. su trabajo como empleado D. L. ciudad oficial administrativo, y su esposa L. señora Aurelia se encargara D. los gastos familiares en el sueldo que recibe D. su trabajo en una fabrica.
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan su propio espacio en L. casa.
texts.en:
Alfonso is requesting a loan to buy construction material because he needs a room.  At this time he does not have the money he needs to buy the block, sand, and cement; which is the material needed to start the construction.

He will pay back the loan with the income he gets from his work.  He is employed as a city administrative officer.  His wife, Aurelia, handles the family expenses with the salary she receives working in a factory.

They want their two children to have their own space in the house.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 50, is married and blessed with 3 children. She has been managing a retail store for almost 10 years. She earns 2,500 PHP a month. She's asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her store. She plans to save more from her income for future emergencies. Also, she wants her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 36 years old, married, and has four children aged 2 to 14. He sells motors, welding machines, and battery chargers to locals. Jeremiah has been running this business for 12 years. He intends to use his loan to buy materials for making machinery. This includes copper wire, switches, and cotton tape.

Jeremiah plans to use the profits from his business to take care of his family. In the future, he hopes to own a large manufacturing company. Jeremiah describes himself as committed.

loans.use: to buy materials such as copper wire, switches, and cotton tape.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
La señora Dora Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 65 años quien tiene un pequeño y modesto comedor desde hace 10 años en Ticuantepe. Ella lo inicio con pocos recursos y con el tiempo lo fue aumentando. Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne…etc.
Ella tiene un nieto a su cargo a quién le ayuda en los estudios.
texts.en:
Dora Luz is a hard-working and enterprising 65 year old woman.  She has had a small and modest eatery in Ticuantepe for ten year.  She started it with few resources, and in time it got bigger.

She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, and meat, etc.

She has a grandson under her care, and she helps with his education.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, and meat, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 81 years old and a divorced mother of four children who are all adults. She is a farmer from eastern Kenya where she has been farming for 60 years. Her mixed farm produces potatoes, cabbages, maize and carrots, which she sells at the local market. Her major challenge in this business has been the difficulty in getting farm inputs, which affects her production.

With this loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings, she intends to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk to earn her more income. The proceeds from this loan will help her improve her living standards. She plans to expand her dairy farming in the future by acquiring at least three dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Redelyn

texts.en: Redelyn is 34 years old, married, has five children and lives in the town of Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She has been in this line of work for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more pigs to raise and sell. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a year, and hopes to improve her business so that she can earn enough money to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en: Korto is 29 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has two children aged 7 and 11 years old. Both of them are presently in school. For the past five years, she has been selling oil, spices and rice in the local market. She enjoys her business a lot because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil and spices for her business. She wants to send her children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and spices for her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a 38-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has a hog-raising business. Myrna built a backyard piggery where she raises pigs to sell at the market. Myrna works hard to help provide for her family. She requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Myrna hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es:
Agripino nació en la ciudad de Urubamba, tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Agripino vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es docente y trabaja en la comunidad de Wilcapata, él también se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Agripino requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Agripino was born in the city of Urubamba. He is 39 years old and he and his partner have two children. Currently, Agripino lives and works in the city of Cuzco. He is a teacher in the Wilcapata neighborhood. He also raises small animals like guinea pigs. Agripino needs this loan to buy feed for his guinea pigs.
The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy feed for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Donitilda

texts.es: Donitilda tiene 43 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora, convive con su pareja y es madre de cinco hijos de 27, 25, 20, 14 y 5 años, quienes viven con ella en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo trabajan duro para brindarles educación y alimentación a sus hijos. Su trabajo consiste en brindar servicio mecánico, pues posee un taller que montó junto a uno de sus hijos,  quien estudio mecánica de motores durante dos años. Desde entonces se han hecho socios de éste taller, siendo Donitilda la encargada de proveer los materiales, mientras que su hijo se encarga de reparar. Le esta yendo bien, pues tienen muchos clientes, y esto debido a los conocimientos que tiene su hijo. Su taller, es un espacio alquilado en una zona llamada Pucallpillo, un barrio dentro de la ciudad. Segun manifiesta le gusta lo que hace, además de que está a lado de su hijo, puede generar ingresosos para su familia. Mas adelante desearía vender combustibles y aceites paravehículos. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, y espera el apoyo de ustedes para consolidar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará lubricantes y repuestos para implementar su taller, asimismmo comprará herramientas.
texts.en:
Donitilda is 43 years old.  She is a kind and entrepreneurial woman who lives with her partner.  She has five children, aged 27, 25, 20, 14 and 5,  who live with her in her own home.  She and her husband work hard in order to educate and feed their children.

Donitilda's business is providing an auto repair service.  She owns an auto repair shop which she set up with one of her children who studied motor  mechanics for two years.  Since then, they have worked as partners in the repair shop.  Donitilda is in charge of providing the materials while her son is in charge of repairing the vehicles.  It is going well and they have many customers as a result of her son's knowledge.  The shop is located in rented premises in an area called Pucallpillo, a neighborhood within the city.  Donitilda tells us that she enjoys what she does, enjoys being alongside her son and is able to make income for her family.  In the future, she would like to sell vehicle fuel and oils.

This will be Donitilda's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can consolidate her business.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy lubricants and spare parts to equip her workshop.  She will also buy tools.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, spare parts and tools

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et font la tontine ensemble. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Marie est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Marie est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à Sourou, un dépanneur. Le couple a cinq enfants dont un reste encore à leur charge. Marie n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Marie mène comme activité la vente des noix de palme.A côté de cette activité,Marie vend du vin de palme. Marie exerce ces activités depuis près de quarante ans. Marie  s'approvisionne en noix et en vin de palme dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Marie et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The JESUKPEGO group has three members that live in the same neighborhood and save in the same tontine. The group's representative, Marie has her hand raised in the photo. To increase sales and to better serve their clients, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDE for the 5th time. Marie is 51 years old and married to Sourou, a repairman. The couple takes care of their five children. Marie never attended school. In order to satisfy her various needs, she sells palm nuts. As a side business, she also sells palm wine. She has been in business for almost 40 years. Marie purchases her nuts and wine in a city of Benin. In an effort to strengthen her business and better server her clients, Marie and the other members of JESUKPEGO are requesting a loan from ALIDE. Their goal is to grow the business.  Their past loans have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and palm wine.

loans.name: María Doralba

texts.es:
Al separarse de su esposo y quedando como madre cabeza de hogar, María Doralba se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio con el fin obtener los recursos necesarios para su sustento y el de su familia. Aprovechando los conocimientos que por hobbie había adquirido en las técnicas de belleza, inició con su peluquería que según esta emprendedora ha sido su tabla de salvación.

María Doralba, sueña con tener su propio local y lograr expandirse, conservando la calidad y mejorando constantemente el excelente servicio que presta a su clientela. Es por eso que con la ilusión de seguir progresando quiere comprar más productos de belleza y accesorios necesarios para brindar más calidad y servicio, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita cumplir sus metas y sueños, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, María Doralba became the head of her household and found it necessary to create her own business in order to obtain the necessary income to sustain herself and her family. Taking advantage of the knowledge of beauty techniques she had gained from a hobby, she started the hairstyling business which she says has been her lifesaver. 

María Doralba dreams of having her own premises and expanding, while maintaining the quality of the excellent service she gives her customers and constantly improving it. This is why, in the hopes of further progress, she wants to buy more beauty products and accessories necessary to provide more quality and service. The reason she is asking for a loan is to achieve her goals and dreams, improve her sales and proportionally improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new products and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Helder

texts.es: Helder, de 53 años, es un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador. Convive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos, en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza, es el acopio de cabezas de ganado vacuno, animales que compra a los mismos productores y los vende fuera de su localidad a mejores precios, asismimso se dedica en la crianza de terneras. Tiene quince años realizando ésta actividad, y hasta el momento su esposo la ha apoyado, en la siembra y cosecha de pasto, que es el forraje principal para sus animales. Lo que le gusta de su actividad porque le permite tener ingresos económicos y con ello puede pagar a su personal y cubrir los gastos de su hogar, así como los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora su próposito es aumentar el número de animales. Este sería el crédito número 21 con la institución MFP, siendo el más antiguo de su grupo comunal, considera que todas son personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el préstamo recibido, comprará más terneras.
texts.en: Helder, who is 53 years old, is an enterprising and hard-working man.  He lives in the company of his partner and their three children in their own home.  His business is to gather up heads of cattle, which he purchases straight from the producers, and then sell them outside his town at a better price.  Likewise, he  raises calves himself.  He has been in this business for fifteen years.  His wife has supported him by planting and harvesting grass, which is his animals' main fodder.  What he likes about his business is that it allows him enough income to cover his personal expenses as well as the household expenses and his children's education.  Now his plan is to increase his number of livestock.  This will be his 21st loan with MFP; he is the longest standing member of his communal bank.  He feels that all the members of his communal bank are responsible people who punctually repay their loans.  With loan he has received, Helder will purchase more calves.

loans.use: to purchase more calves.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 10 children. 

Franklin provides motorcycle-taxi or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle-taxi services.

Franklin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Franklin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcyle-taxi services.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en: Francis is doing fine with his business. He used the previous loan to open a stationary business. He is doing fine with his family.  He wants a loan to increase his stationary business. The group is doing fine because they have finished their four-month period smoothly and have come to ask for a new loan.

loans.use: to increase his stationary stock.

loans.name: Wendy Group

texts.es: Loa nuevos integrantes son la señora Juana va a comprar con su prestamo cafe "XN" para diabetico y el joven Ivan va a comprar zapotos por mayoreo, las demas integrantes sigen en su actividad que vienen desempeñando. La señora Ana María tiene 60 años de edad, ella es viuda tiene 6 hijos 3 mujeres y 3 varones todos mayores de edad ya casados e independientes, ella tiene un taller de costura, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilos, tela, cierres, bies, botones, tijeras, alfileres, agujas, cinta métrica y una parte para lo que necesite en su casa, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años a ella le gusta coser confecciona  faldas, blusas, vestidos y trajes de bailables de la escuela , también pone cierres, ella no estudio corte pero ella trabajo medio año con una señora que tenía su taller de costura ponía cierres, componía faldas y le gusto, ella pensó en poner su taller y no sentirse sola, su negocio es importante porque le gusta confeccionar faltas y blusas, su negocio es conocido por el buen precio y por la calidad de su trabajo, ella utiliza las ganancias para pagar la luz el agua, sus sueños y esperanza son si Dios le presta vida abrir su negocio de jugos, paletas, esquimos y que sus hijos estén bien de salud y en su trabajo. Los integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su apoyo, son muy amables de su parte darnos estos préstamos sin conocernos y nos van ayudar mucho a crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
The new members are Juana who will use her loan to by “XN” coffee for diabetics; and Ivan who will buy shoes in quantity.  The rest of the members will continue in their businesses.

Ana María is 60 years old.  She’s a widow and has six adult children, three daughters and three sons, all adults, married, and on their own.  She has a sewing shop and requested her loan to buy thread, fabric, zippers, snaps, buttons, scissors, pins, needles, measuring tapes, and some things that she needs in her home.  She started her business three years ago and she likes making skirts, blouses, dresses, and dance outfits for schools.  She also adds zippers.  She did not study sewing formally, but she worked for another lady who had a workshop, adding zippers, for six months.  She also repaired skirts and she liked it and thought about starting her own workshop so that she would not feel alone.  Her business is important because she likes making skirts and blouses, and it’s well known for its good prices and quality.  She uses the earnings to pay for water and electricity.  Her hopes and dreams are, God willing, to start an amusement business, including sweets and ice cream, and that her children remain well in their health and work.

The group’s members would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your support.  You are very friendly for giving us these loans without knowing us.  They will help us very much in growing our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Annaliza has a shop that sells green leafy vegetables like "kangkong" & "alugbati". She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Annaliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking mother. She is a widower and has three grown up children. In the absence of her husband, she carries the burden alone in providing for her family's needs. She raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting to sell. With this kind of work, she is able to generate an income just enough for their needs. She pays a laborer too who helps her do farming activities.

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow. She would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is married with four children. Irenea is 53 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Irenea owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Irenea has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Irenea hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un gran hombre de 46 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre diez y veinticinco años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lorenzo para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como piloto de automóvil, el lleva 20 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, por sus años de experiencia tiene mucha clientela.
Lorenzo con el afán de contar con un lugar mejor donde poder cultivar ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una cuerda de terreno con cultivo, él desde hace varios años había querido comprar un terreno pero no le ha sido posible por eso tiene todos las esperanzas de conseguir pronto su crédito y aprovechar esta oportunidad. Su esperanza de vida es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de una cuerda de terreno con cultivo.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has one son. Her husband helps her with the business and her son is in college. Yelena attended University and after graduating she worked for a time as a merchandising expert. However, the need for higher income - to help meet her family’s needs and ensure her son’s education - prompted her to move into the market business selling groceries. Yelena has gained much rich experience working in the market trade. Her perseverance and diligent work have been keys to her success. The availability of loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” has also been a big help to her business. Just recently, Yelena was able to purchase a stand in the busiest market in the city. Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,200 for several purposes. She’d like to increase her turnover capital, purchase additional merchandise, and buy a new refrigerator to store perishable food items. Fresh dairy products, canned corn, peas, fruit and quality vegetable oil are just some of the many items Yelana beautifully arranges on her stand to attract customers in the busy market. The ability to purchase more items and get a new refrigerator to keep groceries fresh will help Yelena meet the high demand for these food items. Increased business income will generate more funds to help pay for her son’s college tuition and continue to secure her family’s well-being.

Олена – одружена, має сина. Її чоловік допомагає їй з бізнесом, син навчається в університеті. Олена має вищу освіту. Після закінчення вузу деякий час працювала товарознавцем. Однак потреба в грошах та необхідність забезпечити навчання для сина примусили її почати власний бізнес з продажу продуктів харчування. Олена має багатий досвід торгівлі на ринку. Наполеглива праця забезпечила їй успіх в бізнесі. Можливість користуватися позиками „Надії України” також відіграла неабияку роль в розвитку її бізнесу. Зовсім нещодавно Олена придбала прилавок на найбільшому ринку міста. Олена просить про позику в 1200 доларів через декілька причин. Вона планує збільшити робочий капітал, розширити асортимент продтоварів та купити нову холодильну камеру для того, щоб зберігати продукти, що можуть зіпсуватися. Свіжі молочні продукти, консервовані кукурудза, горох, фрукти та олія – це лише деякі найменування товарів, які Олена пропонує своїм покупцям. Можливість розширити асортимент товарів харчування та придбати новий холодильник для зберігання продуктів допоможе Олені задовольнити потреби покупців. Дохід від торгівлі допоможе Олені отримати гроші для того, щоб заплатити за навчання сина та забезпечити добробут своєї родини.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for groceries

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
Florante lives in an impoverished rural community outside the city of Trou-du-Nord, Haiti where she travels to sell cooking ingredients from a small stand along the street. Her business is dedicated to financing the economic care of her four children as well as a source of savings to improve their home and living conditions. In order to bring herself closer to her goals of providing adequately for her children, she has requested this loan to expand her inventory to include more basic food staples that are popular items to sell so that she can become more self sustainable. Currently Florante only sells a couple of ingredients that she has managed to turn into a business and has demonstrated that she is ready to take her business further with the opportunity this loan provides for her.

NOTE: Florante is a member of an Bank of Hope solidarity group, along with nine other entrepreneurs. They will be accountable to one another for paying back this loan of $1,200. This group lending method requires group members to help one another throughout the loan repayment process. Loans are paid back as a group. If one person is deficient on their loan, the group must make up the difference. Everyone in Florante's group has gone through Esperanza's training and proven to be responsible and determined to invest in their business and care for their children.

loans.use: Purchase additional cooking supplies to round out her inventory

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana makes woolen shawls. She works by herself. Her husband is a laborer and they have school-aged children. They live in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz where her workshop is located. She would like to increase her working capital and make more shawls. This is her third loan from IMPRO. She is a first-class borrower with a good record of repayment--she repaid her two previous loans in full. She hopes to use this loan to buy wool, cloth and thread. She has good experience and a good track record as a borrower and will earn enough to cover the loan in addition to all her personal and household expenses.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.
