Valeriana elabora mantas de tela y lana, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es albañil, sus hijos están en edad escolar. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II donde tiene su taller; su objetivo es contar con más capital y así poder elaborar mantas en cantidad. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. Los anteriores dos créditos han sido pagados en su totalidad. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, lana e hilo) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos necesarios para cubrir el préstamo y todas las necesidades personales y del hogar.

loans.use: To buy wool, cloth and thread.

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mwajabu is a 56-year-old energetic and dynamic mother of eight, a resident of the Kigamboni area in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop selling cosmetics and a commuter bus for transport services within Kigamboni area, for which she employs a driver. She has been in business for the past four years, and ever since she joined micro finance institutions her life has positively changed. She attended business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation, and the knowledge she acquired has helped her improve her businesses.

She has recently repaid a loan of USD 750 within a shorter period of time than agreed, and now she is greatly in need of another USD 1200, to buy more stock for her shop and recondition her commuter bus.

loans.use: Expand business and recondition her commuter bus

loans.name: Ruhiyye

texts.en:
Ruhiyye N. was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory, the Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. 

She is 31 years old and a mother of three children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. She is currently homeless and is staying in a worker’s hostel in Sumgayit city. Ruhiyye opened her business 1998 by selling a small variety of vegetables in front of the hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family’s food and important consumption needs. Her husband assisted her with the small business. She wants to borrow $500 to open a larger counter vegetable section and hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months.

loans.use: Open a larger vegetable counter section.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. was born in the district of Changalane in Namaacha, province of Maputo. He studied until the 10th grade. When he was 17 years old, he married and had 4 children. He worked in agriculture cultivating vegetables and raising cattle.

He was introduced to Hluvuku through friends. Manuel requested a loan of 20.000mt to buy more cattle. Today he is selling his products from his shop. It brings the products close to the residents saving the cost of travelling to buy meat. He manages the business with his wife. In the future, Manuel wants his business to grow.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. Actividade: Comércio Valor De Empréstimo: 20.000,00Mt(800.00USS) Aplicação:Compra de cabeças de gaD. pra revenda Inicio:12/09/2007 Fim: 04/01/2009

Manuel Groning Gonçalves D. V. Nasceu em Changalane distrito de Namaacha Provincia de Maputo,Estudou até a 10 classe deviD. a debelidade financeira.. Aos 17 anos juntou se maritalmente, o qual resultou 4 filhos estanD. ainda juntos até o Ano corrente, para a sua sobrevivência dedicou-se a agricultura na produção de hortícolas donde acabou por criar o talho pra venda de carne de vaca. Conhece a Hluvuku através de conversas com amigos no distrito e dai aproximou-se e solicitou empréstimo, com este empréstimo de 20.000,00Mt pretende incrementar o volume D. seu negocio de venda de carne de vaca compranD. cabeças de gaD. para abate.

Actualmente, esta exploranD. um talho que é o único na vila de boane que oferece bom ambiente de negocio e tem contribuíD. pra colocar o Produto mais perto D. consumidor reduzinD. desta forma os custos deslocação . Ele dirige pessoalmente o seu estabelecimento e na sua ausência a sua esposa e os rendimento da venda encrementa na renda familiar E no crescimento D. seu estabelecimento. Pretende futuramente ampliar o seu estabelecimento e as suas machambas.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her store with various products.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.en:
Augusto and Melva B. are self-made entrepreneurs who own a simple convenience store in their town of Ciudad del Este. They have three children who are all older and who live and work outside the house.

Seven years ago, Augusto and his wife opened their store with the help of their eldest son. To help manage the store, Melva learned to balance her time between domestic work and store work. They wish to continue being self sufficient and not depend on their sons for financial help.

Their plans are to continue growing their business, however they need the help of a loan to buy goods like sugar, flour, cooking oil, cleaning products, and drinks. Augusto and Melva are dynamic individuals who are committed to always working towards a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, noodles, cooking oil, other foods and household products.

loans.name: Busiya East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to uplift business and make more profits. Sarah is 33 years old and is married. She has s 4 children ranging from age to and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and sustain them financially. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Rose N., Monic N., and Rose N.. Sarah N. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to expand business. Rose N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Monic N. operates a business of sugar wax and wants to boost business. Rose N. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To add in clothe business and improve it

loans.name: Bon

texts.en: Bon, who owns a soup stand, has received loans from Kiva twice before. She has successfully paid back each loan on time. Now she hopes to carry on her partnership with Kiva in order to acheive continued business growth.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bulk-buy goods for a grocery store.

loans.name: Norvi

texts.en: Norvi H. is a fishmonger in Ghana. She is married and has three children. Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings it home for processing.  She then resells the fish to her customers.  Norvi has experienced increased demand for fish from her customers, and wants to expand her business.  She is therefore asking for a loan of $525 to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the inventory of a small underwear shop to include pants and shirts

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes belongs to the “Las Golondrinas 2” comunal bank and she lives in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, is a widow, and has 9 children, all of whom are adults. Her father, her 37 year-old single son, and 3 grandchildren live with her. The money that her son gives her from his taxi driver job isn’t enough to make ends meet. Therefore, with the firs loan of S/. 300.00 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in buying and selling fruits and ice creams. She currently runs the business from her home. Lourdes gets up very early in order to make breakfast for her father, son, and grandchildren before going to the market to make her purchases for the day. She then prepares lunch and tends to her business. She finishes her work at 9:00pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 200 oranges, 200 tangerines, and 200 ice creams. Each day is a challenge for Lourdes. She is very happy for the opportunity provided by Manuela Ramos to obtain a loan and thereby help her grandchildren, who are her greatest treasure.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”domiciliada en el Jr: espinar Nº 371 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 61 años. Viuda, con 9 hijos todos mayores. Su papá, su hijo soltero de 37 años y sus 3 nietos menores viven con ella. El apoyo que le brinda su hijo que trabaja como motocarrista no le alcanza, es así que con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de frutas y chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio instalado en su propio domicilio. Lourdes se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno para su padre, hijo y nietos, para luego ir al mercado y realizar sus compras del día. Lourdes se da tiempo para preparar el almuerzo y atender su negocio. Termina su trabajo a las 9:00pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 2 cientos de naranja, 2 cientos de mandarina, 1 ciento de tanchello y 2 cientos de chupetes. Cada día, para Lourdes es un reto. Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir y así poder ayudar a sus nietos que son su mayor tesoro.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits at wholesale price and ice cream

loans.name: Edina L.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Edina S.. She is married and has four children aged between 13 and 27. In 2001, Edina established her red palm oil business. She opens her business six days a week and nine to twelve hours a day. Edina requires a loan in order to buy more red palm for extracting oil. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for S. client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more redpalm for extracting oil.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Le Thi K., aged 50, has been in TYM Fund since 2003. With the first loan worth VND 2 million, she bought and sold pork. Before joining TYM, she was experienced in this job. So since she had more capital, her business has been more profitable. Besides this business, her family raises some buffalos and pigs. Therefore, her economy is stable with the total income of VND 4.5 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy and sell more pork.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell more pork.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Al no tener estudios superiores, y buscando su independencia económica Betty se dedicó a la venta de golosinas, actividad que realiza desde hace ya dos años.  Tiene un triciclo donde ofrece golosinas de variados tipos, su clientela concurre asiduamente a comprar sus golosinas.  Usualmente trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la noche, ya que la venta es buena, lo dificultoso, es permanecer casi todo el día atendiéndolo, pero a Betty esto le es mínimo, ya que le gusta lo que hace.  Su deseo es asegurar su estabilidad económica, para en un futuro poder conformar una familia.  Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más golosinas y tener mejor equipado su triciclo.  En el futuro, Betty quiere tener una pequeña tiendita comercial, para lo cual está trabajando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Betty is 22 years old, unmarried and lives with her parents. Due to the fact that she did not attend secondary school, and in an attempt to be financially independent, for the past two years Betty has sold candy. She has a three-wheeled cart from which she sells candy of various types. Her customers return regularly to buy her sweets. Betty generally works from 9:00 in the morning till evening, because sales are good. The difficulty is the need to spent almost the entire day attending to business, but for Betty this is minor because she enjoys what she does. Her desire is to ensure her financial stability so that in the future she might be able to have a family. With the money that she has requested she wants to buy more candy and to better equip her cart. In the future she would like to have a small store, and she is gradually working towards this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy for sale

loans.name: Raftar

texts.en:
Raftar was born in 1971. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Zobcug village.
This single man has sold clothing and shoes for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy clothes and shoes to provide his clients with good services and to get more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Puth M. lives in Trapaing Svay village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more rice for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Puth M. is 55 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are workers in different positions, while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Hem Huon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith S. is a villager in Dock Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts to re-sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to re-sell door-to-door. Her husband, Mr. Saom Sambo, helps her in the current business.

Mrs. Rith S. is 46 years old and the mother of seven children three of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to re-sell and to buy a cart to transport her coconuts.

loans.name: Jane  Nakku ‘S Group

texts.en:
Jane is the leader of a five member group. She is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 12 and 14. Both of her children go to school. She also takes care of her old mother. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which four people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Jane deals in second-hand clothing in the Kibuye market in the city suburbs and works seven days a week. She buys clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Jane uses public transportation to go to and from work. She rents her business premises for 40,000 per month and sells retail. Before starting the business, she was a tailor. She sells to an average of ten customers a day and has been in this business for the last fourteen years. Jane has been in MCDT for five years and is now servicing her tenth loan, working all along with the same group mates. Jane wants to use this loan partly to buy more bales of clothing and partly to pay school fees for her children. She also aspires to own a permanent shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai O., 48, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She purchases rubber and sells it wholesale to the market, earning approximately $1.30 per day. Her husband makes around $3.50 a day  working as a taxi driver. This couple has four children, two of who are employed as construction workers and two are in school. Mrs. Thai is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband as the old one often breaks down and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: Purchase new motorcycle

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: LA sra. Wilma es una cliente antigua y muy puntual de la agencia, se dedica a realizar manualidades, como pintado en tela, bordado, macramé, muñecos en soft. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, sus nietos siempre están pendientes de ella. Dicta clases a señoras que deseen aprender a bordar y pintar en tela, y otras manualidades que ella sabe hacer. El crédito será invertido en la compra de material, como pintura, tela, hilos, etc. para dictar clases.
texts.en:
Wilma is one of the agency's oldest and most punctual (re-payment) clients. She dedicates herself to various craftworks such as fabric painting, embroidery, macrame, and doll-making. Her children are now adults, and her grandchildren always keep an eye out for her. She teaches classes to women who wish to learn how to make craftworks like fabric paintings and embroideries. The loan will be used to buy materials such as paint, fabrics, threads, etc. for use in her classes.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase craftwork materials

loans.name: Bashiran M.aftab Naz Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji has been a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan for the past 12 years. Her husband, M. N., runs a grocery shop in the community. Bashiran baji is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons work in a factory for a monthly wage and give half of their income to Bashiran baji. She invests their income in a committee, and plans to marry them off with the committee amount. Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

Bashiran baji’s group includes one other woman who lives in her locality. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia del Rosario C. B. tiene 34 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió corte y confección, carrera que no ejerció debido a que no le gustaba. Tiene 01 pequeño hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Cecilia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que inicio hace 18 años al mismo tiempo que vendía joyas, dejò su negocio debido a que consiguió trabajo y que ha vuelto a retomar hace poco tiempo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Ella es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”.  Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de belleza para su stock.
Cecilia sueña con tener una tienda de piñateria.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia del Rosario C. B. is 34 years old and lives in the Aurora Díaz settlement, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad Perú. She studied dressmaking, a career that she did not practice because she did not like it. She has one young son who depends entirely on her. Cecilia is dedicated to the sale of beauty products, a business that she began 18 years ago at the same time that she sold jewelry. She left her business when she found a job and she has returned to it recently. Her business is run out of her home. She is a new member of the communal bank “Las Auroras en Acción II”. With this loan of 300 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products for her stock. Cecilia dreams of having a piñata store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for her stock

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn S. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She owns a small business in the local market and is a Pro Hok (fermented fish paste) seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more Pro Hok to resell. Her husband, Mr. Yi Thoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Norn S. is 29 years old and has a 3 year old child. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Purchasing more Pro Hok to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Zeca João Ricardo

texts.pt:
Zeca nasceu em inhambane tem 27 anos de idade estudou ate a 10 classe  vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos o rapaz 5 anos e uma rapariga de 2 aninhos somenta o mais velho e que frequenta o centro infantil.

Apois concluir a 10 classe inscreve se para um curso de formaçao de professores onde não foi admitido, anos depois sai de inhambane a maputo onde trabalhava o seu pai pois este havia se divorciado da sua mae. Chegado a maputo seu pai consegue aranjar um emprego nos registo civil como brigadista. Mas devido ao seu desempenho ele foi promovido para categoria de assistente tecnico, e consequentimente e transferido para trabalhar em namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia, trabalha a mais de 10 anos e aufere por mês um valor de 3.257.00mt valor que não satisfaz as suas necessdades. Mas como queria tanto construir a sua propria casa, aproxima se aos nossos serviços solicitando um emprestimo para dar inicio da sua propria casa que cita a 75km de distancia da vila de namaacha. valor este que pagou com muito sucesso. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mae esta que vive em chimoio enviando lhe em cada 3 meses um valor de 1.000.00mt

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de zeca na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Os dois primeiros foram usados para comprar material de construçao para dar inicio da sua obra, estes 15.000.00mt seram usados para concluir  a mesma obra esta cienta que vai reembolsr antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo para fazer manutençao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Zeca was born in Inhambane and is 27 years old. He completed his studies through the 10th grade. He lives with his wife and is a father of two children, a 5-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter. The oldest attends preschool.

After completing the 10th grade, he enrolls in a teacher's development course where he was not admitted. Years later he leaves Inhambane for Maputo where his father worked. His father had divorced his mother. When he arrives in Maputo he gets a job in the civil registry. His good performance allowed for his promotion to technical assistant and consequent transfer to Namaacha, a town on the Swaziland border. He has worked for more than 10 years and receives 3257.00mt monthly, a salary that does not allow for a basic living standard. His desire to build his own house has lead him to ask for a loan in order to begin construction 75km outside of Namaacha.

Along with his children he is responsible for the care of his mother with whom he resides in Chimoio. He sends her 1000.00mt every 3 months.

This is Zeca's third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first two were used to purchase construction material to begin work on his house. The loan will be used to finish construction. Zeca believes that he will pay back the loan before the deadline and that he will ask for a new loan to perform maintenance on the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima B. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Zosima is widowed and has two school-aged children. Zosima operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zosima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish and for working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Zosima from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and for working capital

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru: Замирахон – 37 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также по пятницам на рынке "Джумабазар" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Замирахон закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Замирахон кредитуется у нас с 2005 года. Она очень хороший клиент. Замирахон просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Замирахон увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Zamirahon is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells children’s clothing. She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand, at the Djumabazar market on Fridays and at the Yakshanbebazar in the city of Khujand on Sundays. Zamirahon buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan and some merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there 2-3 times per month. Zamirahon has been our client since 2005. She is a very good client. Zamirahon is requesting this loan in order to buy a new stock of children’s summer clothing made from cotton fabric. Then, Zamirahon’s merchandise assortment will increase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer children's clothing

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru: Назаров Мирзокарим проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Мирзокарим более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить рис. Кроме помощи детей, этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Mirzokarim N. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 49 years old, married and has 6 children. Mirzokarim has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He primarily grows rice and sells it at a market. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds in order to plant rice. Besides help from his children, this business is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael lives in Lagos and she sells plastics, drinks, and kitchen items out of her house. She is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in her business for 10 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more plastics, drinks, and kitchen items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics, drinks, and kitchen items  to sell

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan S. is a 65-year-old single father and currently resides with his son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son is 20-year-old and helps in his father's business. Jargalsaihan rents a small stall in the local food market and sells various cut meat, including mutton, beef and goat meats in small pieces for locals. He usually purchases livestock, such as cattle, sheep and goats when price of livestock is low and sells them when meat price peaks during a year. Since the start in 2006, he has been quite successful with his business; his business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He says that he would like to expand his business as capital allows. Further, he would like to put aside some money for his son's future wedding, which he is very much looking forward to. 
He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for her meat retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for her meat retail business.

loans.name: Abduzabi

texts.en:
A. Abduzabi is 50 years old. He is married with two children. Since he was young he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that Abduzabi has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by IMON International. This support has been in the form of a loan which he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their locality. Today Abduzabi has once again come to IMON International for a loan which will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the young cattle

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been dreaming to uplift their ways of living. She is now 32 years old and she believes that life is too short; she hopes that before God take back her life, she already secure a good life for her children.  Her two children are both studying in the primary school and her husband is out of the country working as a driver in Saudi Arabia. There is nothing more she could asked for than to see her family moved out from poor living condition. She hopes that someday, her family will be together again living a comfortable life. 

Mary Jane is now managing her own general store which is located in their village at Cabisera 9 -11 Ilagan, Isabela. She started her business just before her husband left to work. She would like to expand her business that is why, she wanted to request for additional business capital amounting to PHP5, 000. She hopes that her loan will be provided because she needed to have additional working capital to grow up her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Wilson Ongore

texts.en:
Wilson is married and has three children: Emmanuel, age 24, Gabriel, age 21, and Cynthia, age 16.

Wilson has been in the vegetable supply business for nine years. His other source of income is from rental houses. He intends to use his loan to purchase a chemical spray machine to help his vegetable supply business and to renovate his rental houses. He was introduced to KADET through an existing borrower group and he has no previous credit history.

Wilson's area of business is densely populated with low income earners, who are Wilson's customers. With the profits Wilson earns, he intends to pay school fees for his children.

Wilson hopes to own an estate in the future, and he describes himself as determined and focused.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a chemical spray machine and to renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 55 years old and married with three children. Her children are all in school.

Toyin sells kitchen utensils like plates, pots, spoons, and so on. She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Heab

texts.en: Heab N. is a farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 30 and is married to Mr. Soaly, 28, who works with her in the farming business. They work hard at their business activities every day and never waste time. To help with the farm work, Heab N. wants a loan to purchase a cow, which she will use for plowing the farmland. Heab N. is a good mother, blessed with two kids who are in school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow which she will use for plowing the farmland

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoem S. is a villager in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem in this farming because she does not have enough rice seeds. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for her farming. Her husband, Mr. Tes Muth, is a salt middleman. Mrs. Ngoem S. is a mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others work as laborers in Thailand. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for her farming

loans.name: Tayagba Group

texts.en:
Here are Nanah B., Fanta K., Isatu B., and Kadiatu K.. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits.

Nanah B. (left) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-two years of age, born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Nanah is married with three children. Her husband is a vehicle mechanic and her children are attending schools – one in secondary school and the other two in primary school. Nana sells toothpaste, soap, torch-light/push lights, batteries, mints, chewing gum, etc. Nanah has been in this type of business for twenty years now. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying cartons of toothpaste, batteries, soaps and chewing gum.

loans.use: Buy cartons of toothpaste, batteries, mints, soaps and chewing gum

loans.name: Barbarita

texts.es: La Sra. Barbarita cliente antigua, trabajo en grupo ARIES en nueve secuencias, luego solicito credito individual, sacando montos pequeños de acuerdo a su requerimiento , ella tiene su esposo que trabaja en el Museo de Biologóia de La Universidad, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, la hija mayor salío ya bachiller y se encuentra postulando a una carrera, los otros dos se encuentran en colegio, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de Ovejuyo, es una señora muy responsable y tiene buen historial en la institucion.
texts.en:
Sra. Barbarita is a long-time client who has worked with the Aries Group on nine loan cycles. She later requested individual loans in which she took out small amounts as needed. Her husband works at the biological museum at a university. They have three school-age children. Their oldest daughter graduated from high school and is now pursuing a degree. The others are still in high school.

They live in their own home in the district of Ovejuyo. Sra. Barbarita is very responsible and has a good record with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia, es una mujer responsable, muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes (gaseosas y néctar), esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es empleado de una empresa. Ofelia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de gaseosas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1700 soles, que será invertido en la compra de bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Ofelia es tener una distribuidora de bebidas refrescantes bien implementada donde pueda generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 46, is a responsible, very dynamic, woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has two adult children. She sells refreshing beverages (soft-drinks and fruit nectars) in her home. Her husband, who is employed by a firm, supports her work endeavors. Ofelia has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for three years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, she needs 1700 soles to buy refreshing beverages. Ofelia's goal is to have a well-stocked beverage distribution center where she can generate higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 34 years old and married, and has an only child. He attended intermediate school and passed the final exam. 

He owns a women's clothing shop. He’s been in this business for more than three years. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more goods for his shop so he can attract more customers. Consequently, his family's income will increase. He is extremely ambitious and wants to expand and improve his shop, and begin to import various clothes for his shop. He has a good reputation in the market.

loans.use: To buy clothing and materials

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride is 50 years old and is married with four children with ages 16, 23, 26 and 27. She and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Bonifride operates her business of selling a variety of goods in her shop, which is open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Bonifride is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a large quantity of goods: mainly foodstuffs such as rice, corn flour, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.

With the use of this loan, Bonifride hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow her to help her devoted husband to take care of their family through paying school fees for their children and providing more food for them. In addition, she will be able to save for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of goods for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Emma Flora

texts.en:
Emma Flora A. is from the village of Dalisay, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Emma Flora owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks, like biscuits and other snack food, in the local community. Emma Flora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Emma Flora joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. is 32 years old and a resident of Siem Reap province, where she and her husband earn a living by fishing in and around the river. They are able to generate $5 each day to take care of their family. Ny S. has four school-aged children, all of whom assist with their parents' business when they are not studying. Recently some of their fishing accessories broke down and the family’s income has been affected. Because Ny S. doesn’t have money, she requested a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner. Ny S. will be using her loan to buy new sets of fishing tools to increase the quantity of fish she catches.

loans.use: To buy new sets of fishing tools

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 32-year-old married man with two young children. In 2008, he started his own business – he opened a water delivery company in his town. He's very famous in his town and known by his good reputation.

Jihad was able, since then, to have a good number of clients and has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas. He cooperates with his wife who works as a home-based hairdresser to support the family expenses.

Today, Jihad is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase water coolers for his project. He's planning to repay his loan early and to take a new loan in the future.

loans.use: To purchase water coolers

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en: Maria Cecilia L. is 41 years old and a rice grower. She uses her income to provide her family with adequate supplies of food, clothing and other basic needs. She is grateful to God because she is doing well in her business. She has one child who is 12 years old. At the moment, she is starting to save money for her child's college education. She would like to apply for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Quingeo es un banco comunal conformado por mujeres emprendedoras  capaces de salir adelante junto a sus familias, todas   viven en la ciudad de Cuenca pero son oriundas de la parroquia Quingeo ubicada al sureste del cantón Cuenca, limita al norte con la parroquia Santa Ana, al sur con la parroquia San José de Raranga del cantón Sígsig, al este con la parroquia Ludo del cantón Sígsig y, al oeste con las parroquias Cumbe y Tarqui.  La población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería con el cultivo de maíz, papas, fréjol y cebada, la floristería es una actividad nueva y lucrativa. La ganadería tiene su importancia en la zona baja especialmente por la producción lechera.  De aquí la población masculina en edad de trabajar se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca  ocupándose como obreros de la construcción, en menor escala como obreros de fábricas, talleres artesanales de diferente tipo y en otras actividades comerciales y de servicios de transporte  un buen porcentaje de mujeres se ocupan en el servicio doméstico.

Rosa B. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca pero es oriunda de la parroquia Quingeo  migró a esta  ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo y para salir adelante con su familia, ella tiene 22 años es soltera y vive con sus padres, ayuda muy poco para los gastos del hogar ya que deben pagar arriendo  pero en su comunidad si  cuentan con su casa propia.

Rosa vende verduras hace tres años en el mercado de la feria libre,  labora los días miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos desde las 5 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y los demás días se dedica a la limpieza de casas desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, con su nuevo crédito invertirá en la compra de tomate, cebolla, pimiento, zanahoria, acelga y mas verduras para continuar con su negocio siendo su meta ampliar con otros productos y dar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes.

La señora  Lilia Jiménez es una socia luchadora y siempre se encuentra en la búsqueda de mejores días, se dedica a la venta de aretes, moños, binchas, etc., actividad que realiza hace 9 años laborando en el mercado 10 de Agosto tiene un puesto propio y sus hijos son quienes le ayudan a vender su mercadería, trabaja de 8 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. de domingo a domingo.

Lilia tiene 39 años vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo le ayuda en el negocio,  sus dos  hijos pequeños  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como taxista y como no tienen  casa propia viven arrendando. Este es su primer crédito gracias a la invitación de una amiga a formar parte de este equipo de mujeres trabajadoras, con el dinero que reciba comprará aretes, vinchas, moños, ligas, chunchis, etc.  para abastecer su negocio.

Su meta es  comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
Quingeo is a community bank made up of entrepreneurial women willing and able to help their families get ahead in life. The women live in the town of Cuenca but are natives of Quingeo parish located to the south-east of the canton of Cuenca. To the north is the parish of Santa Ana, to the south the parish of San José de Raranga of Sígsig canton, and to the west the parishes of Cumbe and Tarqui. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and cattle raising, but as well they grow corn, potatoes, beans and barley. Growing flowers is a new and lucrative venture. Cattle raising is important in the lower areas especially for the production of milk. As soon as boys reach working age, they move to Cuenca to take up jobs as construction workers, or as factory workers, artisans of different types, or in various business or transportation ventures. A good number of the women have jobs as domestic servants. Rosa B. lives on the outskirts of Cuenca but is a native of Quingeo parish. She moved to the city in search of better work opportunities and to help her family get ahead. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She contributes very little to household expenses as they have to pay rent, but back in their community they own their own house. Rosa has been selling vegetables for three years in the Feria Libre market. She works on Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5am to 6pm. The other days she cleans houses from 7am to 5pm. This is Rosa’s second loan cycle and she wishes to use the money to buy tomatoes, onions, peppers, carrots, chard, and other vegetables for her business. Her goal is to expand into other products and thus improve service to her customers. Señora Lilia Jiménez is an entreprising member of the group who is always seeking a better life. She sells earrings, hair accessories, head bands etc., work she’s been doing for nine years. She has her own stall in the 10 de Agosto market where her children also help to sell the merchandise. She works from 8am to 2pm, seven days a week. Lilia is 39 years old and lives with her partner. They have three children aged 19, 11, and 7. Her oldest son helps with the business, and the two younger children attend school in the town. Her husband is a taxi driver. As they do not own a house, they live in rented accommodation. This is Lilia’s first loan. She was invited to join this team of hardworking women by a friend. With the money she will buy earrings, hair accessories, buttons, etc to better stock her business. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and hair accessories

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua R. has nine dependants. She has received a junior high education. Ekua processes palm oil for distribution to her customers at Abura. Ekua uses her income to take care of her family. Ekua will use the loan to buy more fruits to process into palm oil for sale. With the new returns from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: T buy more fruits to process into palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn V. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-age children. She is a farmer. She owns land that she and her husband till for planting rice crops. She sells their harvest at the market. When not busy with farming duties, she offers manicure services to her neighbors and other people in her community.

Rosalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She also plans to buy materials for her manicure business. This will be her eighth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza 2 Group

texts.en:
Tana is the coordinator of her group, La union hace la fuerza 2, which means "union makes strength." She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge relates to her children: she operates her business so that she can make sure her children are educated.

Tana is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business in doing so. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, oil, flour, vegetables, and other goods. Her business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make food on a daily basis. Normally, these colmados are located just a short walk from any home. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy school supplies for her children.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, beans, oil, flour, and vegetables)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy silver rings, bracelets, earrings as well as cell phones.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer F. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Jennifer is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food, daily-use products and a variety of vegetables in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina C., 45 years old, married to Welfredo C., is a good member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.- Rizal Central Branch, a partner microfinance institution of Kiva in the Philippines. Mr. and Ms. C. were blessed with 1 child who is now 5 years old. Her husband works as carpenter, while she manages their variety store at home, while attending to the household chores and taking care of their daughter.

She started this business almost two years ago to support her husband in their financial needs. The business is running smoothly, and that is why she is applying for another loan to increase her capital. She wants to buy more grocery products to display in her store, in order to meet the demands of her customers and increase her monthly profits to an additional 2,000 pesos.

She wants to save and earn more for the future of their bright child, who is ranked number one in their school. She would also like to buy appliances for them to enjoy and provide for their daily basic needs. Her dream is to send her child to college and finish a degree. Also, she wants to increase her savings to avoid worrying during payments of monthly utility bills and for any unexpected expenses.

With this new loan opportunity, she is hopeful that some day she and her family will experience a better future. She is thankful that there are institutions like ASHI and KIVA who trust poor people like her. She said she and her husband will repay all the help by improving their lives and moving out of poverty.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Hugo, tiene 37 años de edad, el es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica a la artesanía pero también presta servicio de taxi a la ciudad del Cusco, el socio solicita el dinero para invertir en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de sus automóvil.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Hugo, 37, has a live-in partner and two children. He is a craftsman but also provides public taxi services in the city of Cusco. He is asking for funds for vehicle maintenance and repair. He is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank which is in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan as well as to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 36 years old, and she has twin seven-year-olds. They are both in primary school. Consolee has a women’s hair salon, and with the proceeds from this loan she will open up a men’s salon. She has recently moved to a new location and is building up her client base. With the profits from her business, she wants to improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.use: The opening of a men's salon

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ha logrado salir adelante con sus 3 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 está a su cargo, sus inicios se dan por su esposo que le ayudo a que comenzara con este negocio y así le ayudara a sufragar gastos de su familia, por lo que siempre está pendiente de los diferentes pedidos que sus clientes le realizan. El financiamiento es para la compra de diversos productos que se utilizan a diario.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes is 42 years old, and she has a general store.  She has had this business for more than 10 years.  With a lot of effort and dedication, she has managed to provide for her 3 children, of whom only 1 is still in her care.  She started the business with the help of her husband so that she could help to cover the household expenses.  She is always taking care of the various orders of her customers.  This loan will be used to buy a variety of everyday consumer products.

loans.use: working capital to buy consumer products for her store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is very happy that, with the loan from ASHI, a first Kiva field partner, she is able to provide satisfactory services to her regular customers by fulfilling their orders without delay. She wishes to access a larger loan to expand her handicraft business so she can earn more profits. 

Prior to ASHI, Merlinda had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. She joined ASHI to follow her dreams of providing a decent life for her family. To fulfill this inspiration, she took out a loan and started her own handicraft business. As she continued to take loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she was able to grow her business. Many souvenir shop owners visit Merlinda's village to purchase her products. Other customers are Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) wanting to buy presents for their colleagues abroad. With the loan, Merlinda has noticed that her weekly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory.

Now she is proposing another loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to support maintenance of her business and purchase inventory of raw materials needed for her handicraft. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s standard of living and support the education of her 2 children until they are complete degree holders.

loans.use: To fund the needed materials for her business.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 27 سنة  متزوج ولديه ولدان طموح يعمل في مجال تجارة السيارات منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات تاريخه الاقتراضي في المجموعة جيد جدا ملتزم  يحب عائلته ويريد لها التطور يهدف من خلال طلب  قرض من المجموعة  توسيع مصلحته وشراء سيارات جديدة  للمصلحة وهو محبوب جدا من محيطه واكثر زبائنه هم  اقاربه وجيرانه واصدقائه لأنه ملتزم بالعمل يواجه صعوبة في السيولة وقد اتيحت له فرصة الى جعل المصلحة خاصة له.
texts.en: Hamzah is a 27-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and wants to help them advance. He has been working very determinedly as a car salesman for the past decade. His responsibleness has made him very well-liked by those he works with, with most of his customers coming from his relatives, neighbors, and friends. Enjoying an excellent credit history with Al Majmoua, Hamzah is now asking for another loan to purchase new automobiles to expand his business. He has an opportunity to acquire his own dealership, but is having problems with liquidity.

loans.use: To purchase new automobiles for car dealership.

loans.name: Pazilat Karahozueva's Group

texts.en:
Pazilat K. is the leader of this group. She is 58 years old and a widow. She lives in Uzgen, a lovely ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Pazilat has raised six children – four sons and two daughters. Most of them are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money, Pazilat cultivates tobacco and rice, and has been doing so since she was 11 years old. By selling some part of the harvest she makes 3,000 KGS per month. With this loan she wants to rent a piece of land for cultivating rice.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira K. is divorced, with two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son lives in the capital, and her daughter is married and lives with her husband’s family. Gulmira's youngest son is of preschool age and he lives with her.

Five years ago, after giving birth to her youngest son, Gulmira decided to start her own business making national wares. Now she also earns money by working as a cook in the local café. Out of these total earnings she has managed to organize her daughter's wedding and to prepare a dowry for her. 

Gulmira recently became a grandmother, and she wants to present her newborn grandchild with some gifts: a play-pen and jewelry, as well as organizing a  traditional celebration that is typical of national customs. She is seeking a loan to provide this celebration and gifts.  Her future plans include bringing up her son and buying a home. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To celebrate her grandson's birth

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Chona is married. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Chona is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Carmen Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijos; la socia trabaja en la cooperativa de ahorro y crédito Santo Domingo de Guzmán, ella es contadora y pertenece al banco comunal desde hace 6 años, le gusta la modalidad del grupo en cuanto al ahorro y es un grupo muy cumplido y son amigos desde hace muchos años, ellos también hacen actividades en grupo y lo que reúnen lo ahorran hasta fin de año cuando pueden repartirse sus ahorros y tener una buena navidad, la socia ahora requiere el préstamo para comprar algo personal ella indica que desea comprarse una casaca y con las fiestas navideñas dio regalos a todos y ella no pudo comprarse nada y que ahora desea hacerlo e ir pagando de a pocos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Padre Eterno" ["Eternal Father"] community bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Carmen. She is 38, single, and has one child. She works in the Santo Domingo de Guzman savings and lending cooperative. She is an accountant and has belonged to the community bank for 6 years. She likes the group's saving methods, and it is a very punctual group. They have been friends for many years. They also do group work and they save what they make until the end of the year when they can divide out their savings and have a good Christmas. Carmen now requires a loan to purchase some personal items. She says that she wants to buy a jacket, and gifts for everyone for the upcoming Christmas holidays. She could not buy anything and she now wants to take the loan and pay bit by bit. She is requesting this loan for personal use. She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay the quotas as established.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for personal use.

loans.name: Shahla's Group

texts.en:
Shahla has applied for a loan for the second time from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She started this business 10 years ago because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. Now she is very much an expert in her work and receives a good number of orders every month from her neighboring clients.
 
She will use the loan money for purchasing a new sewing machine, which will help her complete orders on time and make more income. 

She is 28 years old and a confident person who is very much hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her and she will be able to enroll her second daughter, who is now 7, in school in the near future.
 
She is the mother of three daughters; her eldest daughter is enrolled in the local school and is getting her education. Her husband's name is  A. A.; he works in a factory for a low income.  

She belongs to Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house and lives in it with her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book called the Asasah Passbook is Shahla.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es:
Luisa  es una mujer de edad avanzada y con mucho deseo de seguir trabajando para lograr el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda.
Hoy en día labora en una empresa privada como conserje, en donde espera seguir hasta que se jubile.
Su casa la ha venido mejorando con préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en donde ha logrado hacer cuartos y ahora con este nuevo financiamiento lograra cambiar techo del bajarete de atrás ya que necesita hacer este cambio ante que empiece el invierno. Lo que comprara láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, y comenzar. A si como hacer otro cuarto que espera a futuro lograrlo a través de los financiamientos que han sido
texts.en:
Luisa is an elderly woman who has great drive to continue working so that she can make further improvements to her home. Today she works as a janitor for a private business, a place where she hopes to remain until she retires.

Her home has undergone improvements. With the loans she received from AFODENIC, Luisa was able to add rooms. Now with this new loan, she plans to replace the roof over her patio before winter begins. She will buy sheets of zinc, lumber, and nails so that the work can begin. Luisa wants to build an additional room, so she hopes to obtain another loan in the future to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace the roof above her patio

loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria B. is from the village of Guayabal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Hilaria is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Hilaria owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs. In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Hilaria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea H. (pictured with her young daughter) is 37 years old. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh with her husband, Mr. Nhoeurn Uy, who is 48 years old. They have been married since 1986 and have six children – five sons and one daughter. One is married, three are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker and the other is still young.
Sophea sells meatballs in her village. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson F. M. tiene 37 años y está casado con la Sra. Rosana Cabrera de 34 años, tienen 3 hijos, un varón de 16 años y dos niñas de 7 y 3 años respectivamente.
El Sr. Nelson se dedica a la fabricación de joyas de plata desde hace 16 años. El negocio funciona en su domicilio y las joyas que fabrica son anillos, aros, pulseras, cadenas y diges. Sus principales clientes son las joyerías y los revendedores.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de plata en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría mayor descuento por la misma y el costo de las joyas sería menor por lo que tendría mayor ganancia por la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson F. M. is 37 years old and married to Sra. Rosa Cabrera, age 34. They have three children, a 16 year old son and two daughters (ages 7 and 3 respectively).

Sr. Nelson has been making silver jewelry for 16 years. He operates his business out of his home. The jewelry he produces includes rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, and pendants. His main customers are jewelry shops and retail stores.

Nelson wants to invest this loan in the purchase of silver in bulk so that he can get a larger discount. This will lower the cost of producing his jewelry pieces, thereby allowing him to earn more profit when he sells them.

loans.use: To purchase silver for making jewelry.

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa G. runs a CD shop in Meghri city, a mountainous, sunny and fertile landmark. Styopa is the main breadwinner, taking care of his mother, wife and son. 

To meet his clients' demands, Styopa needs to introduce new items in his shop: mobile and computer accessories. This will also increase Styopa's income and improve his household's conditions.

loans.use: to buy mobile and computer accessories for resale

loans.name: Lovetta

texts.en:
Lovetta is 31 years old and lives in the Congo Town area. She's married and her husband is an auto mechanic who works at a local garage. They have two girls who are two and thirteen currently attending school. She and her husband have to struggle to make ends meet. 

Lovetta started a small grocery store in 2006 where she sells, soap, biscuits, cold drinks, oil, etc., but not every day does business seem to go very well. 

Lovetta is requesting a loan to purchase rice, soap, soft drinks, etc.

She hopes to be a very strong business-woman, and plans to build a store and a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ercelia

texts.es: Ercelia, natural del distrito de Palmapampa, tiene 44 años, es una mujer laboriosa, y esta casada con Juan de 46 años y fruto de su amor concibieron 03 hijos y juntos vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Canal caserío del distrito de Samugari. El trabajo que realiza Ercelia es labrar la tierra donde cultiva cacao, café y frutas cítricas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Cuando su trabajo se le acumula no duda en contratar jornaleros para que tenga mayor avance en cuanto a su labor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga que amenazan su productividad. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador desde su chacra hasta su comunidad ya que es allí donde realiza el secado respectivo de sus productos. Más adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su tercer  crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con el crédito solicitado comprará, sacos de abono y fertilizantes, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ercelia, a native of the Palmapampa district, is 44 years old and a hard-working woman.  She is married to Juan, 46, and their union has yielded 3 children.  They live in their own home in the Canal community, part of the Samugari district.  Ercelia’s work involves tending to land where she grows cacao, coffee and citrus.  She does her work at the side her husband, who also works hard to generate income for the family.

She has found it convenient to take her products to the city of San Francisco where, as she tells us, she can get better prices for her goods.  When her workload increases, she has no problem finding migrant laborers to help her out.  What she enjoys most about her work is protecting the crops against plagues that threaten productivity.

She has been in farming for 20 years, and finds the most difficult aspect to be transporting her products.
