The trip from her farm to her community is long and tiring, but this is where the drying of her respective products takes place.  In the future, she would like to buy additional lands in order to increase productivity.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She hopes to be very punctual with her payments since she doesn’t want to create any problems for her cooperative bank.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.use: buy sacks of fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 56 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Dionesia works very hard to provide for them.

Dionesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries for her general store.

Dionesia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, softdrinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Dionesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store to sell

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar  is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Eleazar is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Eleazar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Eleazar has been engaged in her business for over 46 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eleazar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleazar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Eleazar is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Eleazar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 38 years old, married and has 3 children.  2 of her children are in school.

Connie is in an agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Connie requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Connie has been farming vegetables and rice for 17 years now and has borrowed 8 loans in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El señor Franz es docente en una de las escuelas hoteleras de la ciudad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción, pues necesita levantar un muro lateral de ladrillo en su casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Llojeta de La Paz;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Franz is a teacher at one of the hotel schools in the city.  He is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials because he needs to build a brick side wall in his home.  He lives in his own home located in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.

This is is first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: A sus 33 años, Milagros  sigue viviendo en su tierra natal con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. En la búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio y ante la recomendación de su suegra, Milagros se dedica en la elaboración de lechón al horno, de las cuales son ya 11 años de experiencia en sus ventas de éste alimento. Por ser un plato típico de su zona, sus ventas se han mantenido estables y siempre se asegura de tener  el ingrediente básico de su preparación que son los cerdos que compra los fines de semana para  luego beneficiarlos y prepararlos. Tiene su propio horno donde cocina, asimismo atiende pedidos de los clientes para grandes banquetes, así como aprovecha en vender en las ferias comerciales. Recibe la ayuda de su cuñada y de su suegra que también  venden, pues éste negocio lo considera muy rentable, que compensan el esfuerzo que pone. Su deseo es mejorar e implementar su negocio para que sus platillos sean de mejor calidad. Trabaja con MFP a través de los créditos grupales en 17 oportunidades de las cuales se siente muy orgullosa, demuestra su compromiso siendo parte de la junta directiva de su banco comunal que ha depositado la confianza hacia su persona y para ella es una gran satisfacción. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la reparación de su horno, ya que se ha derrumbado  por la mala construcción que han realizado en su horno y es urgente para ella reparar lo que considera su esencial herramienta de trabajo. Por el momento trabaja en el horno de su suegra, sin embargo se acerca la temporada en donde  hay mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Milagros is 33 years old and continues to live in the place in which she was born.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.

In search of business opportunities, and at the recommendation of her mother-in-law, Milagros started making oven-roasted suckling pig.  She now has 11 years experience in selling this food.  As it is a traditional dish in her area, her sales have remained stable and she always makes sure that she has the basic ingredient for her meal which are the pigs that she buys on weekends.  She then dresses them and prepares them.  Milagros has her own oven where she cooks.  She fills customers' orders for large events and also sells in the markets.  She is helped by her sister-in-law and her mother-in-law who also sell this product.  She considers the business to be very profitable and it rewards the effort that she puts in.  Her wish is to improve and stock her business so that she can prepare better-quality dishes.  

Milagros has been working with MFP through 17 group loans.  She feels very proud of this.  She shows her commitment by being a member of the board of directors of her community bank.  They have placed their trust in her and she feels very satisfied as a result.  Milagros will invest the money that she has requested in repairing her oven as it has collapsed owing to the bad way in which it was constructed.  It is urgent that she have it repaired as she considers it her essential work tool.  For the time being, she is working with her mother-in-law's oven.  However, the season when she makes most sales is approaching.

loans.use: to repair her oven

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mariée, Adjoa est mère de 2 enfants, qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle réside en location avec son mari et ses enfants. Adjoa contribue aux différentes charges du ménage. Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 8 ans, Adjoa commercialise des produits cosmétiques tels que les produits défrisants, les pommades pour le corps et pour les cheveux, des gels, des parfums, des savons, des lotions et autres. Sa boutique se situe à Tokpa dans une zone très favorable à son activité. Ses clients sont constitués des petits détaillants et des particuliers. La relation s'approvisionne sur place à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin et au Togo ou au Nigeria, deux pays frontaliers au Bénin. Face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle, elle a décidé d'entrer en partenaria avec FINADEV où elle obtint un concours financier afin de mieux achalander sa boutique. Adjoa compte sur le revenu supplémentaire à dégager de ce crédit pour faire face à ses responsabilités familiales et résoudre ses besoins personnels. Adjoa diversifier son activité afin de faire face convenablement à la concurrence.
texts.en:
A married woman, Adjoa is the mother of two children who are both in school. She rents a place with her husband and children. She helps with the various household expenses. Priviledged with at least eight years of experience, Adjoa sells cosmetics, such as straighteners, body and hair ointments, gels, perfumes, soaps, lotions, and more. Her store is located at Tokpa in a very favorable area for her business. Her customer base is composed of small-scale retailers and individuals. 

Our client is supplied locally from Tokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Togo or Nigeria, two countries bordering Benin. Facing the growing demand from her customers, she decided to enter into partnership with FINADEV, where she obtained financial aid for increasing store traffic. Adjoa is counting on the extra revenues to clear this loan in order to cope with her family responsibilities and to resolve her personal needs. She is diversifying her business to face the competition in a suitable manner.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes ointments, 5 boxes of straightener, 5 boxes of perfumes, and 5 boxes of soaps

loans.name: Prin

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Prin, 35, who has been working in this sector since 2007. 

She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US $2 per day. 

This humble couple has three dependents. All of them are students. 

This rice-growing season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Prin would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield. She says the income will help her improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
"You will never succeed unless you try your best," says Danilo, a responsible father who has four adult-age children. He has owned and managed a 1.5 hectare rice field for almost 38 years, earning a profit of 30,000 PHP per crop. As the fruit of his patience and hard work, all of his children have already graduated, and they are now employed.

Now he is always busy, for he has been chosen as the captain of his barangay. Despite this, Danilo wants to continue managing his rice field to earn money and save for his future. Therefore, he wants to ask for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides and for labor to sustain his rice production. He is hoping that he will increase his production and income to be used for food and clothing and to save for future emergencies.

Danilo believes that he will be successful in carrying out all his plans, for he has strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and for labor to sustain his rice production.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 15 years old.

Marilyn is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Marilyn said farming is challenging, especially since she cannot control the weather. Marilyn works hard to help provide for her family.

Marilyn has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to help uplift her family's living conditions. She also desires to see her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nacianzena

texts.es:
Nacianzena nació en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y tiene 49 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Nacianzena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en la comunidad de Wilcapata en el nivel primario. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a la enseñanza y le va muy bien, ella también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Nacianzena requiere el préstamo para aumentar jaulas  y cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nacianzena was born in the city of Calca, in the department of Cuzco. She is 49 years old and the single mother of two children. Currently, she lives and works in the city of Cuzco. She is an elementary school teacher in the Wilcapata neighborhood. She has been teaching for 17 years, and it's going very well. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs. Nacianzena needs this loan to buy more cages and guinea pigs.

The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more cages and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Neyva Coralit

texts.es: La señora Neyva nacida en la ciudad de Cochabamba,  vive con su esposo el señor Juan con el cual tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrote, tiene una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio hace más de un 1 año, en la zona Nuevo Palmar. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de un frízer y  mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ella es una persona joven muy trabajadora con ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia,  esta muy agradecida a Emprender por confiar en su persona, ya que es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Neyva was born in the city of Cochabamba.  She lives with her husband, Juan, and has two children who are 3 and 5 years old.  She sells groceries.  She has had a home-based neighborhood store for the last year in the Nuevo Palmar neighborhood.  

The loan granted her is to buy a freezer and stock merchandise for her store.  She is a young, very hardworking person with a strong desire to improve her entire family’s quality of life.  She is very grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her since this is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Tammana's Group

texts.en:
Tammana is a 44-year-old married lady. Her husband operates a motor workshop. He is very skillful at his work. People trust his services and appreciate him for his good work. 

Tammana is also very skillful, sewing clothes for her neighbors on order. She charges 150 Pakistani rupees for each job and, due to her good quality work, she receives a good number of orders every month. Tammana has given birth to four daughters and a son. She has enrolled all of them in school and she pays for their education expenses from her earnings. 

Tammana has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to buy some repairing tools and spare parts for his business. This will help him provide better quality repairing services to his customers and increase his profits. Tammana is very confident that her husband will be able to get positive financial results from his business after the investment. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tammana.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for a motor workshop

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pilar; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y pollos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia también se dedica a la venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz),por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y gallinas y también para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz y jora.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pilar is a member of the 'Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department. Pilar is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as pigs and chickens. She fattens her animals and then sells them in the different markets in Urubamba district. She also sells chicha (a corn-based drink) and, through these businesses, she supports her children. Pilar would like to expand her animal-raising business and her chicha business. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs, hens, and also supplies for making chicha, such as corn and jora corn. Pilar is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and hens, and also supplies for making 'chicha' such as corn and jora corn

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus cinco hijos, y de su padre, que por ser mayor de edad depende de Anita para cuidarlo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Anita es la venta de comida, para lo cual tiene un espacio ambientado en su propia casa, siendo una zona transitada. Cuenta con regular clientela, quienes siempre consumen en su establecimiento. Tiene 2 años dedicándose a esta actividad, asimismo su pareja siempre la ha apoyado en el trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera un ingreso económico, con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ahora su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, así como mejorar los ambientes de su casa. Este sería el crédito número tres con la institución MFP, por tanto se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos y seguir teniendo un buen record crediticio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingrediente para la preparación de mas comida.
texts.en:
35-year old Anita is a lively, enthusiastic woman. She lives with her partner, their five children, and her elderly father whom she looks after. They live in their own home.

Anita earns her living by selling meals from her home which is in busy part of town. She has a regular customer base who always come to her for their meals. She has done this job for two years. Her partner helps with the work. 

She likes the fact that her job brings in money to pay for household expenses. Her biggest goal now is to expand the business and improve the surroundings. This will be Anita’s third loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually so she continues to have a good credit rating. With the money she plans to buy ingredients so she can make more meals.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for meals

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is from Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Antonina is married and has four children.

To make a living, Antonina runs a general store selling a variety of foods and household products such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and much more. Antonina has been in this business for over four years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Antonina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her store. In 2011, Antonina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 41 years old, married with four children, and from Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

To make a living, Aida is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products to the local community. Aida has been in the business for eight years, and she earns 15,400 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Aida hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Ninfa Teodora

texts.es:
Ninfa Teodora tiene 46 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 25, 22 y 10 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Ninfa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura, comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar los insumos. El sueño es poder tener un terreno. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar la natación.
texts.en:
Ninfa Teodora, 46, lives in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 25, 22 and 10 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Ninfa has been growing corn and rice for ten years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to work in farming and to buy manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to acquire the supplies.  Her dream is to own a piece of land.  She’s had no type of problem with her crops and in her free time she likes to swim.

loans.use: to work in farming and to buy manure.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is a basket maker from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married and has seven children. Fernanda’s husband works as a driver and mechanic.

Aside from making baskets, Fernanda also sells food items such as rice cakes and "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick). She works hard to help send her children to school. She requested this loan to buy rattan and raw ingredients such as oil, bananas and rice. Fernanda hopes to have enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rattan and raw ingredients such as oil, bananas and rice.

loans.name: Chanthen

texts.en:
Chanthen (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sophea, is hired to design windows and doors with mirrors. They have been married since 2003 and have one son who is still young and one daughter who attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthen is applying for another loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work on.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work on.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province in Kampong Siem district, Mon is aged 32 years and married who has two children. One of whom is too young to school and another one is in school. To support her family, she does rice farming which is the primary source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for almost twelve years. 
She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and the first loan has improved her living’s condition. She is able to earn 30,000 KHR per day. She is now requesting for the loan of 3,000,000 KHR to pay for buying fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to earn more income so as to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To pay for buying fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Sabine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 34 ans a arrêté l’école au cours primaire a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis quinze ans dans son atelier. Sabine est mariée à un peintre auto du nom de Jean-Marie. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Sabine vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques de façon secondaire depuis quinze ans environ. Sabine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sabine ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFA sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Lurvin Margoth

texts.es:
Lurvin, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad que ya trabajan y uno menor de edad.

Lurvin, desde que sus hijos estaban pequeños se ha dedicado a vender tortillas junto a su tía y de esa manera a logrado cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. 

Lurvin, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña, de esa forma lograra mejorar sus ingresos y tener lo necesario para ir subsistiendo.

El sueño de Lurvin, es mejorar cada día sus ingresos y seguir con su negocio de tortillas.

loans.use: para comprar maíz y leña.

loans.name: Nohemi Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nohemi is mother of two children and is married. She lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a driver and his earnings are not enough to cover all of the family expenses, which is why four years ago she started her small busienss selling hot dogs from her home. Soon thereafter, with the help of her husband she was able to buy a hot dog cart and she started selling her product at local markets. Thansk to her efforts and dedication she has been able to help her family.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $550 to purchase a larger hot dog cart and consequently offer a better service and carry a greater quantity of products, to meet the high demand that she is currently seeing. With your generosity you can help Nohemi and her family. Do not wait, she and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nohemi es madre de 2 hijos y es casada, vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es chofer foráneo y con lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos familiares, es por ello que ya hace 4 años Nohemi tuvo la idea de comenzar con pequeño negocio propio, la elaboración y venta de hot dogs en su propio domicilio. Luego con la ayuda de su marido pudo comprar un carrito pequeño para vender su producto en los mercados rodantes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha logrado ayudar mucho a su familia.

En este momento, ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 DLLS para poder comprar un carro más grande y ofrecer un mejor servicio y una mayor cantidad de productos, dada la fuerte demanda que esta experimentando. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Nohemi y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase car for hot dogs

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto was born and raised in Baba, Ecuador where he has grown up cultivating rice. He has lived on his lands for about 30 years with his family. He has had two children with his wife; both of them are grown but still contribute to the farm. He hopes to invest the loan in buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the upcoming planting season. His goal afterwards is to make some improvements to his home.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Senora Ana Laura is a hard-working and honest woman. She got into sales about 21 years ago to help her husband pay the bills and to pay for the schooling of their 3 children. Thanks to her friendly and easy going nature and for the love of what she does, has helped her to get more and more clients. She began by selling draperies and jewelry. At her friends’ requests, she also began selling decorative products for the home which has been very successful.

Due to the good quality of her products and the product demonstrations she does at friends’ homes, has helped her get a lot of orders. She needs a loan in the amount of $375 USD. Be an important part of Ana Laura’s life by helping her business grow. She and her family sincerely thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Laura es una mujer honesta y muy trabajadora, desde hace 21 años se dedica a las ventas, inició para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus tres hijos, afortunadamente el carácter que posee, la facilidad para relacionarse con los demás y su gusto por las ventas la ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes, comenzó vendiendo lencería y joyería, poco después ante la invitación de una de sus amigas incorporó la venta de productos decorativos para el hogar, donde ha tenido muy buenos resultados.

Gracias a la calidad de los productos que comercializa y a las demostraciones que hace en casas de amigas, han logrado obtener muchos pedidos, para poder surtirlos necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Ana Laura y ayúdala a que continúe creciendo, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Diana Alicia

texts.es:
Diana is a very hard-working woman. She is married with 2 children who are 5 and 9 years old. Her husband is a salesman and does not get paid very much, and they therefore live with his mother. In order to save up to buy their own house, a year ago Diana started her own business making and selling refried beans, as they are very popular in Mexico. This fact allowed her business to grow, and now she also sells “totopos”.

Thanks to the good service that Diana offers her clients, the demand for her products has grown, and she now needs to increase her production rate. In order to do this she is asking for a loan of $200 to buy ingredients. She will repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Diana thanks you for the opportunity that she has, with your help, to have a family home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene dos hijos, de 5 y 9 años de edad. Su esposo es vendedor y recibe un sueldo muy bajo, él y su familia viven en casa de su madre, para poder ahorrar y adquirir su propia vivienda desde hace un año Diana emprendió su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de frijoles embasados, éste es un producto muy consumido en México lo que la ha ayudado a crecer rápidamente, ahora también va a incorporar la venta de totopos.

Gracias al buen servicio que Diana ofrece a sus clientes, la demanda por sus productos es mayor y para poder cubrirla necesita incrementar su producción por lo que ahora está solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, y se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Diana agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda de mejorar y obtener un patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is  49 years old and a mother of five. She and her family live in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She has raised poultry for four years and is now requesting a loan of $725 to buy chickens to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar K. is 44 years old, he is college educated, is married and has four children. He is currently receiving a pension and at the same time is working as a chef. Safar has been raising, feeding and selling large and small horned domesticated animals for 2 years in his home, in his village Dastgirak in the Yavan region.

Safar plans to use this loan to purchase 3 large animals and their feed. After 40-45 days of feeding them, Safar sells the animals and uses his revenues to purchase new animals; he uses the profits to support his family. By taking out a loan he will be able to increase his earnings and the loan will also give local butchers the opportunity to purchase animals for slaughter and to supply meat products to local residents. Safar plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Сафар, возраст – 44 года, образование высшее, женат, имеет 4-х детей, в настоящий момент находится на пенсии и одновременно работает шеф – поваром в Обществе с Ограниченной Ответственностью «Чжунда». Сафар уже в течение 2-х лет занимается разведением, откормкой и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота у себя дома в кишлаке Дастгирак Яванского района. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. Через 40-45 дней после откормки Сафар продает купленный ранее скот, на вырученные деньги приобретает новый молодняк, а полученную прибыль направляет на содержание своей семьи. Получив кредит он во-первых сможет увеличить свой доход, во-вторых даст возможность местным мясникам приобретать упитанный скот и поставлять жителям района мясные продукты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of horned animals

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. E. from Morales, in San Martin, owns a business raising and selling chickens. She started the business in July of 2004 to earn money to feed and educate her two children. After inheriting some land from her parents, she saw the opportunity to take charge of her life. She learned how to raise chickens from her brother who has a similar business. She currently has over one thousand chickens and believes there is plenty of room to grow.

At 34 years old and divorced, she works hard to keep her business running efficiently and take care of her children. Having her own business gives Doris the flexibility to do both. Before she started her business, times were hard. She is now very happy and couldn’t imagine doing anything else.

With a loan of $500, Doris would like to buy more chicken feed so she can raise more chickens next season. She is a member of the Community Bank Mujeres Rumbo Al Desarrollo who help support her business decisions. Doris is ambitious and proud of her accomplishments. In the future she would like to expand her business and raise pigs, too.

loans.use: To buy feed for chickens

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
Ms. Santos Victoria is 49 years old, she studied until the third year of middle school. She has 6 children, but only 2 depend on her. They live in the district of Mache, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad. She has a grocery store, she also provides room and board to teachers and some students who come to study to the school of Mache. She has been able to run her grocery store, as well she has been able to run other business since she was 20 years old. Previously, she was buying wholesale curd (quesillo) to sell it and also she was buying small animals as guineas pigs and hens. A year ago she started providing room and board and she is doing really well. She belongs to the communal bank " Women of Mache ", where she obtained her first loan of $100 that invested to buy small animals to fatten them and then sell them. With the loan of $350 that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc. She will also buy the ingredients to cook for her room and board business. Ms. Santos is the president of the communal bank "Women of Mache" and she is the promoter for health for her region. Her biggest dream is to build her house in the city of Trujillo and open her business there.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos Victoria tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, en total tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo 2 dependen de ella y vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Ella tiene una bodega en la que vende abarrotes, además da pensión a los profesores y a algunos alumnos que vienen de fuera a estudiar en el colegio de Mache. Desde que tenia 20 años ha mantenido su bodega como ha podido y también se ha dedicado a otros negocios. Anteriormente compraba cuajada (quesillo) al por mayor para venderlo y también compraba animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Hace un año que empezó a dar pensión y le va muy bien. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres de Mache” , lugar donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió comprando reses pequeñas para engordarlas y luego venderlas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, etc.,. Así también comprará los ingredientes para cocinar para sus pensionistas. La señora Santos es presidenta del banco comunal “Mujeres de Mache” y promotora de salud de su región. Su mayor sueño es construir su casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y ahí abrir su negocio.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Sophal, 59, is a widow with six children; four sons and two daughters. Mrs. Sophal and her family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home. The other two children sell flowers and clothing.

Mrs. Sophal has also been in the business of selling flowers and second-hand clothes since 1995. She buys her clothes in Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Mrs. Sophal also buys jasmine flowers under contract from a farmer in her village for her daughter to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to expand the business

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam and Cuong have proven to be very reliable business partners. They have borrowed from Mekong Plus on 3 different occasions and have repaid each loan on time. They also received a loan from Kiva last time and have repaid on time as well. Her previous loans have helped Tam's family to be able to build a new small home with a bathroom. They were even able to paint their home with the money they saved up. They would like to continue to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can expand Tam's grocery business.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her little business

loans.name: Catherine's Tulivu Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 12, 10 and 9. Catherine sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business of batik making.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda V. D. Castillo has a farm where she raises animals, such as pigs and cattle, to sell at the market. She has been a farmer all of her life in the town of Mache, high in the mountains of the Libertad region of Peru. She owns some land and knows everything there is to know about pigs and cattle.

Hermelinda is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her children moved to Trujillo, the capital of the region, which is along the coast, so she and her husband now live alone. She’s worked hard for her entire life to survive.

A member of the Mujeres D. Mache community bank, Hermelinda is requesting a loan of s/3000 ($1100 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the capital to buy more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy more animals to raise.

loans.name: Women's Wing Group

texts.en: Mabinty Sesay owns a small restaurant in Makeni town and has been in business for more than 3 years.  With her previous loan, she purchased saucepans, plates, bags of rice and five galons of palm oil.  This increased her business capacity and income.  She would like to further expand the business.  Mabinty is 35 years old and married with 5 children.  With her income, she is able to pay school expenses for the children.  She is the group leader and is hardworking.  Ramatu sells dried fish, Gbassey sells rice and palm oil and Adama also runs a small restaurant.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.3200000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the restaurant, stocks of rice, beans, dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em Y., 50, is a farmer and her husband is tuk-tuk taxi driver. Their combined income is $15 per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married and lives in Toul Thnort Village, Kandal Province.

Y. owns a few oxen, which she uses to farm various kinds of fruit, including banana, jackfruit, and mango. Due to growing demand for her crops, Yeourn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase wood. She will use the wood to build a stable for her oxen. The remainder of the loan will be used as working capital for her farming business. The loan will allow her to protect her business assets, and thereby increase the stability of her business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To build a stable for her oxen

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan H. is a villager in Pouthi Reamea Village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder who raises four pigs. She now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase pig food to feed them. Thus, Mrs. Phan H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Pring Chhorn, helps his wife in her business. Mrs. Phan H. is 39 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending school. Mrs. Phan H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase pig food to feed four pigs.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mr. Mat E., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sarifas E., 41, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their daughters sells beef with their relatives, and the other two children study in a local school.

Mr. Mat and his wife have been selling recycling materials for three years. They travE. about forty kilometers from their home to buy discarded household materials from villagers.  Then they sell them to a wholesaler in their village. They need a motorbike to carry the materials. Therefore, Mat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to carry recycling materials.

loans.name: Melanita Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Melanita comenzó como operaria de un taller de costura ya que su mama le había enseñado a bordar, luego con un dinero que le proporcionó su esposo compró materia prima y empezó a elaborar su propia mercadería, lo cual hacia en una maquina alquilada, se siente agradecida de  adim, ya que hace 3 años se le financió para la compra de una máquina de coser, que es la que utiliza para la elaboración de trajes típicos, los que vende en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos; sus hijos asisten a clases y su esposo atiende los quehaceres de la agricultura, ella sueña con tener un taller grande con 3 maquinas de coser y tener su personal, ya que su producto tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Melanita started working in a sewing workshop as her mother had taught her how to sew. Later, with the money that her husband gave her, she bought raw materials and started to make her own merchandise, which she did using a rented machine. She is very grateful to ADIM as 3 years ago they financed the purchase of a sewing machine and she now uses it to make typical clothing which she sells in the Masaya county market. She lives with her husband and 2 children; her kids go to school and her husband does agricultural tasks. She dreams of having a big workshop with 3 sewing machines and one of her own, as her products are very much in demand.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun T., 39, and her husband, Mr. San Sous, 38, who live in a small village across the Mekong river, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in the local school and their youngest daughter is still young and stays at home. In addition to her children, she also has two brothers living with her as well.

Oun has been a silk weaver since 1996. She sells her finished work to the middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. In addition to silk weaving, she raises pigs as well. Her husband has been a cow seller for twenty years. It is a skill he learned from his parents. He buys cows from other provinces (Battam Bong, Kandal, Prey Veng...) for resale in Phnom Penh.

Oun is requesting a loan to purchase cows for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Saidiat

texts.en: Saidiat is 60 years old and married with 6 children. Saidiat sells flashlights and batteries. She has been in this business for a long time. Saidiat needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more flashlights and batteries to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more flashlights and batteries to sell

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im S. is 31 years old and married to Sim Mao, 33. They are residents of Kompong Tom Province. The couple are both rice traders who earn their living by purchasing rice from farmers and reselling it for a profit. They are responsible for their three children, all of whom are single and go to school. Because the sale of rice is the principal way for them to earn money to sustain their family's needs, Im S. and Sim Mao hope to enlarge their business operation. Thus, they would like to request a loan to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Kampala Road-Fatuma Nakka Group

texts.en:
Fatuma N. (front row in the center) is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children, of whom 2 are in school. For a period of 4 years now, Fatuma has been operating a restaurant in Bombo town. Her menu is comprised of local dishes and delicacies. To boost her business, she needs a loan to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs like rice, flour, matooke, and beans.

Her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of sales. Her ambition is to expand her restaurant into a modern one, offering both local and international dishes. Rehema is hard-working and will ensure her children study up to university.

loans.use: Purchase rice, flour, beans, and matooke (a cooking banana)

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn L., 31, is married and has a business selling grocery products from her home. On average, she makes $3.50 a day and her husband earns around $2.50 a day by purchasing rubber from individual growers and reselling it to the market-wholesaler. Mrs. Sorn L. would like to use this loan to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: groceries

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуде 65 лет, но несмотря на свой возраст продолжает заниматься предпринимательством. Времена сейчас тяжелые и если пропустить несколько дней без торговли, то убыток составит многие сомони. Мавчуда продает мелкие товары – носки, нитки, иголки, детскую одежду и тп. Торгового прилавка нету и Мавчуда сидит прямо на земле посреди торговых рядов. И так и в холод и в жару. Недавно Мавчуда решила получить займ для развития своего бизнеса и для этого обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mavchuda is 65 years old but in spite of her age, she is still involved in entrepreneurial activities. The times are hard, and several days of no sales bring a loss of many somonis. Mavchuda sells many things – socks, thread, needles, children’s clothing, etc. Because she does not have a counter, Mavchuda sits on the ground between market rows, no matter whether it is cold or hot outside. Recently Mavchuda decided to apply for a loan and turned to Microinvest for help.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M., currently in the business of selling tea and bread, is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, coffee and bread for sale.  Mary, the 30-year-old wife of a businessman, has three children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more sugar,coffee and bread for sale.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри – женщина средних лет (43 лет). Замужем и имеет трех детей. Она занимается продажей овощей на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Она продаёт в основном огурцы и помидоры. Сейчас огурцы и помидоры растут только в парниках. Она закупает их у дехканин, которые выращивают овощи в больших парниках. Сейчас огурцы и помидоры стоят дорого на рынке, но люди все равно покупают их. Потому, что потребность организма в витаминах весной очень большая. Через 1,5-2 месяца у всех поспеют помидоры и огурцы  в огороде, и потом цена на них упадет. Поэтому Мехри хочет увеличить свой ассортимент, и продовать еще и другие фрукты и овощи.
texts.en:
Mehri is a middle aged woman (43 years old). She is married and has three children. She sells vegetables at the “Panchshanbe” market in Khuhand. She mostly sells cucumbers and tomatoes. Right now cucumbers and tomatoes only grow in green houses. Mehri purchases them from farmers who grow vegetables in large green houses. Right now cucumbers and tomatoes are expensive at the market, but people still buy them, because the body has a very large demand for vitamins in the spring. In 1.5-2 months everyone will have cucumbers and tomatoes ripen in their garden and their price will drop. This is why Mehri would like to increase her product selection and also sell other fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product selection

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg T. is a 50-year-old widowed mother of one. Her only daughter is married and lives on her own. Erdenechimeg lives in Arhanghay, one of the Mongolian central provinces, on the plot of land she owns. She has been running a retail sales business for the last 19 years. As a result of her hard work, she was able to afford a nice wedding for her daughter, a home for her daughter and electronic items for her personal use. In 2007, she started running a dairy products stall at the local market. Her sister and daughter help her with the business when they have free time. Erdenechimeg is a hard-working, open and loyal person who is well respected in the business community. She requested a loan to buy more dairy products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy dairy products

loans.name: Lalang

texts.en: Lalang R., a 35 year old woman, sells tomatoes and okra and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Her husband is a peasant and they have three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit S., 53, is a village woman and lives in the rural area of Phnom Penh Capital, where she owns a plot of land and uses it to plant various kinds of crops to earn a living. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works as a security guard for a gasoline station. This couple has four children: two are married and live separately, while the others are single. One of their daughters is a garment worker and has provided a salary to meet the family’s foods a little more. Tit S. will use half of the loan to buy a motor for her family’s riding needs and the rest of the loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy a motor for the family’s riding needs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Ms. Emma M. is single and resides at Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occiddental . She is hard working and has been engaged in dried fish vending. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2006; she is grateful for the benefits of savings and insurance. Now she's applying for a loan amounting to Php 10,000 as additional working capital for her dried fish vending business. Her aspiration is to save money for the future and acquire a stall in the market place in order to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Саодат женщина - 45 лет. Замужем имеет  4-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Саодат занимается продажей ремни на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Ей помогает старший сын Толиб. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Саодат хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать больше прибыли для того чтобы обучать своих детей в Университете.Саодат  уже 2 года  кредитуется в нашей организации и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Saodat is a 45 year old woman. She is married and has four children. She has secondary education. Saodat sells belts on the Panschabe market in the town of Khujand. Her oldest son Tolib helps her. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. Saodat wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise because a good variety attracts more customers. She wants to expand her business and get more profit to give their children a university education. Saodat has been taking out loans for two years at our organization and is a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy belts

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2008 et a gagné grâce à son dynamisme la confiance de beaucoup de clients. Cette croissance de sa clientèle l’oblige à accroître son stock de marchandises pour les satisfaire convenablement. Elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 02 children, this woman generates revenue by selling groceries. She began this business in 2008 and thanks to her dynamism, has gained the trust of many clients. This growth in her clientele has compelled her to increase her stock to properly satisfy them. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase various grocery products.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio F. is from the village of Casusan. He is 47 years old. Lucio is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lucio makes and sells household furniture to local businesses and community members. Lucio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lucio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lucio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: One Word Business #3 Group

texts.en:
One Word Business #3 is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia and led by Bandu J..

Bandu is 35 years old and is single, with two children aged 5-8. Her eldest is in the 3rd grade. She was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Bandu lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Bandu’s business is dry meat, which she buys wholesale, prepares, and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades. She is successful because her customers like her personality and the way she prepares the meat.

Bandu’s dream is to grow her business so she can one day get married and build a permanent shop. With the profits from her business, she dreams of raising her family well and sending all her children to school which she was unable to attend herself.

loans.use: To purchase a carton of meat

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is already a widow.  She and her children are living in Barangay Malamag West of Tumauini, Isabela.  Her five children are now married and they live with their own families. Cristeta is now sending her youngest in a secondary level of education and she is hoping that he will finish his education someday. 

To make a living, Cristeta is selling pork and carabao meat in their village. She is now five years in the business and she is hoping to grow it more for her generate bigger income. Aside from the meat that she sells, she also sells cooked foods and other additional products to sell in her vending stall to increase her income. Cristeta is hoping to avail an additional working capital to improve her business further and able gain more income. She is requesting to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28 years old Naumi   M. from Mbeya.. Naumi has been running a timbers  business since 2008. Client’s business is purchasing and selling timbers . She works at the business for 9-12  hours per day, 6  days per week Naumi currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase timbers in bulk for business . In the future, she plans to open the same business at new location . Naumi thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase timbers in bulk

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. (in a white shirt at the right side of photo) lives in Pangarap Village Caloocan City, a progressive city in the northern tip of Manila.  She is 54 years old. Her husband Augusto is a carpenter. They have six children.  

Elma owns and manages a home-based workshop making dolls hand-sewn from fabric trimmings  She has been in this business for twenty years; now, she now has six employees working on shifts. Elma earns at least P 64,000.00 a month. Elma states that her family used live a poor life amongst the squatter communities in Manila; they were blessed to be included among the families relocated in Pangarap Village. Through the help of a religious missionary group, she was given the opportunity to get into business.
   
She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for four years. Currently, she needs a new loan in the amount of P 20,000.00 so that she can buy more scrap fabric and other raw materials for her business. She will also use part of the loan to purchase a few pieces of G.I. sheet to replace a dilapidated portion of their house’s roof.

She hopes to make her workshop a lot bigger in the future so she can be of help to many unemployed individuals. She also wishes to independently export her dolls.     

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: purchasing raw materials for doll making

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva V. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis, Oriental. She is 43 years old. Eva is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a business providing photography services to local community members. Eva has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her photography business

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 36 years-old and married with four children. She sells used hand bags. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a hardworking woman and she makes sure she has food on the table everyday through her hard work. Ngozi is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more used hand bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase used hand bags.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella sells drinks, groceries and foodstuffs from her house and sells for long hours to enable her meet the basic needs of her home. She has been in this business for a long time.

Stella is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client and she got her capital to start this business from LAPO. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Stella hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

Stella is 26 years old and married with a child. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Luz Dalila

texts.es:
Luz tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 5 años dedicándose a la venta de pescado en su zona y en los caseríos colindantes. Ella nos cuenta que tuvo que empezar con este negocio debido a que el dinero que percibe su esposo como transportista no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Luz se dedica a distribuir su mercadería todos los días en una mototaxi a sus habituales clientes. Su producto es muy apreciado por los pobladores de la zona debido a que, por lo alejado del lugar en donde viven, no tienen acceso a pescado fresco.

La continua demanda de sus clientes ha hecho que Luz piense en ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer mur conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y clientes de la zona. Ellos la consideran una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the Fanupe Barrio Nuevo settlement, which is located in the Morrope district, 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years she has been in the business of selling fish in her area and in the surrounding settlements. She tells us that she had to start this business due to the fact that the money her husband earns as a hauling contractor isn’t enough to cover the family expenses. She works everyday distributing her merchandise on a motorcycle-taxi to all her usual clients. Her product is very much appreciated by the inhabitants of the area because, due to the remoteness of the place they live in, they don’t have access to fresh fish.

The continuous demand from her clients has made Luz think about expanding her business, but she lacks sufficient capital. For this reason she has seen the need to apply for a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to help her achieve her objective.

She is a woman who is very well known and appreciated by her neighbors and clients in the area. They consider her to be a responsible, hard-working woman, who is devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh and salted fish for sale.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Nohemi S. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a que su negocio creciera más. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación en este otro crédito para comprar mercancía que le esta haciendo falta y que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ya que es la tienda de abarrotes de la colonia.   
Entre Doña Nohemi y  su esposo el señor el Federico Mascorro, son los que atiende el negocio.Planea pagar este crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nohemi S. is very grateful for your cooperation in a previous loan which helped her to grow her business. She is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise that she needs and that her customers have been asking her to sell, since her business is the neighborhood grocery store. Both Nohemi and her husband, Federico Mascorro, attend to the business. She plans to pay off this loan with the earnings that she gets from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.ru: Насимов Нурхон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Насимов Нурхон имеет высшее образование. В области торговли работает более 10 лет. Насимов Нурхон арендует торговую точку. Он покупает и продает одежду и порфюмерию. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
N. Nurhon lives in the city of Kulob. He's fifty years old, married, has four children and a university education. He has worked in the field of trade for more than ten years, renting a trade point. N. buys and sells clothes and perfumes. He's requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Lilian Roxana

texts.es: Lilian Roxana S. R. de 30 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como catedrático de una universidad nacional, así mismo junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Lilian como toda una mujer visionaria, con deseos de poder mejorar la vida de su familia, inicio su propio negocio, el cual es una venta de ropa para mujeres y niños, y así mismo comercializa productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes. Lilian solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor variedad de ropa y cosméticos, los cuales comercializa de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias de Soyapango. Todo esto lo hace con el anhelo de poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, y de esta manera darles una vida digna, la cual este suplida con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Lilian Roxana S. R., 30, lives in Soyapango with her husband, who is a professor at Universidad Nacional, and their three, minor children, who are students. Lilian, like so many visionary women, wanting to improve her family's life, started her own business, which consists in clothing sales for women and children, as well as the sale of beauty products, like creams and perfumes. Lilian is asking for funding to buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics which she sells throughout Soyapango's different neighborhoods. She does all this with the goal of providing the best for her children and therby giving them a dignified life, one that meets all their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
E. is a mother of three children. She was abandoned by her husband when she was seriously ill and, by the grace of God, she recovered and put the husband to shame. She is the breadwinner of her family. She and her lovely children live in Mile Three Nkwen, Cameroon.
