E. said that, in the midst of the ups and downs in her life, she constantly told herself that “…I know God can turn my story around”, and that was when she heard about GHAPE. Identifying her group members was the only thing that delayed her enrollment. 

She joined the program in 2008 and has successfully managed and repay her first loan of forty thousand francs. With a second loan, she plans to expand her dress business. She plan to buy in bulk and sell to other final retailers who do not have capital, the position that she was in a few years ago. Hopeful that she will again register success with this loan, she plans to repay the loan in 12 months and use the additional income for the benefit of her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses statement, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy wrappers, bags, and lace dresses

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes M. is from the village of Malamag East. She is 50 years old. Mercedes is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mercedes M..

Mercedes is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes raises pigs for fattening and sale. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP whenever she sells an animal.

In 2008, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mercedes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Plilly O., age 50, is married and has six grown children. She has been selling water and bites to eat at a place called Ubungo Maziwa for 10 years now, and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $60.

This will be Pilly's second loan, called a motisha loan, from Tujijenge Tanzania. (A motisha loan is a loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) She used the first loan to increase her business and has paid it back successfully. Pilly hopes to obtain a loan to further increase her business.
	
Pilly will share this loan with her small loan group Arusha which totals 10 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Pilly is second from the left.

loans.use: To buy more water and make more bites

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Oyuntuya is 65 years old and lives with her grandson in an apartment the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest and capital city of Mongolia. Oyuntuya earns her living by selling clothing and underwear at a counter. She sells a variety of clothing, including men's and women's trainers, underwear, and woolen sweaters to sell to her many customers. Oyuntuya has been operating her business since 2003, and has steadily expanded it since then. She has gained a great deal of business experience over the past seven years. With her earnings, she purchased a car for her eldest son. Oyuntuya is an honest person. She says, “University tuition fees are very high now. Therefore, I have to expand my business and increase my profit in order to help my grandson attend the university.” She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina K., who opened her cosmetics shop two years ago to improve her family’s standard of living, sells a variety of goods, including cream, makeup materials, and glass bangles. She spends her income to help her husband, Raghu Raj K., a government worker, cover the family’s expenses and is now requesting her second loan of 15,000 NPR to buy additional cosmetic goods for her shop.

The mother of two children, a son and daughter, Mina lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her daughter is taking the BSC (nursing) course, and her son is studying in university. Both also help her in her shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Achille

texts.fr: Né en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, T. Achille est marié à ATTIVI SOKLA Julienne, une revendeuse. Il y a près de neuf ans que Achille vit au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Achille  vit dans ce quartier avec sa femme et ses enfants. Achille a en effet, trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Achille a très peu fréquenté. Achille est un peintre. En plus de cette activité qu'il exerce depuis sept ans environs, Achille vend également des peintures à Cotonou. Achille achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à la SOBEPEC (une société de peinture au Bénin). Achille a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Achille sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, in 1975, Achille T. is married to Julienne Attivi Sokla, a retailer. Achille has lived in the Agbalilamè district, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, for nearly nine years. He lives in this area with his wife and his children. Indeed, Achille has three children, two of whom are in school. Together, the couple provides for the various family expenses. Achille himself received very little schooling. Achille is a painter. In addition to this business that he has run for approximately seven years, he also sells paint in Cotonou. Achille buys his supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and also at SOBEPEC (a painting society in Benin). Achille has already received two loans from ALIDé, and has fully repaid them both. With the intention of building his business and increasing his stock, in order to better accommodate his customers, Achille is seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying jars of paint

loans.name: Holger Gonzalo

texts.es:
Holger de 36 años vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas)  de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos. Cuando el era pequeño su familia tenia una joyería y el aprendió a bañar en el asesoro en oro. Cuando creció el necesitaba mantener a su familia y opto por tener el mismo negocio de su familia. 

Ahora el tiene un taller de joyería, fabrica joyería bañada en oro y plata desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días y las vende a los almacenes. Para tener mas Inbesos necesita comprar con el préstamo soldaduras, líquidos etc.  

En el futuro quiere un local de joyería y construir mejo su casa.
texts.en:
Holger is 36 years old and lives in an urban zone of Las Qrquideas (called this because originally there were many orchids) in Guayaquil. He has 3 children. When Holger was very young his family had a jewelry store and he learned to apply gold plating. Then he grew up and needed to maintain his family and opted to pursue the same business as his parents. Now he has a jewelry workshop and makes gold- and silver-plated jewelry from 9:00am until 6:00pm every day. Holger sells his works to general stores. In order to have more income he needs this loan to purchase solders, chemicals, etc. In the future he wants to open a jewelry store and build a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING SOLDERS AND CHEMICALS TO USE IN MAKING JEWELRY

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide et le petit mil. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Baya C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women, on average 47 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their activities at the start of the winter campaign. The crops they speculate on are ground nuts and millet, among others. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Baya C. intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser before prices increase, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate three hectares (approx. 7.5 acres). The crops are sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. They hope to attain an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per campaign.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es: Basilio tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 8 años cultiva verduras y hortalizas, en toda la extensión de terreno que posee. Su esposa, es su principal apoyo en esta actividad, desde entonces ambos cuidan sus plantaciones de plagas, así como dar el adecuado riego y fertilización, esencial para obtener una buena cosecha. Esta labor tendrá su recompensa en la cosecha  ya que  puede ofrecer a los comerciantes mayoristas a un precio regular en el mercado de su zona. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Basilio is 38 years old and lives with his partner and daughter in a rented house. For mO. than 8 years he has cultivated vegetables across all the land he owns. His wife is his principle support in this activity, and both of them protect the crops from plagues of insects and give them adequate fertiliser so that they have a good harvest. This work is rewarded during the harvest as Basilio can offer wholesale business people a regular price in the zone's market. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is very content to know that he has the support of a financial institution. Basilio has always proved to be responsible with his repayments, and is thankful to be part of this communal group because all of the members are responsible and supportive. He will invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser and seeds for the next sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 33-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda, with his wife and four children. His wife is a hairdresser and together they live in a rented house nursing a dream of constructing their own residential home in the near future.

Robert operates a salon which provides services for both men and women. He has been in the business for two years now, having sold charcoal as his first business activity. He notes, however, that machine breakdowns are affecting the operation of the business. He hopes to see his business grow in size and improve the quality of services offered.

Robert intends to use the loan to buy hairdryers for the ladies’ side of the salon and also shampoo and creams.

loans.use: To buy hairdryers for the ladies' side of the salon and also shampoo and creams

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa B. is a married woman who lives in Hacienda  Maruja, Brgy. 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses.  One business sells dried fish and the other rice. Her husband, Joben B., who is 38 years-old, works as a laborer and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are aged 13 to 18 years -old. 

In 2003, Marissa joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marissa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to expand her rice and dried fish businesses so that she can continue to save for the future. Marissa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Uiimdas

texts.en: Uiimdas K. is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his wife have been living in their current home for the past 30 years. Their children are now grown and live separately. Uiimdas operates a taxi service in his local area, using his own car to transport people to and from points in his province. He became a driver in 1976, working in a government agency until 1989. He is a modest and hardworking man. His daughter-in-law runs a small food cafe. Uiimdas says, "I want to build a big restaurant for my son". As his car is now beginning to age, Uiimdas hopes to soon make some needed repairs. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase new tires and repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and repair his car

loans.name: Trabajando Hacia El Bienestar 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Anselma is the coordinator of her group, Trabajando hacia el Bienestar 1, 2 & 3 (Working to the welfare). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house as she is living in bad conditions right now.
Anselma is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year and a half, and she started it by making breakfasts with a loan she took from another company. She plans to use her new loan to invest in her business by buying chairs and tables for her comedor, where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. (A comedor is a small restaurant located in a non-commercial area or neighborhood, where people come for lunch or dinner. They are served homemaD. food for a cheaper price than in a restaurant or cafeteria.) Anselma will use her profits to buy a bed and a television. She plans to have a good, successful business because she wants to see her wishes come true and her business is her only hope. 
This Esperanza associate began with us because "I have a business and I need to make my business sustainable". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la iniciativa de una vecinas quienes decidieron  reunirse y formas un grupo para trabajar De esta forma, se inicia el comité La Victoria Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a de la ciudad de Luque.
 Todas las integrantes de este comité tiene un trabajo especifico e independiente, y de esa forma cada una procura para ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Gloria Rodríguez quien  se dedica a la venta de verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de verduras varias al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio.
Hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ayuda para la alimentación de su familia, ella comenta que tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando y mejorar su actividad, y al mismo tiempo desea vender otros productos que le puedan dejar mayor beneficio.
Es por ello que quiere seguir trabajando con el grupo y en futuro contar con un mayor capital para invertir en la actividad que a ella mejor le convenga.
texts.en:
The current committee was formed thanks to the initiative of some neighbors that decided to unite and form a working group. This is how the committee "La Victoria Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a" of the city of Luque was started. All the members of this group have specific and stand-alone work, and in this way each one of them helps support her family. One of the members is Mrs. Gloria R. who makes a living selling vegetables and invest her money in the purchase of varied vegetables at wholesale to increase her income. She has been working at this for several years and this activity has helped her feed her family. She notes that she wishes very much to continue working and improving her business and at the same time she wants to sell other products that could be more beneficial to her. For these reasons she wants to continue to work with the group and be able to count on more working capital in the future to invest in the business that would best suit her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José E. S. y su esposa desde hace 2 años se dedican a la distribución de chorizo que ellos mismo preparan. Este negocio les ha traído muy buenos ingresos y han tomado clientes que les gusta su producto. Ahora quiere comprar más mercancía para seguir produciendo su producto y así tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
José E. S. and his wife have sold chorizo that they manufacture themselves for the last two years.  The business has produced very good earnings for them and they have regular customers that enjoy their product.

He wants to buy more merchandise to continue making his product and thus have more profits.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mamdy

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMDY O. est âgé e de 30 ans, marié et père   de 1 enfant.  il  vit  dans une famille nucléaire au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Ayant abandonné l’école à bas âge pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus dans le souci de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il  commença très tôt à faire le commerce auprès d’une connaissance qui faisait de la fabrication du savon local. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il finit par évoluer seul pour mener la même activité depuis maintenant  4 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Pour faire du savon il a besoin de la soude caustique, de la pâte noire, de l’huile et d’eau.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Il   est  en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois, après 2 prêts individuels correctement remboursés, il est à son 3ème  prêt individuel   qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 sacs de soude caustiques et 20 fûts de pâtes noires. Il   s’approvisionne sur place. 
Monsieur MAMDY O.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il   envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de renouveler son stock et de payer sa location.
texts.en:
Mr Mamdy O. is 30 years old, married and father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in the Pengana Sud quarter of Segou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
He left school at an early age to carry out income generating activities so he could provide for his family. He started in business very early working for an acquaintance who made soap. After several years of training, he started his own business which he has run now for 4 years. He has a large clientele and is well known.
To make soap, he needs caustic soda, black paste, oil and water.
With the intention of expanding his business, in order to increase his profits and meet client demand which continues to grow, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso. He has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for  24 months, and after 2 individual loans which were duly repaid, he is now looking to take out a 3rd loan which he intends to use to buy 10 bags of caustic soda and 20 barrells of black paste. He sources his supplies locally.
Mr Mamdy Ouedgrago accepts cash and credit and has a clientele made up of both men and women.
With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 100 000FCFA. This profit will allow him to renew his stocks and pay his rent.

.

loans.use: Achat de matières premières pour faire du savon

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos (14,9,5 años).
María Luz, antes esperaba de su esposo, él se enfermo, lo operaron y ya no tenia ingresos porque el que aportaba la casa era él, una amiga le invito a ella y a su hermana a participar en las reuniones de bancomunal en Finca, ingresó y le dieron una semilla pequeña (crédito), con eso surtió un poquito de todo y se puso a vender en su casa y tuvo acogida pues la vecinas le compraban, al siguiente ciclo pidió un poquito más de semilla, en la actualidad vende en su casa abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, ganchitos, viaja a la ferias de la selva lleva abarrotes, verduras entre otros está contenta le va bien tiene, su esposo está mejor y se dedica  a la agricultura (siembran papa, cereales), los productos que sacan le lleva a las ferias y también lo vende en su tienda con el trabajo de la agricultura y sumado su trabajo se compraron un tractor que lo alquilan por horas.
a Maria Luz le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque aprendió a trabajar y ahorrar, su sueño es comprarse un carro y poder llevar sus mercaderías a las ferias y construir su casa porque ya se compró el terrero.
texts.en:
María Luz, 32, is married and has three children (14, 9 and 5 years of age).  She is a member of the Retoño (Sprout) communal bank.

María Luz used to depend on her husband but he became ill and was operated on and had no income; he was the one who used to support the household.  A friend invited her and her sister to participate in Finca’s communal bank meetings and they got a small seed loan that she used to stock a bit of everything and started selling from home.  Her neighbors started buying from her and her store was well received.

During the next cycle she asked for a slightly larger seed loan and she now sells groceries, vegetables, fruits and snacks from home.  She travels to the markets in the countryside to sell groceries and vegetables, among other things.

She is happy and does well.  Her husband is better and has been farming (they grow potatoes and cereals) which she sells in the markets and from her store at home.  With what they earned farming added to her funds from the store they bought a tractor that they lease out by the hour.

María Luz enjoys the communal bank meetings because she learned how to save and how to work.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her merchandise to the markets.  She wants to build her house, too; she already bought the lot.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more wood and sticks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She has a retail business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products from home.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by selling piped water.  Her main business challenges include thieves and transportation.

Her goals and aspirations are to start selling charcoal on wholesale only and to build more rental rooms. Elizabeth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Thuch P. is a 56-year-old married man and father. He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Cham Province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows different kinds of crops on his land, such as rice and corn, which he will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. His wife also helps him in the same business. This couple has three school-aged children. Because his income is just enough for his family’s daily expenses, his house frequently cracks during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, he is requesting a loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: To repair his old house.

loans.name: Alex Franklin

texts.es: Alex Franklin M. A. tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de La Villa en Francisco Morazan. Alex empezo con la cria de ganado desde hace tres años y su padre le enseño a trabajar. Dos veces a la semana èl destaza dos vacas y vende la carne a compradores que tienen carnicerias. El prestamo lo necesita para comprar 3 novillos y asi incrementar su inventario de ganado. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra ofrecer a sus clientes mas carnes. Su desafio es mantener su ganado sano y seguro porque es lo que le permite sostener economicamente. Su meta es convertirse en el mayor ganadero de su comunidad y asi poder darle una mejor condicion de vida a su esposa e hijos. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA.
texts.en: Alex Franklin M. A. is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives with his family in the community of La Villa en Francisco Morazan. Alex began to raise livestock three years ago, and his father taught him how to do the work. Twice a week he slaughters two cows and sells the meat to buyers who have butcher's shops. He needs the loan to buy three young bulls and thus increase his herd. With the help of this loan, he will be able to offer his customers more meat. His challenge is to keep his livestock healthy and safe, because this is what allows him to maintain himself economically. His goal is to become the biggest cattle owner in his community and thus be able to give his wife and children better living conditions. This is his first loan with FAMA.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Florence has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Florence joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florence is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell (e.g. canned goods and junk foods)

loans.name: Moisés Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo López es originario del municipio de Granada, depende solo su esposa, se dedica a laborar como Técnico Electromecánico de equipo de bombeo en una empresa de la localidad desde hace 5 años. 

Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es el de hacer un mejoramiento en su vivienda por tal razón decidió solicitar un préstamo en Ceprodel realizar dicha mejora y así poder tener la satisfacción de cumplir su plan de inversión y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo López is from the town of Granada.  His wife is his only dependent.  He has been employed as pumping equipment Electromechanical Technician for a local firm for the last five years.

One of his needs is home improvement so he decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan to carry out this project thus having the satisfaction of meeting his investment plan and improve his living standard.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia grows rice for a living. She and her husband are both farmers. They cultivate their land to plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest to rice traders.

Delia is a mother of 5 children. Her eldest child is 18 years old, while the youngest is only 6. All her five children go to school. Delia said she and her husband work hard to sustain their family, especially the children's education. It is their dream to see their children succeed in life.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling produce for the last four years. His hardships are poor growing seasons, leading to low supply and changes in the market price. His vision is business expansion, building a house and educating his children. Moris needs the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan O. is from the city of Aguada Ozamiz City. He is 33 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ryan prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Ryan has been engaged in his business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

Ryan joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting his first loan, for 30000 PHP, to be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support two children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.
She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she is able to cook inside the house since the Envirofit cookstove does not emit a lot of smoke like other ordinary woodstoves.

Gina is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more inventory for his timber business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her snack business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Susan has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita, age 54, owns and operates a retail shop where she sells both food items and daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste. Benita has had this business for 13 years. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 a month, which she utilizes for supporting her family's needs.

Benita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, instant noodles, and soft drinks to offer for sale.

In the future, Benita hopes to see her small store expand into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, instant noodles, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with six family members, two of whom work. Hussein has had a shop for men’s shoes since 2007. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients. He is well known in his area. He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to purchase additional goods. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to purchase additional goods.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a resident and farmer in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. He has been in farming for 30 years, producing milk and French beans. He has six children who are all adults.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump to help him set up an irrigation system on his farm. He says the irrigation system will ensure a constant water supply and help his production.

Bernard points at inconsistent rainfall as the main challenge, especially to farmers producing beans. He is happy though about loans advanced by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Kawral Apress Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kawral est créé Juin 2009  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 21 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la gestion de restaurant.

Madame Sounkara  (assise à extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle a 07 autres membres de sa famille en charge (petits fils et petites filles).

Elle vend de la  bouillie de mil et niébé le soir. Cette activité, elle la maîtrise très bien pour l’avoir pratique pendant plus de vingt ans.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des sacs de mil du niébé et du sucre.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir ses petits enfants dans leur formation scolaire.
texts.en:
Kawral is a group that was created in June 2009 on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois. The group is composed of 21 women who are all from the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and managing restaurants.

Ms. Sounkara (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has seven other family members to support (grandsons and granddaughters). She sells millet porridge and black-eyed peas in the evenings. She has mastered this business very well for having done it for over twenty years. 

With this loan, Ms. Sounkara is going to buy sacks of millet, black-eyed peas, and sugar. The profits from her business will enable her to save money and to support her grandchildren’s training and education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of millet, black-eyed peas, and sugar

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 20 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, french beans, potatoes, cabbages and eggs which are all sold to the local market. Farming has been her main source of income. She is 51 and married with four children, one of whom is currently attending school.

With this loan of 45,900 Kenyan shillings, she intends to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income that will be generated from the sale of milk will go towards paying school fees and opening a small kiosk in her location. Her biggest challenges have been pests and diseases and insufficient water for irrigation. She hopes that in the next five years, she will have bought a chaff (hay) cutter and a pick-up truck for transporting her farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Haqiqat

texts.en: Haqiqat is 49 years old, married and has two children. Haqiqat runs her own business selling home furniture in Agcabadi district in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Her shop is located in the central market of the city and everyone who passes by comes in, but still her monthly income from this business is only $300 USD. She would like to increase her profit and start selling plastic furniture. This will allow her to increase her monthly turnover and improve life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory of plastic furniture

loans.name: Manoelalo

texts.fr:
Manoelalo est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 04enfants.
Manoelalo travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et des mèches depuis 1998. Elle vend dans une boutique à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Manoelalo a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: Manoelalo is a 49-year old woman. She is married to a soldier and has 4 children. She has been selling groceries and hair extensions from her home-based store since 1998. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Manoelalo is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy more groceries for resale.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is proud that she is a full-blooded Igorot, an ethnic group in the mountains of northern Luzon. Cynthia did not finish college because of financial shortage. She is 41 years old, married and has five children.

Cynthia is engaged in a business direct-selling lipstick, lotion, shampoo and fragrances. She wanted to help her husband in sustaining their family needs and to give a better future to their children. Cynthia doesn’t want her children to experience suffering, so that’s why she is doing her best for them.

Cynthia is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy shoes, sandals, shirts, face powder and roll-on to sell to her customers around their village. Her goal is to have all of her five children finish their college and become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, shirts, face powder and roll-on to sell

loans.name: Favian

texts.es: El señor Favian, es productor lechero y su esposa es artesana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera para así aumentar la producción de leche y a la vez sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Cota Cota  en la provincia Los Andes en el departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Favian is a milk producer and his wife is an artisan. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase both his milk production and his income. He lives in his own home in the town of Cota Cota in Los Andes Province in the Department of La Paz. Favian is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma is 60 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 30 and 25.  In 2000, she established  her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy foodstuffs for her business.  In the future, Goma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. As a borrower to improve living standard extra training is needed.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a "chiya pasal," these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат замужем, мать двоих детей Муж является колхозником. На рынке она торгует фруктами и овощами, продукцией сельского хозяйства. Полученный займ она хочет использовать для ежедневного приобретения свежей сельхоз продукции и её перепродажи на рынке. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу доброту и помощь. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Nazokat is married and is a mother of two children.  Her husband is a farm worker.  Nazokat sells fruits and vegetables, agricultural crops at the market.  She wants to use the obtained loan for the daily purchases and resale of agricultural products at the market.  She thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and help.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy alegre, vive en compañía de pareja y sus tres hijos de 13,9 y 6 años respectivamente, en una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Sandra es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza, para lo cual cuenta con un local acondicionado como bar, que funciona por la tardes hasta la noche, ahí instaló mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes, así como un congelador donde poder enfriar sus bebidas. Tiene ocho años dedicandose a este trabajo, asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de un joven quien se encarga de atender a la gente, siendo su trabajo remunerado cada semana. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es los ingresos que le genera, por ser preferido por el público masculino y de esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar su local, acondionarlo para mejorar el ambiente. Este sería su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más bebidas entre cervezas y gaseosas de diversas marcas y en mayor volumen, y así podrá tener mejor márgen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Sandra, 30, is a hardworking, enterprising, very cheerful woman living with her spouse and three children who are 13, 9 and 6 years of age respectively in a rented house.  Sandra sells soft-drinks and beer.  She has a locale set up as a bar that’s open from the afternoon into the night.  She set up chairs and tables there to take care of customers as well as a freezer to cool her beverages.  She’s been in business eight years and also employs a young man who waits on tables earning a weekly salary.  What she likes about her work is that it generates income because the men prefer it and she’s able to help her husband cover household expenses this way.  She plans to expand the locale and improve its environment.

This would be her 3rd MFP loan so she hopes for support from all of you.  She will use the requested amount to buy larger amounts of beer and soft-drinks of assorted brand to earn a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: MatilD. tiene 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía D. sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, en su propia casa, la cual logró comprar a base D. mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza MatilD. , es la venta D. pescado fresco y seco. Entonces, desD. muy temprano se levanta para dirigirse al puerto mas cercano, en donD. compra el pescado fresco y lo lleva a su casa, ahí tiene un espacio acondicionado para la venta D. éstos productos. En este negocio, sus hijos la apoyan atendiendo a la clientela, que son muchos. Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a este trabajo, y gracias a ello ha logrado independizarse económicamente, y pueD. contribuir con los gastos D. su hogar y satisfacer las necesidades principales D. sus hijos. Sin embargo el estar en contacto con la humedad le ha traído problemas D. salud, como dolores en los huesos. Considera rentable por la acogida que tiene entre sus vecinos que siempre le compran su producto. Este será el crédito número cinco con la institución MFP, y se siente muy contenta con su grupo, pues lo considera como personas solidarias que se apoyan mutuamente, están siempre en comunicación y toman acuerdos para seguir trabajando unidas. Con el préstamo solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra D. más pescado.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 45 years old; she’s a hardworking woman.  She lives with her four children and her husband in her own house which she managed to buy thanks to much effort.  MatilD. sells fresh and dried fish.  

She rises very early to head to the nearest port to buy fresh fish.  She takes it home where she has a space set asiD. to sell these products.  Her children help her in the business tending to customers, which are quite a few.  

She’s been in this line of work for four years and thanks to it she’s managed to become economically independent and is able to contribute to household expenses and cover her children’s basic needs.  However, being in contact with dampness has caused her some health problems like pain in her bones.  She considers the welcome she has among her neighbors who always buy her products to be profitable.

This will be loan #5 with MFP.  She feels very happy with her group because she considers them to be mutually supportive people who help each other out; they are always in communication and they make decisions to continue to work together.  She will use the requested loan to buy more fish.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Nestor has a shop where he sells fish like sardines, milk fish & trout. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Nestor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nestor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nicson

texts.en:
Nicson aims to acquire higher output every harvest season from his farming business. Harvest season usually falls during the months of April and November. He involved himself in rice farming as source of his income because he was not able to seek better employment. He had once worked as a security guard but moved into rice farming. 

Nicson is 31-years-old, married and has one child.

He would like to ensure good crops from his farming business but he has inadequate funds to sustain his rice field. In this regard, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy four bags of rice seed and 12 bags of fertilizer to use in farming.

In the future Nicson would like to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice seed and 12 bags of fertilizer to use in farming.

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Saúl Humberto tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Saúl se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar insumos.

El sueño es poder tener un terreno. No se le presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Saul Humberto, 32, lives with his partner and their two children--11- and 5-years old, respectively--in Ventana, a canton of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios. 

Saul Humberto is a member of the Las Palmas community bank in the rural town of Campo Alegre.
 
Saul Humberto has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He buys and sells whatever he needs in Ventanas.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for his farming business.
 
Your loan will help Saul Humberto pay for the supplies he needs. His dream is to buy land.  He's never had problems of this kind before. In his spare time, he likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia, 48, makes baskets for a living. Her baskets are made of "nito" (a tropical vine). Melecia has been in this business for 15 years. She works hard to make her products of good quality.

Melecia has requested this loan to purchase nito and other materials to make baskets. She hopes to earn better and be able to send her two children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nito and other materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 25-year-old married woman with two children not yet in school. She has had a business selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for the past year. Angelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a forty-nine-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years, and the major hardship is price fluctuations and inflation. However, she has a vision of expanding her business into new areas.

The purpose of the loan is to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is 47 years old and lives in the Kitale area of Kenya. She has six children who are the love of her life. The reason why this mother wakes up every day, motivated to work hard, is to give her children a good life. Jovia has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To provide a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, Jovia finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest business challenge is meeting demand, which is really high. Jovia lacks funds to increase her poultry farm. Jovia is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy poultry. Her loan will help her to sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and the local market. This will translate into increased profit and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Jovia intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. She will use the profit from her loan to repay her loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her six school-going children. 
Help Jovia to start off on the right foot in her poultry business and let her improve her life. A loan will do a lot for her. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Caminemos Al Futuro  Ii Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO II, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia María Antonieta continúa  con su negocio de ferretería, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa la cual espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia sigue vendiendo clavos, cemento, bidones, pinturas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de clavos, cemento entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: para la compra de clavos, cemento entre otros.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan Erinmwinorose is a 45-year-old woman with two children who has acquired one year training in her business.  She lives in Benin city, Edo state of Nigeria. She plans to expand her business with the money she has requested.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Faataumamate

texts.en: Faataumamate is a 47-year old woman with seven children to support.  Her husband’s meager income cannot cover the expenses for this large family, and Faataumamate’s farm is critical to providing for the education of her children.  She can earn usually earn ST 200 – 400 (approximately USD 115 – 150) a week by selling the taro that she raises at the local market, but Faataumate feels that she could do more if she could access the necessary funds to grow her farm.  To expand her farm, Faataumamate wants to buy some fertilizer to increase the yield of her taro farm as well as to buy some beef cattle to raise.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.ru:
Mukhtor P. is married and has 4 children. He has been in business for 7 years, 2 of which he has been working with Microinvest. He began his business with only 5-6 kilograms (10-12 lbs) of dry fruits. Today, he sells no more than 15-20 kilograms (30-40 lbs) of dry fruits. His large family includes his father and mother, his wife and 4 children. His children must continue to go to school—the reason he asks for help. Mukhtor P. asks for $1000 to increase his trading volume.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Пулотов Мухтор женат, имеет 4 детей. Бизнесом занимается 7 лет, из них 2 года работает с Микроинвест. Начинал свой бизнес всего 5-6кг сухофруктов. Сейчас он продает не более 15-20 кг сухофруктов. Семья у него большая, отец, мать, жена и дети. В его семье зарабатывает только он. Дети учатся в школе. Поэтому ему нужна поддержка со стороны нашей организации. Пулотов Мухтор просит 1000$ для увеличения своего товарооборота.

loans.use: Increase trading volume

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita sells groceries, vegetables, plastic items, clothes, beauty prodcuts, and snacks. She decided to begin her business in an effort to take control of her own finances and to be somebody important in life. She developed her business in San José de Sisa, departamento de San Martín – Perú. Lita's business has grown considerably, and she is now able to cover the cost of her family's necessities.

Lita uses the loans that she receives from Movimiento Manuela Ramos through her Banco Comunal Doradinas to purchase new products, to purchase greater quantities of goods to sell, and to more or less satisfy the needs of her clients who live in her community and those who live around the outskirts of her community. With her last loan she received $625 USD.

Lita is 39 years old and has two kids, the older of which helps with her business. Lita's goal is to open her own market that sells textiles, so that she can employ the women in her community through her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Lita se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, plásticos, ropa, pasamanería y golosinas. Decidió iniciar su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos y ser alguien importante en la vida. Desarrollando su actividad en San José de Sisa, departamento de San Martín – Perú. El negocio ha crecido considerablemente ya que ella cubre las necesidades de su familia.

Los prestamos que ha recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, las invierte en la compra de productos variados y en mayores cantidades y poder así vender al por mayor y menor para llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en la misma comunidad, como los que vienen de los distritos aledaños. Ella en su último crédito ha recibido el monto de S/2,000 ($625).

Tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, de los cuales el mayor la ayuda en el negocio, su meta es llegar a abrir una tienda de mercería y tejidos y dar trabajo como tejedoras a las mujeres de la comunidad.

loans.use: To buy various products to sell

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana has done craftwork since she was very young like the majority of the women in her community. She is 45 years old, has six children, and her spouse is a floriculturalist (sowing of flowers, especially roses). About a year and a half ago she suffered an embolism that affected half of her body, and since that time she has not been able to embroider. Now, she deals in fabric which she distributes to other women who embroider it to create the finished product to sell in Santo Domingo . She is part of the Crisantema 1 group.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

SEBASTIANA ha sido artesana desde muy pequeña al igual que la mayoría de las mujeres de su comunidad. Ella tiene 45 años, siete hijos y su esposo se dedica a la floricultura (siembra de flores, especialmente rosas). Hace aproximadamente año y medio ella sufrió una embolia afectando la mitad de su cuerpo, desde entonces no ha podido bordar, ahora ella compra la tela y paga a otras mujeres para que borden las prendas obteniendo de esta forma el producto terminado y lo vende en Santo Domingo. Forma parte del grupo Crisantema 1.

loans.use: Craftwork

loans.name: Sayfullo

texts.ru:
Sayfullo A., 50, is married and has 5 children. He sells fruits and vegetables on one of the markets of Dushanbe. Sayfullo has been in business for 5 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of fruits and vegetables. Sayfullo A. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Сайфулло, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Сайфулло занимается продажей овощами и фруктами на одном из рынков в городе Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести большее количество овощей и фруктов для дальнейшей их реализации. Так как клиент торгует в самом городе Душанбе, столице Республики Таджикистан, он даст возможнодсть жителям города приобретать свежие овощи фрукты по более низким ценам и получать необходимое количество витаминов, так необходимое в зимнее время. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
Maria Marta López V. belongs to the communal bank El Gran Pajaten, she lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. Her business is located at Jr. Cahuide Nº 386 where she sells basic necessities and groceries.

Thanks to the support of her husband and children she has been able to grow her business and today finds herself with a well-stocked business, and she also sells cacao and orange seeds which increases her income.

With the 600.00 Soles loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy crates of eggs, dozens of bottles of oil, sacks of rice and sugar, among other things, and with the rest she will use in the cacao and orange crops.

Maria is very talkative and happy, she is 57 years old, she lives with her husband and grandchildren, she works with enthusiasm and pride of the projects she has been able to complete and make reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Marta López V. pertenece al banco comunal El Gran Pajaten, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Cahuide Nº 386 y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos logró incrementar su negocio, actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien surtido y también cuenta con sembríos de cacao y naranja que incrementan su ingreso económico.

Con el préstamo de S/.600.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará huevos en jabas, aceites en botellas por docenas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, entre otros y con lo que le resta lo utilizará en la cosecha de cacao y naranjas.

La señora Maria es muy comunicativa y alegre, tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus nietos, trabaja con entusiasmo y esmero para lograr que sus proyectos se hagan realidad.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (eggs, oil, rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Ms. Zarifa is low-income, vulnerable woman (her sone is pictured). She is 56 and lives with her family in the village of Saatli city in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. Zarifa has a herd of five cows. She started her business with the assistance of her son five years ago with one cow, and now she ihas ncreased the number of animals in the herd up to five. Now she has applied to Normicro Saatli branch to receive a $300 loan to build the open shed for the cattle.

loans.use: To build an open shed for cattle

loans.name: Kyerinda East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah M.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Sarah is 25 years old and is married to her husband, who is a mechanic for work. She has 3 children, all of whom go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and boost her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Suzan N., Rose Kalembe, Aliziki N., and Magret B.. Suzan N. has a business rearing cows and wants to buy insecticides and cow feed. Rose Kalembe is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to purchase chicken mash (feed). Aliziki N. operates a retail shop business and wants to increase stock. Magret B. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and uplift business.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Rosalina Francisco

texts.pt:
Rosalina Francisco M. was born in Maputo in 1964. She had to drop out of school after completing the 7th grade due to a asthma condition. She lived with her parents until 1982 when she got married and had one daughter who is now 23 years old. In 1984, she divorced her husband and, along with her daughter, moved in with her parents. A war broke out in 1985 and the Secondary School in Manhica, where she worked as a tailor, had to shut its doors. Two years later, she married her second husband, with whom she had 5 children - the oldest is now 20 years old. She has held a tailor position at the Boane's orphanage since 2001. She found out about HLUVUKU- ADSEMA through co-workers and community leaders from Mahelane. They told her about the services that were available and she decided to request a credit line in the amount of 16,000.00 MT, which would be used to build her home. Plans for the future include taking out a credit line to continue building her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalina Francisco M., Nasceu em Maputo em 1964 e estudou apenas ate a 7ª classe pois a saúde dela não era das boas, pois sofria de asma.through co-workers and community leaders from Mahelane. They told her about the services that were available and she decided to request a credit line in the amount of 16,000.00 MT which would be used to build her home. Viveu sob a responsabilidade dos pais ate 1982 quando contraiu o matrimónio, o qual resultou em uma filha que actualmente tem 23 anos de idade. Em 1984 divorciou se do marido tendo levado com ela a filha para a casa dos pais. Em 1985 trabalhou na Escola secundaria da Manhiça como costureira, mas porque era tempo da guerra fecharam a instituição. Em 1987 juntou com outro marido com o qual teve 5 filhos, sendo a mais velha de 20 anos de idade. Trabalha na Casa de acolhimento de crianças orfãs em Boane, desde 2001 como costureira ate então. Conhece a HLUVUKU- ADSEMA graças aos colegas de trabalho e os lideres da comunidade de Mahelane Que lhes falarão sobre os serviços da mesma e teve a coragem de aproximar e pedir um credito no valor 16.000,00MT para aplicar na continuidade de construcao da sua habitação. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para aplicar nos acabamentos da sua obra.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build families house

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas B. sells cosmetics and beauty supplies. She is not yet married and has no children. She is a young woman who is focused on developing herself and expanding her business. She wishes to increase sales, but lacks capital.

She is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maricela Del Scocorr

texts.es:
Five years ago, when her youngest daughter was born, Maricela decided to leave her work to dedicate more time to her children. Because she still needed to generate income, she looked for a way to earn money and still be with her family, eventually starting her business selling clothing. Now, thanks to what her mother taught her, she is able to make her own garments. She offers her customers good prices, made to order pieces and new clothing.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, so she can purchase a sewing machine

Maricela, desde hace 5 años cuando nació su ultima hija decidió dejar de trabajar para poder dedicarse mas a sus pequeñas, pero ante la necesidad de ingresos económicos, busco la manera de tener un negocio en el cual no descuidara a sus hijas y fue así como inicio con la venta de ropa, pero ahora gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre ha aprendido a elaborar ella misma las prendas, redituándole mejor ya que le da un buen precio a la gente y les hace la ropa a la medida y las prendas son nuevas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una maquina para de coser para poder hacer ella misma la ropa que vende.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SEWING MACHINE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Silvina is a widow and has three grown-up and married children. She lives alone.

To remain active and earn extra income, she attended an informational session on the use of natural products six years ago. Following her own positive experience of using these products, she recognised their sales potential and decided to join and has been part of the distribution network that sells natural products ever since.

Silvina requires a loan of $450, repayable over six months, to purchase stock and to fulfil the orders she has already received and are outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Silvina es viuda tiene 3 hijos ya adultos y casados, ella vive sola y para mantenerse activa demas de percibir ingresos extra, deicidio emprender su negocio todo surgio cuando la invitaron a una platica de informacion de productos naturistas cuando ella empezo a consumir estos productos, como ella tuvo una experiencia positiva con estos productos, estaba convencida de que realmente cumplian lo que prometian por lo le fue muy facil venderlos, y desde hace 6 años es distribuidora de red de esta marca.

Ahora ella necesita un prestamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes.

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Sesilia M., 35 is married, and has three children aged 6,10 and 13. In 2004, Sesilia established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $260 every month from this business. Sesilia requires a loan in order to buy more material. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to then, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more material.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Ndèye G. and Omou Khairy K. are two very dynamic women. They formed a group to work together, and their main business is the sale of second-hand clothes. They have benefited from two previous loans, which they repaid without incident. It is with the goal of increasing their stock that they are asking for this new loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndèye G. et Oumou Khaïry K. sont deux femmes très dynamiques . Elles se sont constituées en groupe pour travailler ensemble et leur principale activité est la vente de fripperie. Elles ont eu à bénéficier de deux prêts qu'elles ont remboursé correctement. C'est dans le but de renforcer leur stock qu'elles contractent ce nouveau prêt.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 37 years and is married. She sells buns. She works selling buns everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sakina now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Pon Than's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which consists of thirty-one members, is located in Au Da Village in Kampong Cham Province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Pon T. is the village bank president and she is a pig and cow breeder. Since the fist business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. PhE. ThE., is a construction foreman who can make little income to support his famiL.. Mrs. T. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to wO. or study because that child is five.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: These people would like to create and improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị  C. năm nay 48 tuổi, hiện chị là chủ cửa hàng kinh doanh bia, nước giải khát tại xã Đồng Tâm huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày với sự giúp đỡ của chồng công việc kinh doanh của chị có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Ngoài việc bán bia cho khách hàng lẻ cửa hàng của chị còn cung cấp bia cho các cửa hàng nhỏ trong huyện  nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Với thu nhập 4.000.000đ / tháng  việc hoàn trả vốn của  chị C. cũng rất thuận lợi. Chị mong muốn trong thời gian tới chị được vay thêm 20.000.000 để đầu tư mua thêm bia về bán cho các cửa hàng tại địa phương nhằm  tăng thêm nguồn thu nhập cho gia đình, ngày càng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho các con ăn học.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 48 years old. She currently has a small café shop, selling beer and soft drinks in Dong Tam, Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. With the assistance of her husband, the café has been going very well. In addition to selling beer in her café, she supplies it to other café shops in her town, so her family’s income has been relatively stable. With a monthly income of 4.000.000 VND, Mrs. C. is very on time in paying back her loans. In the next round of loan, Mrs. C. would like to borrow 20.000.000 VND ($1200) to stock more beer for her own café as well as to sell it for other shops in her area, thereby earning more money to send her kids to good schools.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Muhitdin

texts.en: Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why from a young age Muhitdin D. has dedicated himself to this business and today is seeking a way to expand his efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and two children.  The problem he faces today is the lack of capital financing for the production of vegetables like potatoes. For this reason, he trustfully approached IMON to ask for a loan for farming to continue supporting his humble home and develop his profession economically.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M. is a group leader of four members, who all live in Phum Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sinat M. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is four years old, too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Koy Pearom, is a vet in the local village.

Mrs. Sinat M. sells clothes in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Buy more fashionable clothes for her customers

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 23 years old and lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver for a year. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have much start-up capital, which made it hard for him to purchase a car. He decided to start his business because he always wanted to be independent in his work.

Khaled has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура женщина 34 лет , имеет двоих детей, муж электрик.Мастура закупает хлопковое масло оптом с маслозаводов и продаёт в разлив в розницу.Мастура продаёт качественное рафинированое масло,поэтому у неё очень хороший поток клиентов.Благодаря этому бизнесу у неё улучшилось состояние проживания семьи увеличился товарооборот.Мастура постоянный клиент Микроинвест
texts.en:
Mastura is a 34 year old woman with two children. Her husband is an electrician. Mastura buys cottonseed oil wholesale from a factory and sells it retail, on tap.
