Because Mastura sells such high quality purified oil she has a good stream of customers. Thanks to this business her family's living situation has improved and sales have increased. Mastura is a regular Microinvest client.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Foods

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es: El grupo " Barrio Lindo" esta representado por la señora Julia y esta conformado por  16 mujeres  y 5 hombres. En general los socios (as) se dedican a actividades como el transporte publico D. pasajeros  y a la venta D. productos como ropa, perfumes, pan, caña, carne y a la elaboración D. pan y a la construcción D. viviendas. Ante cualquier adversidad saben como salir adelante  mediante el  esfuerzo y seriedad que les caracteriza es por eso que no tienen miedo a la competencia.  El crédito que les otorgó agrocapital  es para  compra D. insumos, mercadería, materiales  e instrumentos D. trabajo para poder mejorar en sus negocios e incrementar sus ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. así como en el manejo D. fondos otorgados y la responsabilidad que se necesita para poder cumplir  con sus obligaciones es por este motivo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda una ayuda para mejorar sus ingresos. existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Mirtha y Pedro, Tambien Diki y Wilmar los cuales son hermanos pero todos tienen independencia económica por lo que no existe riego dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
The Group "Barrio Lindo" is maD. up of 16 women and 5 men. The members work in various activities including public transportation, sales of products such as clothing, perfume, bread, sugar cane, meat, as well as construction of houses. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, materials, and work tools to grow their respective businesses and help improve the quality of life for their families. The majority of the members have experience in work groups and in managing grants. They are responsible and able to comply with their obligations, which is why the foundation, Agrocapital, is supporting them in their efforts to increase their income. There is a family relationship between Mirtha and Pedro, as well as with Diki and Wilmar who are brothers. However, each member has financial independence.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help fund the various businesses in this group, including public transportation, clothing sales and construction.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre and his wife have one daughter who is nine years old. He offers taxi services in his city and between cities. He has been in this business for six years. Andre uses his personal car as a cab. His business goal is to pay his car loan and to be able to use the profit from his business to improve his family's living conditions. Andre would like to receive a loan of $950 to purchase a license, buy insurance and pay for minor car repairs.

loans.use: to purchase license, insurance and car repair

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Акилов Ахрор мужчина 34 лет , женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается бизнесом продажи видеокассет и дисков. Его ассортимент  с каждым кредитом увеличивается новыми кинофильмами и концертами. Следующий кредит он также хочет использовать для закупа товара. Он берёт займ в Микроинвест уже второй год. Его мини маркет расположен в центре Худжанда , поэтому у него хороший поток клиентов. Ахрор благодарит KIVA за сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Ahror A. is a 34 year old man, he is married and has two children. He sells videotapes and CDs. His product assortment increases with every loan with new movies and concerts. He would also like to use his next loan to purchase products. This is the second year that he is taking a loan from MicroInvest. His minimarket is located in the center of Khujand and this is why he has a good stream of customers. Ahror is grateful to KIVA for its partnership.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of videotapes

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon A., a 37-year-old farmer who is assisted by his wife, grows onion and corn to support his family's daily needs. Gafurjon comes from a family of farmers, and through agriculture he is able to build the future of his children. He started cultivating his small parcel of land in 2004, the harvest being used primarily for family consumption with the remainder sold in the market. Currently Gafurjon is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer for his crop. He and his family sincerely thank Kiva and its lenders.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Milca

texts.en: Milca H. is a 55-year-old, married with 2 children; she lives in Panaon, Mis Occ.  She started her business when she joined Paglaum.   She sells such things as pots, clothes, slippers, and other items.  Milca is trying hard for them to live comfortably with Paglaum MPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is commonly called “Leoni” (her nickname) in their village. She is now a widow and has two children: Fredillon and Fredelyns. They live in a rural community located in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Her eldest already graduated from college.

Leoni is thankful for having her vending business as source of income to provide for the education of her youngest child. Leoni is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital for her vending business. She is very proactive in her business as she goes around her village selling her vegetables instead of having a shop in front of her home like some do. Having the loan will give Leoni the opportunity she needs to work hard and grow her business.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Promise Kabugho Betty Group

texts.en:
K. Betty is a forty-eight-year-old businesswoman who is widowed with two children schooling. She has a drug shop which she has operated since 2007. She has less capital than she needs and so could not meet her customers’ demands. She is using the loan to purchase various drugs to meet her customers’ demands.

K. Betty is a hardworking woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase various drugs to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Abdul Saboor

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is A. Saboor, the son of A. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old. He is married with six children. He is the only one at home that is responsible for paying the house expenses. 

He is a farmer and has been involved in this business more than 15 years. He is much experienced in the field of farming. He has requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani to buy more seeds and the required tools for farming. 

He really wants to progress and have an advanced business. He is confident that with the loan he will be able to work in a better way and will support all his family members

Finally, he would like to extend his gratitude to the Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and tools

loans.name: Ismot

texts.en: Ismot sells baby items. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. Ismot lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Ismot is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more baby items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Skylight Group

texts.en:
The Skylight Group is new to SMEP, and all fifteen members have requested their first loans of either Ksh 15,000 or Ksh 20,000.

The Organizing Secretary of Skylight Group is Violet N., who owns Ghemt Hardware store in Githunguri, a growing trading center outside Nairobi. Violet has run this business for the past eight months, selling electronic goods and building materials such as cable, bulbs, pipes, cement and nails. Previously, Violet was employed as a cashier for three years, and used her savings to open the hardware store.

Violet has requested a loan to purchase more expensive materials such as cable, cement and paint to sell. She would like to one day be a wholesaler of electrical goods and other hardware.

Violet is married, and is the mother of two children: a 12-year-old girl and a 7-year-old boy. She describes herself as principled. She believes in herself and achieves whatever she puts her heart into.

The other members of the Skylight group own a diverse set of businesses including a cereal shop, a restaurant, a grocery, and a clothing shop. In addition, some members transport water and buy/sell plots of land.

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her business

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely renders services like pedicure and manicure in their village. According to her, she just started selling barbecue stick, balot and native cakes in the afternoon for her to have additional income.  She hopes to maintain and grow her business by availing an additional working capital of at least PHP4, 000. She really hopes to avail the loan to have sufficient revolving capital for her businesses. This will help her in supplementing the educational needs of her children. 

Nely have four children whom two are presently studying. Her eldest child will pursue her education in college next school year and she’s preparing for that time to come. Her husband is a carpenter and he is currently working in Manila, a place away from them. This is the only way they know to provide their family with sufficient support.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer to strengthen the soil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, or Opin as she is fondly called, is a resident of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Valentino; they have four children, three female and one male. They are all in school. The eldest is in college while the others are in secondary and elementary levels. As parents, Josephine and Valentino want all of their children to finish their studies and find stable jobs someday. 

Farming is their main source of income. Their crops include rice, vegetables and corn. To assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family, Josephine decided to begin selling fish, meat and vegetables in their village. With a small amount of capital, she was then able to start her own business in the public market of Diadi. Through her patience and sacrifices, she earns a net income of PHP 700 a week, which she carefully budgets for the daily needs of their family and the tuition fees and allowances of their children. 

She wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from the Kiva lenders for the improvement of her business. Through the loan, she can purchase more merchandise that she believes will result in an increased income.

loans.use: improving her food selling business

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is from the village of Taguilon. She is 36 years old. Rosevilla is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla raises and sells pigs. Rosevilla is just starting this business.

In 2007, Rosevilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Rosevilla's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells drinks at the market. She is 46 years old and married with two children. With her profit, she helps her family. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Chiwe

texts.en: Chiwe sells hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices in her shop. She is not a hair stylist but she sells hair materials to make a living. She is happy because the high season is here and she hopes to make more sales during this season. She is 33 years old, married with a child. Her child is doing well in school. Chiwe is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Queta

texts.es:
Queta tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo David, de 53 años, y con sus “tres Marías”, que son sus simpáticas hijas: María Alejandra de 25, María de los Ángeles de 22 y María Milagros de 16 años. Todos juntos viven muy felices en su casa propia, la cual es una de las más visitadas de su pueblo, debido a su negocio.

Cada día Queta debe despertar muy temprano e idear las comidas que preparará para durante el para sus clientes, pues ha habilitado parte de su sala y comedor para atender a varias personas que la visitan diariamente a la hora del almuerzo.
Cada día hay nuevos sabores y aromas que deleitan a los más exigentes paladares, quien escribe puede dar fe de eso, y lo mejor de todo es que son preparados con baja condimentación; lo que es difícil de encontrar en la ciudad, la señora Queta sabe que sus comidas son únicas y está muy orgullosa de ello.
Pero ella o sólo prepara comida, sino también tortas, postres y jugos de frutas, para esta labor la ayuda su esposo cuando tiene tiempo, y de sus hijas para la atención de los comensales. Todos trabajan a diario juntos, con el propósito de salir adelante, están más que satisfechos, ya que las ganancias son muy buenas y para el futuro sueñan con ampliar su negocio.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Queta con MFP y está segura de cumplir, como siempre, con cada pago, ya que es muy responsable y no quiere quedar mal, ni dejar mal a su banco comunal que trabaja duro para avanzar puntualmente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la reparación de su apreciada cocina, la cual la ha acompañado durante 5 años, y necesita mantenimiento para seguir funcionando en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Queta is 52 years old and lives with her husband David, 53, and their “three Marías” - their lovely daughters María Alejandra, 25, María de los Ángeles, 22, and María Milagros, 16. They all live happily together in their own home, which, due to their business, is one of the most visited in town.
Every day Queta wakes up very early to think up the meals she will prepare for her customers throughout the day. She has converted part of her living room and dining room to serve the various people who visit every day around lunch time.
Every day there are new flavours and aromas that delight the most discerning of palates, to which this writer can attest. Best of all, the meals are prepared with subtle seasoning, which is difficult to find in the city. Queta knows that her meals are unique and she is very proud of them.
Not only does she prepare meals, but she also makes cakes, desserts and fruit juices. Her husband helps her with this work when he has the time; her daughters also help serve the diners. They all work together each day with the goal of getting ahead. They are more than satisfied since their profits are very good. For the future, they dream of expanding their business.
This is Queta’s eighth loan with MFP and she is confident that she will, like always, make each payment. She is very responsible and does not want to get into financial trouble or make any problems for her communal bank, which works hard to keep moving forward. She will use the requested money to improve her much appreciated kitchen, which has served her well for 5 years and needs maintenance to keep it in perfect working condition.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen repair

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina A. B. is from the village of Mobod in Oroquieta City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Felomina owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and Kiva. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Razel's Group

texts.en:
Razel M. is from the village of Baculod, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 31 years old. Razel is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Razel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Razel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Razel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Razel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Razel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Razel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Razel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas 123 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Exitosas (Successful Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a town on the north coast reliant on a fading tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and five children.

Lucia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and making sheets and curtains. She will do so by purchasing brassieres and panties in the main market in Santiago as well as cloth to sew her sheets and curtains. She will use the profits to invest in her business by constructing a commercial venue as part of her home and to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a dozen panties, brassieres, and cloth to sew curtains and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth H. is a leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Phdau Cheung village in Takeo province. The members of this loan hope to increase their income to support their families. Mrs. Sareth H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Sam, is a construction worker who can receive a small salary to support his family. Although this couple tries to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sareth H. is now requesting 800,000 Riels to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Sareth H. is 30 years old and the mother of four children. Two of the children attend the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: Née en  1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, T. Geneviève est mariée à REKPE Placide et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leurs charges. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Hêvié, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis six ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Geneviève a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle mène passionnément depuis une douzaine d’année, et qui lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Parallèlement, Geneviève vend dans son atelier de coiffure, des mèches et divers produits de beauté. Geneviève a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Face aux exigences de sa clientèle, Geneviève sollicite un deuxième prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son stock de produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Geneviève T. is married to Placide REKPE and is the mother of two children. The couple also takes care of two other children. Only some of them have had schooling. The family has been living for the past six years in Hêvié, in the Abomey Calavi commune. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Genevieve has learned hairdressing, an activity she has practiced with passion for over 12 years, and which allows her to meet the needs of her family. As a side business in her beauty salon, Genevieve sells hair extensions and various beauty products. Genevieve has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, and has repaid it in full. Given her customers' demands, she is now requesting a second loan, to strengthen her activity and increase her stock of supplies.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa K. âgé de 58 ans sollicite pour la deuxième fois un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des moutons et chèvres. Il est éleveur  depuis 35 ans et fait également le commerce de bétail.  Il est Peulh une ethnie qui s’adonne le plus à ce métier d’éleveurs au Sénégal.  Il a été initié à ce métier par ses parents et y parvient à régler tous ses besoins.
Monsieur Moussa K. est marié père de 5 enfants dont la moyenne d’âge est égale à 12 ans. En plus de sa famille, il a en charges 7 personnes qui sont soient des neveux, nièces et sœurs. 
« Ce métier m’a permis entre autre de régler les besoins de la maison et j’ai même acheté une maison avec les bénéfices gagnés » dixit Monsieur K..
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa K., aged 58, is requesting for the second time a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying sheep and goats.  He has been a livestock farmer for 35 years and also trades in livestock.  He is Fulani, an ethnic group that is devoted the most to the livestock trades in Senegal.  He was introduced to this trade by his parents, and he has met all his needs through it.  Mr. K. is married and the father of five children, whose average age is twelve.  In addition to his family, he supports seven people, who would be nephews, nieces, or sisters.  "This trade has enabled me, among other things, to take care of the needs at home, and I even bought a house with the profits earned," says Mr. K..

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep and goats

loans.name: Agusta

texts.es: LA SRA. AGUSTA S. Y., TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD ES UNA MUJER MUY LUCHADORA, TIENE 3 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, QUE DEPENDEN DE ELLA. ES PERSPICAZ AL DETECTAR LA NECESIDAD DE CRECER EN SU ACTIDAD, PROYECTANDO MEJORAS EN SU PUESTO DE VENTA PARA ASI CONSOLIDAR SUS INGRESOS, A TRAVES DE UN CREDITO QUE LE PERMITA OFRECER UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SU CLIENTELA, LO QUE LE ASEGURARIA A LA VEZ SU CONSOLIDACION Y FORTALECIMIENTO DE SU MEDIO DE VIDA, QUE SE VEERIA REFLEJADA EN UNA MEJOR EDUCACION Y EJEMPLO PARA SUS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS EN LO QUE SE REFIERE A LA LUCHA POR MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA SUPERACION.
texts.en:
Augusta S. Y., 41, is a very tenacious woman. She has three minor children that are dependent on her. She was keenly aware that she needed to enlarge her business making improvements to her sales stall so that income would improve. She is asking for funds that will make it possible for her to offer better service to her customers which will lead to the consolidation and strengthening of her means of support. This, in turn, will be reflected in a better education and employment for her youngsters with respect to the struggle for improved quality of life and betterment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her sales stand.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Julio aperturo un restaurant hace varios años, aunque el restaurant no estaba situado en un local céntrico, pudo adquirir algunas ganancias que le permitan mantenerse. Bárbara se desempeña en  el rubro D. las confecciones D. todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir, lo hace en el puesto D. venta D. su compañera, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos por lo cual desea mejorar su situación económica, a ella le gustaría aperturar un taller para obtener mejores ganancias.
El grupo se muestra puntual y responsable en el crédito obtenido por su compañerismo y esfuerzo. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Julio opened a restaurant several years ago. Although it wasn’t located in central spot, he managed to earn enough money to support himself. Barbara makes all kinds of clothing which she sells from her friend’s stall. She is married and has three children. Because of them she wishes to better her financial situation by opening a workshop and earning more money. The group is punctual and responsible with repayments of the loan which they obtained through comradeship and effort. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou K. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15ANS1 depuis le 19 juillet 2002, elle a une expérience de 7 ans et demi dans ledit Banc Villageois et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle achète des tissus teintés dans d'autres régions pour revendre dans sa ville (Vélingara). Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter sa production afin de faire plus de bénéfices et participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille, par exemple la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité. Elle a aussi comme objectif de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Astou K. is a 53-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15 ANS1 since July 19, 2002.  She has 7½ years of experience with the aforementioned Banc Villageois and has received from it fifteen loans, which she always managed and repaid on time.   Astou purchases dyed fabrics in other regions in order to resell them in her town (Vélingara).  With her new loans, she is going to increase her production in order to make more profit and to help provide for her family in terms of, as examples, health care, food, and schooling.  She also has the goal of boosting her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her revenue-generating business
